heading: A/L students assault teacher
description:
A teacher of a leader school in Anamaduwa has been admitted to Anamaduwa District Hospital after he was assaulted by the A/L students of the school.
The students have assaulted the teacher after he had punished a student while teaching at a classroom.
However, 2 students have also admitted to hospital alleging that they were assaulted by the teacher.

heading: Former chief of staff of President & STC chairman further remanded
description:
Former Presidential Chief of staff I.K. Mahanama and former chairman of State Timber Corporation P. Dissanayake further remanded until 26th of June.
 
They are in remand custody after they were apprehended by the investigators of Bribery Commission for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 20 million from an Indian businessman.

heading: IP Neomal and Lamahewa further remanded
description:
IP Neomal Rangajeewa and suspended Prisons Commissioner Emil Ranjan Lamahewa have been further remanded till 3rd of July.
They were remanded after being produced before Colombo Additional Magistrate today (Jun 19).
 
They are in remand custody over Welikada Prison riots which saw 27 prison inmates were killed.

heading: Film Corporation takes over distribution of films
description: Chairman of National Film Corporation says that the distribution of films which was handled by four private sector companies will be vested with the National Film Corporation.

heading: Medical practitioners await a decision on Influenza injection
description:
The Ministry of Health says that the recommendation to be given by the special committee appointed to advise on the injection to be administered to control the Influenza virus is yet to be released.
 
The Secretary to the Ministry of Health, Janaka Sugathadasa said that as a consequence there has been a delay in making an injection available to government hospitals.
 
To date, 25 deaths have been reported due to the spread of influenza in the Southern Province, 18 of those victims were children.
 
Most recently a 4-month-old baby died of the virus at Karapitiya Teaching Hospital last Sunday.
 
Meanwhile, Southern Health Director, Dr. G. Wijesuriya said that on a daily basis approximately 60 patients are seeking treatment from government hospitals for the disease.
 
Additionally, according to Sabaragamuwa Provincial Health Director, Dr. Athula Kannangara on a daily basis, approximately 10 patients seek treatment from government hospitals in the province.

heading: Anti-SAITM march blocks roads
description: An anti-SAITM march organized by the Inter-University Student's Federation has created a traffic congestion in Rajagiriya.

heading: Appeal of Gnanasara Thera postponed
description:
The hearing of the appeal filed by jailed General Secretary of Bodu Bala Sena, Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera was postponed to 22nd of this month.
 
Our correspondent said that when the appeal was taken up at the Homagama High Court, the judge decided to postpone it due to the non-attendance of representatives from the Attorney General's Department.
 
Meanwhile, a group of Buddhist monks from several organizations commenced an agitation campaign in front of the Pettah Bo tree, against the jailing of Gnanasara Thera.

heading: A group of postal workers returns to work, police protection given
description:
The Postmaster General Rohana Abeyrathna says that all post offices in the country were opened today (Jun 19) and most of the workers reported to duty.
 
He further said that police protection has been provided for those workers.
 
However, Chinthaka Bandara, the convener of the Joint Postal Trade Union Front, said that the strike will continue on today, making it 9 days since the launch.
 
Meanwhile, over 500,000 pieces of mail have been accumulating at post offices including the Central Mail Exchange in Colombo, as delivery of mail has been suspended during the strike.
 
Trade unions stated that over 150 million rupees in revenue per day, was lost by the Department due to the strike.

heading: Mother & daughter, unable to pay hospital bill stranded in Chennai
description:
A mother and her daughter who have unable to settle the hospital bill following the daughter was undergone surgery are stranded at a private hospital in Chennai.
 
The mother told us that the hospital authorities before the surgery said that the estimated the cost of the operation would be 750,000 rupees.
 
However, after the surgery was done, the hospital has issued a bill of Rs. 900,000.
 
The 45-year-old mother and her 15-year-old daughter are residents of Parasangaswewa in Anuradhapura.

heading: Inter-University Students' march comes under teargas attack
description:
Police fired teargas and water cannon to disperse an anti-SAITM march organized by the Inter-University Students' Federation at the Parliament round-about.
 
Police said a traffic congestion has been created in and around Rajagiriya as a result of this action.
 
The undergraduates are demanding to abolish the SAITM.

heading: SDIG Nanayakkara further remanded
description:
Mount Lavinia Magistrate today (Jun 10) ordered to re-remanded former Mount Lavinia Crimes OIC Tissa Sugathapala and former Senior DIG Prasanna Nanayakkara till 3rd of July.
 
They are in remand in connection with the killing of Sunday Leader former editor-in-chief Lasantha Wickramatunga.
 
They are accused of concealing of evidence.
 
The case was taken up before Mount Lavinia Chief Magistrate Mohammed Mihail.
 
The court also gave permission to the Criminal Investigation Department to record a statement from the SDIG inside the prison.
 
The CID also informed the court that they will record a statement from former IGP Jayantha Wickramaratne on 22nd of this month, relating to this incident.

heading: Met Department issues strong winds advisory
description:
Met Department says that strong gusty winds up to 60-70kmph are likely over Northern sea areas and in Gulf of Mannar from today (Jun 19).
 
Wind speed can be increased up to 60-70 kmph at times in the sea areas extending from Puttalam to Kankesanturai via Mannar and the sea areas extending from Puttalam to Mannar can be rough or very rough at times.
 
The sea areas extending from Hambantota to Pottuvil can be rough at times as the wind speed can increase up to 60 kmph at times.
 
Other sea areas can be fairly rough at times as the wind speed can increase up to 50 kmph at times.
 
Naval and fishing communities are requested to be vigilant.

The sea areas extending from Hambantota to Pottuvil can be rough at times as the wind speed can increase up to 60 kmph at times.
 
Other sea areas can be fairly rough at times as the wind speed can increase up to 50 kmph at times.
 
Naval and fishing communities are requested to be vigilant.

heading: VAT on doctors' consultation fee, channeling fee and professional charges removed
description:
Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera says that the Cabinet decided to remove 15% VAT on doctors' consultation fee, channeling fee and professional charges from 1
 of July.

heading: New petrol variety to enter market
description:
The Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development says a new variety of petrol will be introduced to the market to be used for motorcycles and three-wheelers.
 
Minister Arjuna Ranatunga said required testing is being done these days.
 
He said that the new petrol variety will transfer an economic benefit to the users.

heading: Oman suspends sending mail to Sri Lanka
description:
Oman Post has announced that it will temporarily stop receiving any mail to be sent to Sri Lanka, "due to unforeseen circumstances".
 
In a statement online, the postal agency said, "We would like to inform you that Oman Post will stop accepting P.O. mail to Sri Lanka, Colombo due to unforeseen circumstances until further notice."
 
An official from Oman Post told Times of Oman that the decision came from the Sri Lankan authorities: "We received an email that Sri Lanka Post will not be accepting any international mail until further notice."
(Times of Oman)

heading: Two women hacked to death in Welipillewa
description:
Police have found the bodies of 2 women, who were hacked to death in Waga in Wlipillewa, Hanwella.
Police were tipped-off on these deaths.
The mother was aged 68 and her daughter was aged 38.
Police suspect that the husband of the second woman might have committed the murders last night.
When police reach the house, they found the 4-month-old daughter of her and she was hospitalized by the police.
Hanwella police are probing the incident.

heading: Date fixed to hear Gotabhaya's appeal petition
description:
Court of Appeal today (Jun 19) fixed the dates to hear an appeal petition filed by 8 accused including former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa to acquit them from the Avant-Garde court case.
 
State Counsel representing the Attorney General's Department requested the court to fix a date to consider the petition.
 
Accordingly, justices Achala Singappuli and Arjun Obeysekera ordered to call the case again on 2nd of next month.
 
This case has been filed accusing them of incurring a loss of Rs. 11,400 million to the state by allowing to operate a floating armoury to Avant-Garde.

heading: 2 more suspects including a woman arrested over Kirivehera shooting
description: Police Spokesperson says 2 more suspects including a woman have been arrested for aiding and conspiring shooting of the chief incumbent of the Kirivehera in Kataragama.

heading: 25,000 families in Monaragala without toilets
description:
It is reported that 25,000 families in Monaragala district are without toilets.
 
This was revealed during an event to coincide with the "Gamperaliya Programme", which was held at the Monaragala District Secretariat under the patronage of Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera.
 
The Minister promised to allocate funds to address the issue.

heading: Norway to help Sri Lanka map marine resources
description:
The Norwegian research vessel Dr. Fridtjof Nansen will arrive in Sri Lanka on Thursday for a 26-day research journey around the island.
 
The research vessel will assist Sri Lanka in mapping the country’s marine resources.
 
Meanwhile, the State Minister of the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Jens Frølich Holte will arrive also in Sri Lanka tomorrow, the Norwegian Embassy in Colombo said.
 
The State Minister’s visit coincides with the arrival of the research ship.
 
The State Minister will also meet senior politicians, ministers and members of civil society in Sri Lanka.
 
The State Minister will also pay a short visit to Jaffna, where he will learn more about the outcomes of the long-term Norwegian support to livelihood activities in the resettled areas.

heading: Gnanasara Thera's appeal to be heard today
description:
Minister of Buddha Sasana, Gamini Jayawickreme Perera says that he hopes to meet the President today (Jun 19) to discuss the imprisonment of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.
Meanwhile, the appeal filed by Bodu Bala Sena General Secretary, requesting his release is scheduled to be heard before Homagama High Court today.
The attorneys handed the petition to Homagama Magistrate court on 15th of this month.
Sinhala Ravaya General Secretary Venerable Maagalkandey Sudatta Thera said that he felt strongly that the Ven. Gnanasara will get bail soon.

heading: Buddhika Pathirana sworn in as a Deputy Minister
description:
Matara district United National Party MP Buddhika Pathirana was sworn in as the Deputy Minister of Industry and Commerce today (Jun 19).
He was sworn in before President Maithripala Sirisena.

heading: Striking postal workers urged to report to work
description:
The Postmaster General Rohana Abeyratne says that employees of the Postal Department who fail to report to work today (Jun 19) will be considered as having vacated their posts.
 
Issuing a communiqué, the Postmaster General said that holiday leave for employees had been cancelled.
 
He said that it is the responsibility of the Staff Officers for providing facilities and security, to open and operate the post offices.
 
Police assistance will also be made available.
 
The Postmaster General also stressed that the administration is no longer accountable for the security of temporary staff, casual, substitutes, acting and permanent workers who do not return to work today.
 
The strike action launched by the Joint Postal Trade Union Front in protest against the recruitment process has entered into its second week.

heading: Panadura, Moratuwa private buses strike
Father goes to court against Health Ministry
description:
A father, whose' child has passed away due to influenza is planning to file a case against the Ministry of Health.
He charged that the child died as a result of doctors' carelessness.
The victim, a 6-year-old boy, was a student of Seevali Model School in Matara.
Sudhila Vidhuravi Edirisinghe was first admitted to Matara Hospital and then transferred to Karapitiya Teaching Hospital as his condition was worsened.
Later he was transferred to Ridgeway Hospital in Borella where he had died.
The boy's father said that the doctors had told that the child died after a drug was contaminated.

heading: Supreme Court orders AG to draft charges against Ranjan Ramanayake
description:
The Supreme Court ordered the Attorney General to file a draft charge sheet before June 30th, against deputy minister Ranjan Ramanayake for being in contempt of court.
The case was taken before Chief Justice Priyasath Dep and Justice Murdu Fernando this morning.
Additional Solicitor General Priyantha Navaana who made submissions before Court on behalf of the Attorney General said that all Supreme Court judges  have already observed that deputy minister Ranjan Ramanayake’s statement was, at a glance, in contempt of court
The bench of Supreme Court judges including the chief justice ordered the Attorney General to draft a rule document before June 30th asking Ranjan Ramanayake to show cause as to why he was not punished after being in contempt of court.
After a meeting with the Prime Minister on August 21st last year, deputy minister, Ranjan Ramanayake said, to media, that the majority of judges and attorneys-at-law are corrupt.
Later, MaagalKande Sudaththa Thera and a retired air force officer, Sunil Perera filed a petition against the deputy minister with the Supreme Court.

heading: Ivor Dennis passes away
Two killed in Kandana train accident
description:
Two persons, a motorcyclist and a pillion rider were killed when their motorcycle collided with a goods train in Peralanda, Kandana last afternoon.
It was reported that the motorcycle had entered the level crossing disregarding the signals.
The deceased were residents of Kelaniya.

heading: Mahesh Nissanka granted baill (Photos)
SriLankan Airlines makes a request
description:
SriLankan Airlines says since the planned renovation activities of the Bandaranaike International Airport will be delayed, there is no need for the outbound passengers to come 4 hours early to their departure time.
 
Yesterday, the airline requested the passengers to arrive early to minimize congestion at the departure counters.

heading: Monks engage in satyagraha over imprisonment of Gnanasara Thera
description:
Several groups of monks affiliated with different organizations staged a sit-in protest against the imprisonment of Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera, in front of the Bodhi Tree at Colombo Pettah this afternoon (Jun 18).
 
Meanwhile, another group of monks from Sinhala Ravaya were not allowed to meet the jailed monk by Welikada prison officials today.
At the same time, Pavidi Handa also convened a media conference to express their views on the imprisonment of Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.
Meanwhile, the National Intellectual Sangha Council issuing a media communique pointed out that President Maithripala Sirisena should intervene to give a general amnesty to the jailed monk.

heading: New Deputy Ministers meet Maha Nayaka Thera's
description:
Newly appointed Deputy Minister of Law and Order Nalin Bandara says the United National Party candidate will contest the next Presidential Election under a common alliance.
The Deputy Ministers, Ajith Mannapperuma, Lucky Jayawardene, Nalin Bandara and Edward Gunasekera paid a courtesy call on the chief prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiri chapters yesterday and Bandara spoke to the media following that.

heading: MR to take over SLPP leadership
description:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa will take over the leadership of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna at the second annual convention of the party to be held in November, this year.
 
MP Rohitha Abeygunawardene disclosed this addressing the media at Battaramulla today (Jun 18).

heading: SLHRC probes Jaffna police shooting
description:
The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka has initiated a special investigation into the death of a person during a clash between two groups at Mallakam in Jaffna, last night.
It is reported that several SLHRC officials attached to the Jaffna office inspected the clash site and recorded statements from several factions.
The police firing took place after two officers of Chunnakam police on road patrolling had intervened to settle the clash between the two groups.
Police said that they opened fire after a member of one of the groups attacked them with a sharp object.

heading: Two other suspects remanded over Kirivehera shooting
description:
The two suspects who were arrested in Kataragama yesterday over the Kirivehera shooting incident were remanded until 20th of this month today (Jun 18).
 
They were remanded when they were produced before Tissamaharama Magistrate.
 
With this altogether 5 suspects are in remand custody.

heading: MR says Udayanga Weeratunga will return
description:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that former ambassador to Russia, Udayanga Weeratunga will return to the island soon following requests made by him and several others.
He revealed this responding to questions posed by journalists in Anuradhapura today.

heading: STF launch island-wide raids to arrest underworld members
description:
The Police Special Task Force has commenced a special operation to apprehend underworld members who have left Colombo to other areas.
Previously, operations were carried out in Western and Southern provinces to arrest underworld members whereas, from today, it is reported that STF officers will be deployed for operations covering the whole island.

heading: Warning to striking postal workers
description:
Post-Master General says the postal workers who do not report to work will be considered as vacated their posts.
The postal workers are engaging in a strike for almost a week now.

heading: Police misfire injures suspected drug smuggler
VAT charged from private hospitals to be removed
description:
Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera says that the Value Added Tax imposed on private hospitals will be removed next week.
The Minister said it will be done as a part of extending concessions to the public.
Minister Mangala said this addressing an event in Matara which was held to distribute compensation to the people who were affected by floods in 2017.

heading: Kelaniya undergraduate electrocuted
description:
A 3rd year undergraduate at the Kelaniya University has died of electrocution.
He was electrocuted when he attempted to pluck fruits using an iron bar inside the university premises.
The victim was aged 23 years.

heading: Heads of State Institutions should be responsible for paying salaries to excess employees, says Finance Ministry
description: However, the Director General of the Management Service Department further said that it was observed during staff review meetings that development officers attached to certain institutions are not assigned on a particular subject or are not given a specific job of work.

heading: Two Youths steal Rs. 8 million from ATMs
description:
Police have arrested 2 youths from Negombo for fraudulently drawing Rs. 8 million from ATM machines.
They had stolen money from ATMs in Negombo and Ja Ela and police arrested them following a thorough investigation.
They were arrested in Kurana last evening, and police recovered Rs. 2.8 million from them.
A motorbike, purchased by the 26-year-old youths, using the stolen money was seized.

heading: A statement from prison on Ven. Gnanasara
description:
Prisons Media Spokesperson, Thushara Upuldeniya says that Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera has been provided with the clothing normally given to prisoners.
He said this addressing a media briefing in Colombo today (Jun 16).
However, Chief Incumbent of Pepiliyana Sunethra Devi Pirivena, Professor Medagoda Abayathissa Thera convening a media briefing in Colombo noted that Gnanasara Thera is facing a risk of losing his ordainment.
Meanwhile, the Bodu Bala Sena and Sinhala Ravaya made a plea to gods at the Seenigama Devala against the imprisonment of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasaara Thera.

heading: Former Minister talks about a misery
description:
Former Minister and Senior Vice Chairman of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party says that it is unfortunate that other members of the SLFP are still stuck with the government.
The former Minister said that addressing a seminar titled, "Nidahase Vedikawa", which was organized by the Group of 16 in Matale.
Addressing the seminar, MP Sudharshini Fernandopulle said without accepting those who are willing to join the opposition, the United National Party could not be expelled.

heading: Elle Gunawansa Thera says "Election is needed"
description:
Ven. Elle Gunawansa Thera says it is highly important to call for an election soon.
The Thera said this addressing the Colombo District Conference of the Sri Lanka Mahajana Party held at the New Town Hall yesterday.
Former Minister Basil Rajapaksa and MP Udaya Gammanpila also attended this event.

heading: Operation to capture Sinharaja elephants stopped
description: Deputy Minister Palitha Thewarapperuma says that the operation to capture 2 elephants in Sinharaja has been suspended following the orders of the President.

heading: Main suspect and twins involved in Kirivehera shooting arrested
description:
The main suspect along with twins involved in the shooting of chief incumbent of Katharagama Kiri Wehera, Venerable Kobowaka Dhamminda Thera have been arrested in Pepiliyana.
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekara stated that the suspects were arrested by a group of Officers attached to the Tangalle Crimes Division.
The chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Venerable Kobowaka Dhamminda Thera continues to receive treatment at a private hospital in Colombo.
Three armed persons carried out the shooting on 12th night where the chief incumbent sustained injuries to the arm and abdomen.
Another monk who sustained injuries was admitted to Hambantota General Hospital and was later discharged.

heading: Postal strike causes a daily loss of Rs. 150mn
description:
Post-Master General Rohana Abeyrathna says that due to the trade union action of postal employees, the department suffers a loss of around 150 million rupees daily.
He further said that they hope to have a discussion with the trade unions tomorrow.
However, the Convenor of the Joint Postal Trade Unions Front said that no positive response has been received for their demands.

heading: Sri Lanka obtains loans worth over Rs. 1029 billion from China
description:
It has been revealed that Sri Lanka has obtained $ 8.2 billion or Rs. billion from China as loans for the last 12 years.
Those loans have been obtained from China Development Bank and China EXIM Bank for large-scale projects.
Hambantota Port : Rs. 188bn
Norochcholai Coal Plant : Rs. 72bn
Southern Expressway Extention (Matara - Beliatte) : Rs. 300bn
These details were revealed by the Finance Ministry following a request made through the Right to Information Act.

heading: Rs. 3 million contract to shoot Kirivehera chief incumbent
description:
Investigations reveal that the caretaker of Mahasen Devala Bopegedera Asela Lakshman Bandara has given a Rs. 3 million contract to shoot at the chief incumbent of Kirivehera Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera.
Police Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said it will be further probed based on the bank details of the suspects who are in police custody.
Already 5 suspects along with 2 firearms are in police custody over the incident.
2 suspects were arrested in Kataragama today and the main suspect was arrested along with 2 other suspects in Pepiliyana yesterday.

heading: Former President reveals a new betrayal by government
description:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the government has produced a draft bill in parliament to amend the Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters Act No. 25 of 2002.
 
The former President in his communiqué further emphasizes that the structure of the initial act will change significantly with many clauses being changed through the new draft bill.
The prevailing law is only applicable to nations while the amendment will facilitate the infiltration of organizations such as the International Criminal Court.
The former President highlights that the proposed amendment is coupled with the Office on Missing Persons Act which was previously introduced by the present government and the Act which was brought forward to enforce the International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance, in Sri Lanka.
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in his communiqué further notes that the draft bill will facilitate the implementation of the provisions in the International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance Act No 5 of 2018.
A mechanism should be in place to obtain evidence from Sri Lanka for a case that is being heard in another country regarding crimes that are said to have taken place in Sri Lanka.
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in his communiqué thus stresses that the objective of the proposed amendments to the Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters Act of 2002 is in fact, to pave way for such a mechanism.
Meanwhile, the former president stated that the general public will respond in the near future to the suppressive programme adopted by the government to imprison leaders in the opposition.
The former president made this comment addressing a ceremony at the Jumma Mosque in Mukarawewa – Horowpathaana this morning.

heading: Police fire kills one person in Jaffna
description:
One person was killed and 2 policemen were injured when police attempted to control a clash between 2 groups in Tellippalai in Jaffna.
It was revealed that police had opened fire when the people attempted to attack the police team,

heading: Clandestine affair ends in tragedy
description:
A 28-year-old woman and a 54-year-old man have committed suicide by jumping in front of a moving train in Hadiwatte in Habaraduwa.
 
They had ended their life by jumping before the Matara bound Ruhunu Kumari train last evening (Jun 14).
 
The woman, a mother of one child was a resident of Habaraduwa while the man was a resident of Ahangama.
 
He was a father of two.
 
According to information, the woman, a garment employee was having a clandestine affair with the man who was a three-wheel driver.
 
The reason for their tragic decision is yet unknown.
 
Habaraduwa Police investigate the incident.

heading: Important message for airport passengers
description:
SriLankan Airlines urges the passengers to arrive at the airport four hours prior to their departure time effective from tomorrow (Jun 18).
The airline said this is mainly due to a series of renovation work expected to commence shortly at the emigration counter areas at the departure terminal of the BIA.
For more information, the passengers are urged to check www.srilankan.com or call center 1979 from any telecommunication provider.

heading: Deputy Minister at FCID
description:
Deputy Minister Nalin Bandara has arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division to give a statement on an alleged financial fraud taken place at the Ceylon Shipping Corporation during the previous regime.




The Deputy Minister had made the complaint to the FCID on this alleged financial misappropriation in July 2016.

heading: Gnanasara Thera's lawyers submit appeal
description:
The lawyers of Venerable Galagoda Atte Gnanasara Thera have filed an appeal to be forwarded to High Court requesting the Thera to be acquitted and released.
 
The General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena was sentenced yesterday (Jun 14) for threatening the wife of missing journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandhya Eknaligoda at the Homagama Court premises on 25th of January in 2016.
 
The Thera was sentenced to a one-year rigorous imprisonment, to be ended in 6 months.
 
The Homagama Magistrate also imposed a fine of Rs. 3,000 on the Thera and also ordered to pay Rs. 50,000 to the aggrieved party.
Meanwhile, the Sihala Ravaya has made a request from President Maithripala Sirisena to extend the general pardon to Galagoda Atte Gnanasara Thera.

heading: Suspect in murder of Karandeniya Vice Chairman arrested
description:
Police have arrested a suspect, an accomplice of Kosgoda Sujee, in the recent murder of Vice Chairman of the Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha, Donald Sampath.
 
Police said he was the main suspect in the shooting.
 
The suspect was arrested in Weragoda in Kahawa by the officers of Uragasmangandiya Police.

heading: Former President’s message to SLFP
description:
Former President, Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the Sri Lanka Freedom Party should take an urgent decision to quit the current government.
 
Addressing the media in Kandy, he said that discussions between the two factions could be held thereafter.
 
Meanwhile, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna member and former Minister, Basil Rajapaksa said that he is committed to pressurize the government to hold provincial council election.

heading: Main suspect in Kirivehera shooting still hiding
description:
The chief incumbent of the Kataragama Kirivehera, Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera is now recovering at a private hospital in Colombo.
 
The Thera was airlifted to Colombo for further treatment.
 
Meanwhile, police have widened the search operation to apprehend the main suspect in the shooting which occurred on Monday.
 
The main suspect has been identified as the former caretaker of Mahasen Devalaya, Bopegedara Asela Lakshman Bandara.
 
Meanwhile, a resolution demanding security forces should intervene to provide sufficient security for all temples throughout the country is scheduled to be passed in the Kataragama Sasanarakshaka Bala Mandalaya meeting this afternoon.
 
Meanwhile, the registrar of the organization, Ven. Kapugama Saranatissa Thera told us that they condemn the gun attack on the Kirivehera chief incumbent.

heading: Strong winds and showers predicted
description:
Met Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and Galle and Matara districts, particularly in the morning.
 
Fairly heavy falls about 50mm can be expected at some places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, and North-Western provinces.
 
Showers or thundershowers may occur at few places in the Batticaloa and Ampara districts after 2 pm.
 
Fairly strong gusty winds up to 40-50 kmph can be expected in North-Central province and in Monaragala, Jaffna, Mannar and Hambantota districts.

heading: Requests galore seeking Ven. Gnanasara's release
description:
Minister of Justice and Prison Reforms, Thalatha Athukorala stated that the General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena, Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera will have to comply with the Prisons Ordinance.
Meanwhile, when we inquired from the Prisons Media Spokesperson, Thushara Upuldeniya regarding the recent reports that Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera is suffering from abdominal pain, he stated that such a condition was not diagnosed when the Thera underwent a medical examination.
Meanwhile, several factions made requests today as well to release Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasaara Thera.
The Sinhala Ravaya Organization and the Bodu Bala Sena visited the chief prelate of the Ramagngna Chapter, Most Venerable Napane Pemasiri Thera and the Registrar of Asigiri Chapter, Venerable Medagama Dhammananda Thera to inform them about the imprisonment of Venerable Gnanasara Thera.
Furthermore, they also paid a courtesy call on the Anu Nayake Thera of Malwathu Chapter, Most Venerable Dimbulkumbure Sri Wimaladhamma Thera.
Further, the Sri Rohana Maha Sanga Sabha of the Syamopalika Wanshika Maha Nikaya wrote to the President today requesting the release of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.
An Adishtana Pooja was also held yesterday in Mahiyangana town against the imprisonment of Ven. Gnanasara Thera.
Subsequent to the Adishtana Pooja, a plea to gods was also made at the Mahiyangana Sri Sumana Saman Devala.

heading: Samurdhi officer remanded for obtaining a bribe
description:
The officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption have arrested a Samurdhi officer for soliciting a bribe of Rs. 2,000.
 
He was from Kolonna, Ratnapura.
 
The suspect had demanded the bribe from a Samurdhi recipient, to help him to obtain a loan of Rs. 100,000 from Samudhi Bank.
 
The suspect had first collected Rs. 10,000 and he was arrested yesterday (Jun 14) while collecting Rs. 2,000.
 
He was remanded until 20th of this month after he was produced before Embilipitiya Magistrate.

heading: Gnanasara Thera refuses to meet certain visitors
description:
The Bodu Bala Sena General Secretary, Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera has filed an appeal requesting to annul his rigorous imprisonment and acquit him from all charges.
His lawyers stated that the appeal was handed over to Homagama Magistrate Court to be forwarded to Homagama High Court.
The Thera was sentenced to 6 months rigorous imprisonment yesterday for threatening the wife of a missing journalist, Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandhya Eknaligoda.
Meanwhile, Prison Media Spokesperson, Thushara Upuldeniya said that Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera rejected to see some of his visitors to Welikada prison today (Jun 15).
Among them were Iththekande Saddhathissa Thera, MPs Dayasiri Jayasekera, and Jayantha Samaraweera.

heading: President stops operation to capture Sinharaja elephants
description:
The operation which was launched this morning (Jun 15) to capture the two wild elephants in Sinharaja forest was suspended as the two air force veterinarians were recalled.
Wildlife Minister, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka said that the two veterinarians were recalled by the President.
Several environment activists earlier disclosed the move by the Wildlife Department to relocate the two elephants from Sinharaja to an elephant detention camp in Horowpatana, will not augur well for those animals.
Later, the President advised Environment Ministry Secretary and Director General of the Wildlife Department to leave the two elephants further in the forest until a proper mechanism is arranged to relocate them.
However, Minister Fonseka while inspecting a house destroyed by wild elephants in Galgamuwa said that the President gave the approval to relocate the two elephants to Horowpatana.
Later, the Minister who inspected a cultivation destroyed by wild elephants in Wetakoluwagama in Galgamuwa said that the operation to capture the two elephants in Sinharaja was suspended after the President had recalled the two air force veterinarians.

heading: Two students drown in sea
description:
A search operation is underway after 2 schoolboys were reported missing while they were bathing in the sea in Porathota, Ettukala in Kochchikade.
 
The students were from a school in Kochchikade.
 
It was reported that 5 grade 11 students had gone to the beach at around 11.30 am and 4 of them had ventured into the sea to have a bath.
 
They had drowned and the onlookers were able to rescue 2 of them and admit them to Negombo General Hospital.
 
The other 2 are still missing.

heading: More letters and parcels piling up, strike continues
description:
The Joint Postal Trade Union Front says that they would be continuing their strike until they get a proper response from the authorities.
The Convenor of the Front Chinthaka Bandara said that no discussion had been offered by authorities to resolve the matter.
The postal workers began this strike on 11th of this month.

heading: Kirivehera Thera shot at while having police protection ?
description:
Police Media spokesman, SP, Ruwan Gunesekera said that investigations have been initiated to ascertain how Kirivehera Chief incumbent Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera was shot at while he was under police protection.
Addressing a media conference held in Colombo, SP Gunasekera further said a separate investigation will be carried out on that.
Meanwhile, hospital sources stated that the chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Ven. Dhamminda Thera is recovering from gunshot injuries.

heading: Muslims of Sri Lanka to celebrate Ramazan tomorrow
Woman drowns in Welikanda (Photos)
description:
A 38-year-old had died in Welikanda, Polonnaruwa, after drowning in a canal this morning (Jun 16).
The victim was W. A. Nalika.
She had left the home this morning to have a bath in a canal, which was nearby her house.
However, she had drowned in it.
The inquest has revealed that the reason for her death was drowning.

heading: President says Ramazan carries a message of peace
description:
Muslims in Sri Lanka would celebrate Ramazan festival today (Jun 16) as the new moon has been sighted.
Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena in a message issued in view of Ramazan said that the salvation and betterment of the human being could only be attained in an environment of good thoughts where moral values are strengthened.
He added, "It is the noble message of giving priority for peace conveyed to humanity by Islam devotees when they celebrate Ramazan after observing fast for a month, and making sacrifices".
Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in his Ramazan message said that this is an important religious festival celebrated by Muslims across the globe to mark equality, purity, and devotion.
This period of fasting functions as a means of reassessment for Muslims, as they strive to lead a life of cooperation and compassion with spiritual purity, the PM said.

heading: Deputy principal arrested for trying to molest schoolgirls
“Kirivehera Thera is recovering” – hospital sources
description:
The hospital sources say that the chief incumbent of Kirivehera Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera who was admitted to a private hospital in Colombo with gunshot injuries is now recovering.
 
A hospital spokesperson said that necessary treatments have already been given to the injured Thera.
 
The Thera had received gunshots in his abdomen and a hand.
 
Police have identified the main suspect connected to the shooting as a former custodian of the Mahasen Devalaya, Bopegedara Asela Lakshman Bandara.
 
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera noted that the suspect had fled the area.
 
The Special Task Force has recovered a sword, 2 daggers and 10 live bullets from the suspect’s residence.
 
The Ven. Dhamminda Thera and the resident monk Ven. Veedapola Sobhitha Thera were shot at while coming down from the upper compound to the lower compound of the Kirivehera, last Tuesday night.
 
Three unidentified individuals had fled in a red jeep parked near the Kirivehera, following the shooting.
 
The red colour jeep, with the registration number UP CAG 8531 which was parked in Gaminipura at the main suspect’s residence was found last evening.
 
Police said that the 2 other accomplices have also identified and the probe is underway to arrest the suspects.

heading: Update: Heavy traffic in Town Hall
description:
Heavy traffic in and around Town Hall area due to the protest march by the students of Higher National Diploma.
Updated:
...........................................
Heavy traffic in Maradana
Heavy traffic is reported in and around Maradana area due to a student protest march.

heading: New Deputy Ministers assume duties
description:
Newly appointed Deputy Ministers Nalin Bandara and Ajith Mannapperuma assumed office today (Jun 14).
 
President Maithripala Sirisena also attended the occasion.

heading: Former President says 'police inactive'
description:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says the country's law and order dwindled due to the inactiveness of police.
 
He said this in response to the questions posed by the journalists following a religious event in Mattegoda, Polgasowita today (Jun 14).

heading: Deputy Minister Masthan meets President’s Secretary
description:
A special meeting was held between Deputy Minister K. Kader Masthan and secretary to the President at the Presidential Secretariat this afternoon (Jun 14).
 
It is reported that the meeting is focused on removing the subject of Hindu Religious Affairs from his purview.
 
Masthan was recently sworn in as the Deputy Minister of Resettlement, Rehabilitation, North Development and Hindu Religious Affairs.
 
Several factions raised objections for giving Hindu Religious Affairs to the Vanni district SLFP MP.
 
UNP MP Wadiwel Suresh, Northern Provincial Councilor, M. K. Sivajilingam and TELO and PLOTE organizations objected to the appointment.
 
Minister Mano Ganeshan also said that he drew the attention of the President to the appointment.

heading: Stay order preventing action against GR extended
description: The Court of Appeal has extended stay order preventing action against former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa under the Public Property Act, till the petition is heard.

heading: Yashoda Range Bandara granted bail
description: State Minister Palitha Range Bandara's son Yashoda Range Bandara, who was remanded over an accident, has been granted bail by Chilaw Magistrate.

heading: Wild elephant electrocuted in Wellawaya (Photos)
description:
A wild elephant was electrocuted inside a private land in Neluwagala, Wellawaya, last night (Jun 13).
 
Our correspondent said that the elephant had got contacted with a live power line that connected to a water pump.
 
Investigations are underway to ascertain whether that the power line was laid purposely to harm the animals.
 
A wildlife official said that the wild elephant was aged around 25 to 30 years.
 
Our correspondent said that human-elephant conflict has affected the Wellawaya area and many cultivated lands have been destroyed by encroaching wild elephants.

heading: SLAS officers suspend strike
description:
The strike action launched by the Sri Lanka Administrative Service Union over a non-payment of a promised allowance has been suspended.
 
The decision was taken following a discussion with the State Minister of Public Administration.
 
The daily activities at the Department of Emigration and Immigration, Department of Registration of Persons and several other state entities were affected by the strike.

heading: Ven. Gnanasara sentenced to rigorous imprisonment
description:
The Thera was found guilty for threatening the wife of missing journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandhya Eknaligoda inside the Homagama Court premises.
 
Homagama Magistrate and Additional District Judge Udesh Ranatunga delivered the verdict.
 
The Thera was imposed a fine of Rs. 3,000 and also ordered the Thera to pay a compensation of Rs. 50,000 to Sandhya Eknaligoda.
The General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena, Ven. Galagodaatte Gnanasara Thera has been sentenced to 1-year rigorous imprisonment to be ended in 6 months by Homagama Magistrate court.

heading: Hindu Affairs removed from Deputy Minister Masthan's portfolio
description:
Minister D.M. Swaminathan says that Deputy Minister Kader Masthan's portfolios were gazetted without Hindu Affairs.
 
The Minister said that he discussed the matter with the President over the phone and then the President informed him about it.
 
Masthan was recently sworn in as the Deputy Minister of Resettlement, Rehabilitation, North Development and Hindu Religious Affairs.
 
Several factions raised objections for giving Hindu Religious Affairs to the Vanni district SLFP MP.

heading: Date of Ramazan celebration to be decided tomorrow
Relocation of Sinharaja elephants stopped (Photos)
description:
President advises officials to allow the two rare wild elephants to continue to remain at the Sinharaja forest reserve.




 
The officials were also instructed to speed up the construction of an elephant fence to avoid those elephants encroaching the nearby human habitat of the Sinharaja forest.
He told if it is to be done it should be done after obtaining the expert view of professionals who can conduct a scientific study.
The instructions were issued during a discussion with the officials of the Mahaweli Development and Environment today (Jun 14).

heading: Customs detect illegally imported reptiles
description:
Sri Lanka Customs officers at the Bandaranayake International Airport's Cargo Village detected 32 chameleons or lizards sent from Australia illegally.
 
The reptiles were concealed in a CPU in 4 bags.
 
The goods have been sent from Australia via Singapore to an address in Kalutara.
 
However, since no one came to clear the goods, the authorities have checked the address and it was found to be a fake one.
 
Then a decision was made to open the package.
 
The animal quarantine officer has recommended sending back the reptiles. 
 
Investigations are being carried out jointly by the Directorate of Revenue and Services Katunayake and Bio-Diversity Control Unit of Customs.

heading: Police allowed to question underworld figures arrested in Kadugannawa
description:
Court has given permission to question the 3 underworld figures linked to underworld kingpin Makandure Madush while keeping them in custody.
 
The Colombo Organized Crimes Investigation Unit will now be able to question the suspects further.
 
The suspects were arrested while hiding at a hotel in Kadugannawa yesterday (Jun 13).

heading: Special office to pay compensation for war-affected
description:
Cabinet has approved the establishment of a special office to pay compensation for conflict-affected people in North and East.
 
Joining the weekly Cabinet media briefing, Co-cabinet spokesperson Minister Gayantha Karunatillake said the relevant draft bill will be presented in Parliament soon.

heading: Swiss court refuses to sentence LTTE financiers
description:
13 Sri Lankan LTTE supporters charged with financing the terror outfit by extortion, fraud and other illegal means escaped jail terms when the Swiss Federal Criminal Court refused to sentence them yesterday. 
The Swiss Federal Criminal Court has given no prison terms to the 13 alleged LTTE financiers and they were either given suspended custodial sentences or acquitted. 
The court said accusations of participation in and supporting of a criminal organization did not stand and released all of the accused. 
The accused are from Switzerland, Germany, and Sri Lanka. 
Some are former members of the World Tamil Coordinating Committee, which represented the LTTE in Switzerland until 2009, and include its founder, his deputy and the person in charge of finances. 
In its judgment, the court noted that the hierarchical link between the LTTE and WTCC was not sufficiently established. 
The judges also felt there was not enough concrete proof to consider the LTTE as a criminal organization. 
While the federal prosecutor had asked for prison terms of between 18 months and six years for the accused, the court did not oblige. 
During her indictment, Juliette Noto, a federal prosecutor, described a sophisticated system used by the WTCC to raise funds largely from the Tamil community in Switzerland

heading: Three underworld figures arrested in Kadugannawa
Sarath N. Silva’s FR petition dismissed
description:
The Fundament Rights petition filed against Provincial Council Elections (Amendment) Act before Supreme Court by former Chief Justice Sarath N. Silva has been rejected.
 
It was dismissed by the majority of a 3-member bench, even without granting leave to proceed.
 
The bench comprised of Chief Justice Priyasath Dep, Justice Nalin Perera and Justice Buwaneka Aluwihare.












Former Chief Justice Sarath N. Silva filed his Fundamental Rights petition on 28th of September last year.
He requested the Supreme Court to issue a decree announcing the manner in which the Provincial Council Elections (Amendment) Act was passed in Parliament in last May, was illegitimate.
The petition by Sarath N. Silva noted that passing the draft bill by a two-thirds majority in Parliament without holding a referendum is contravened to the Constitution.
The Speaker, the Attorney General and the Chairman of the Election Commissioner were named as respondents in the petition.
Announcing the decree in open Court, Chief Justice, Priyasath Dep said that the petition is rejected without granting leave to proceed on the majority decision of the three-member bench of Judges.

heading: Chief incumbent of Kirivehera admitted to a private hospital
description:
The chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera who was airlifted from Hambantota Hospital has been admitted to a private hospital in Colombo.
 
The Thera had received gunshot in his abdomen and right hand, and the Director of Hambantota Hospital, Dr. Dhanushka Perera said that the Thera underwent a surgery at the hospital.
 
Ven. Dhamminda Thera and another resident monk Ven. Vidyapola Sobitha Thera were shot at last night by 3 suspects last night at the Kirivehera premises.
 
Later police found the jeep used by the assailants.
 
The investigators have also identified the gunmen.

heading: Amal Karunasekara further remanded
description:
Former military intelligence chief Major General (Retd.) Amal Karunasekara has been further remanded till 26th of June.
He was arrested over the abduction and assault on journalist Keith Noyahr.
The former Military officer was produced before Mount Lavinia Additional Magistrate Lochana Abeywickreme.

heading: Nepalese cyclist dies after falling into Mahaweli River
description:
A Nepal national had died after falling into Mahaweli River during a cycling competition.
 
He had fallen into the river while cycling on the causeway in Minipe.
 
Hasalaka Police said that the body was recovered this afternoon.

heading: Police probe suspicious death of a girl
description:
Police have commenced investigations into a death of a 21-year-old young girl, who had died under mysterious circumstances in Uragasmanhandiya in Elpitiya. 
The parents have looked out for the girl, who was employed at a nearby garment factory, after she failed to return home last evening (Jun 12). 
It was found that the girl had been admitted to Balapitiya Hospital, after an alleged accident. 
However, she had died in hospital. 
Police have also arrested a van driver, who had taken the girl to the hospital. 
It was found that the suspect has had an affair with the girl and police suspect that he may have a hand in the murder. 
The girl had stopped the affair after it was found that the man was a married person. 
However, the exact reason for the death is not clear and the postmortem will be held tomorrow.

heading: Postal trade unions vow to continue strike
description:
The Joint Postal Workers' Union says that they have decided to continue their strike as the authorities are reluctant to address their issues.
 
It is reported that more than 300,000 letters are to be distributed at the Central Mail Exchange.

heading: Wimal writes to President on Lt. Colonel Ratnapriya Bandu
description:
The leader of the National Freedom Front, MP Wimal Weerawansa requests to reassign Lt. Colonel Ratnapriya Bandu to the Vishwamadu area in order to give a new beginning to the national reconciliation.
 
In a letter addressed to President Maithripala Sirisena, Weerawansa pointed out that Vishwamadu residents were emotional to send off the military officer from the area as he done a yeoman service to them.
 
He urged the President if there are obstructions to cancel the transfer, to address it.
 
Lt. Colonel had served in the Vishwamadu area for around 6 years and he has been transferred to Ambepussa Sinha Regiment camp.
 
The farewell event became very emotional as some rehabilitated LTTE members and other villagers even cried on the occasion.

heading: Police identify main suspect in Kirivehera shooting
Fire in Passara kills 3 of same family
description:
Three women from the same family were killed in a fire that broke out in a shop in Passara, Mahiyanganaya early morning today (Jun 14).
 
Police said the victims were the mother (62 y), sister (23 y) and aunty (61 y) of the shop owner.
 
Investigations revealed that there was only one door for both entry and exit at the shop.

heading: Acid attack on Kegalle Co-operative Development Commissioner
description: The Kegalle Co-operative Development Commissioner, W. Karunatillake has been attacked with acid at his office.

heading: Two bodies washed ashore in Punkudithiv, Jaffna
description:
Kayts Police say that two bodies were found from the coast of Punkudithiv, Jaffna yesterday (Jun 13).
 
It is believed that the two men were fishermen from Mannar who were reported missing since last week.
 
The relatives had identified the bodies.

heading: Special "Balaya" programme today
description:
A special "Balaya" political discussion will be telecast by Hiru TV today (Jun 14) which will discuss the 20th amendment moved in Parliament by the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna.
The programme will be featured by JVP Propaganda Secretary MP Vijitha Herath and General Secretary of the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya, MP Udaya Gammanpila.
It will start at 10.30 pm.

heading: Ven. Gnanasara to be sentenced today
description:
The Homagama Magistrate will sentence the General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena, Ven. Galagodaatte Gnanasara Thera today.
 
He was found guilty of making death threats to the wife of missing journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandhya Eknaligoda inside the Homagama Magistrate Court.
 
The Thera was found guilty after a lengthy hearing and the Magistrate fixed the date of today (Jun 14) for sentencing.

heading: Showery condition to enhance
description:
The Met Department says that the showery condition in the South-Western part of the island is expected to slightly enhance.
 
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and Galle and Matara districts.
 
Fairly heavy falls about 50mm can be expected at some places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces.
 
Showers or thundershowers may occur at few places in the Batticaloa and Ampara districts after 2 pm.
 
Fairly strong gusty winds up to 40-50 kmph can be expected in North-Central province and in Puttalam, Matale, Monaragala and Hambantota districts.

heading: “Group of 16” says ‘they are even prepared to form a new party’
description:
Former Minister Susil Premajayantha says that the majority of the people wish to hand over the country again to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
 
The MP said this expressing his views to media at the Colombo High Court premises yesterday (Jun 13).
 
Meanwhile, some members of the “Group of 16” who left the Unity Government recently, held a discussion last afternoon.
 
The discussion was held at the residence of former Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala.
 
Responding to journalists following the meeting MP S. B. Dissanayake said they are even prepared to form a new party.

heading: National Economic Council convenes
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed the National Economic Council to take steps to protect the local entrepreneurs.
 
He gave this directive when the NEC met at the Presidential Secretariat last afternoon with President at the chair.
 
The President's Media Unit said that 6 issues encountered by the local business community were discussed here.
 
It was highlighted here as a result of the removal of CESS on imported ceramic sanitary ware, the local industrialists are facing the danger of extinction.
 
Then it was decided to impose an import duty which was similar to the CESS.
 
The President said that the state-owned banks should lend to the local industrialists for concessionary rates in order to improve the domestic manufacturing sector.

heading: Deputy Minister to appear at FCID
description:
Deputy Minister of Law and Order, Nalin Bandara who assumed duties yesterday (Jun 14) has been summoned to the Financial Crime Investigation Division.
 
That is to obtain a statement.
 
He is scheduled to arrive at the FCID to give a statement for a complaint lodged earlier.

heading: Losses mount, postal strike continues
description:
The Joint Postal Trade Union Front says that about 1,000 airmail sacks have piled up at the Bandaranaike International Airport in Katunayake as a result of the ongoing strike by the postal workers.
 
The Postal Department said they were earning Rs. 150 million to 180 million on a daily basis and added since the start of the strike that the Department has failed to earn any revenue.
 
The Postal Trade Unions Front launched this strike 5 days ago demanding to put in place a recruitment procedure specifically tailored for the Postal Department and to ensure job security of the Acting Assistant Post Masters.

heading: Postal strike continues
description:
The Joint Postal Workers' Union says that they have decided to continue their strike.
 
They said that the decision was taken as the authorities are not paying attention to address their issues.
 
It is reported that more than 1.3 million letters and parcels have piled up at the Central Mail Exchange and other post offices in the country.
 
The postal workers began their strike on 11th of this month.
 
Meanwhile, the members of Sri Lanka Administrative Services Union have taken sick leave as a mark of protest against government's failure to pay an agreed allowance to them.

heading: A mother and infant die in Nugawela accident
description:
Motorbike collides with bus”
A 24-year-old mother and her little daughter died when the motorcycle she was traveling on collided with a bus at Nugawela in Kandy at around 7.50 this morning.






Our correspondent said that their motorcycle had first collided with another motorcycle from behind throwing the victims to the other side of the road.
Then an oncoming private bus had run over them.
Police said that the husband was in a critical condition.
The small girl was 2 years and 3 months old.

heading: An accomplice of Wele Suda arrested with drugs and weapons
description:
Police Narcotic Bureau has arrested a close accomplice of jailed Wele Suda with 2kg of heroin in Maviththara, Piliyandala.
 
The estimated value of the narcotic haul was Rs. 25 million.
 
The find was made when the suspect's house was searched following a tip-off.
 
The PNB sleuths also found the locally made revolver, a repeater gun, and 16 live ammunition.
 
The 35-year-old suspect has been carried out drug trafficking for a long period of time, the probe revealed.

heading: Police child molester identified
description:
The police constable who had molested a 15-year-old boy inside the Welioya Police Station was identified by the boy during an identification parade.
 
The identification parade was held at the Kebitigollawa Magistrate Court yesterday (Jun 14).
 
Then the Magistrate ordered to extend the remand custody of the policeman until 23rd of this month.
 
It was revealed that the suspect was the telephone operator at the police station.
 
The victimized teenager was arrested by police for allegedly stealing corrugated iron sheets and he had been abused by the suspect on the night of 8th of May.

heading: Group of 16 SLFP’ers to support Flower Bud at future elections
description:
Senior Vice President of the SLFP Parliamentarian W. D. J. Senevirathna says that the 16 SLFP MP’s who left the government would contest future parliamentary elections under the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.
He stated that Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa had assured that they would be given nominations through the Flower Bud.
Meanwhile, the Policy Framework of the Group of 16 is to be unveiled at a seminar in Matale today.

heading: BBS to make a plea in Seenigama
description:
The Bodu Bala Sena is scheduled to make a plea to gods at the Seenigama Devala this evening over the imprisonment of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.
 
The General Secretary of Sinhala Ravaya, Venerable Magalkande Sudaththa Thera stated that laymen of Bodu Bala Sena have organized the plea to gods.
Meanwhile, Sinhala Ravaya Organization is scheduled to meet the chief prelates of Asgiri, Malwathu and Ramagngna chapters regarding the imprisonment of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.

heading: Journalist Mahesh Nissanka remanded
description:
Journalist Mahesh Nissanka, who was arrested by Kadawatha Police over an alleged assault has been remanded until tomorrow by Mahara Magistrate.
 
He is suspected of attacking a fitness center owner in Enderamulla, Wattala on Saturday night over a personal dispute.

heading: Traffic congestion in Town Hall
description:
Traffic congestion is reported from Town Hall area due to a protest by Inter University Students' Federation.
 
Police said that the road leading to the Ward Place is also closed.

heading: Rs. 1.75 million worth gold detected at BIA
description:
A 39-year-old resident of Kalmunai was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport while trying to smuggle in Rs. 1.75 million worth of gold biscuits into the country.
 
He had arrived from Qatar at around 2.45 am today (Jun 12).
 
The gold biscuits were forfeited and the suspect was released on a fine of Rs. 25,000.

heading: Renovated Beira Lake Linear Park inaugurated
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena vested the renovated and developed the eastern bank of the East Beira Lake and the Linear Park along Beira Lake with the public, today (June 12).
 
The programme was implemented by the Urban Development Authority under their project to develop the waterways in the city of Colombo. 
 
These development activities are carried out with the assistance of the World Bank under the Metropolitan Colombo Urban Development Project.

heading: Joint Opposition charges government
description:
The Joint Opposition charges that the government has been able to improve the state revenue over the last three years by intimidating the masses through taxes.
The details were disclosed during a media conference in Colombo today (Jun 12).

heading: EURO 4 standard fuel to be introduced
description: Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development says Euro 4 fuel to be introduced to the market, replacing Super Diesel and 95 Octane petrol.

heading: Chief incumbent of Kiri Vehera admitted to Hambantota Hospital
Wasantha Samarasinghe makes a revelation on Singapore FTA
description:
The Central Committee Member of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna, Wasantha Samarasinghe says two tax bills relevant to the Singapore Free Trade Agreement have been passed in Parliament after the FTA was signed.
He said this addressing a media conference at Battaramulla today (Jun 12).

heading: Joint opposition discusses 4 presidential candidates
CCTV captures Galewela accident
description:
Two off-duty soldiers were killed on the spot when the three-wheeler that they were travelling by collided head-on with a tipper in Puwakpitiya on the Dambulla - Galewela road.
 
Another person was critically injured in the accident.
 
He was first admitted to Galewela Hospital and later transferred to Kurunegala Teaching Hospital.
 
The deceased were 22-year-old Samith Maduranga Ekanayake and 23-year-old Supun Kalhara Rajathilleke.
 
They were on leave and were serving at an army camp in Diyathalawa.
 
The victims were returning home after attending a funeral when the tragedy struck.
 
Police said that the three-wheeler had attempted to overtake a car at high speed and then hit the tipper head-on.
 
The tipper driver was arrested by police.

heading: Chief incumbent of Kirivehera to be airlifted to Colombo
description:
The Director of Hambantota Hospital says that the chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera will be airlifted to Colombo for further treatment.
 
Dr. Dhanushka Perera said that the Thera had received gunshot in his abdomen and right hand.
 
Ven. Dhamminda Thera and Ven. Vidyapola Sobitha Thera were shot at last night by 3 suspects last night.
 
Later police found the jeep used by the assailants.
 
The investigators have also identified the gunmen.

heading: Journalist Mahesh Nissanka sends to remand custody
description:
Journalist Mahesh Nissanka and his eldest son, who are accused of assaulting another individual have been remanded until 18th of this month.
 
They were produced before Mahara Magistrate today (Jun 13).
 
The alleged assault had taken place on Saturday night in front of a supermarket in Enderamulla, Wattala.
 
A fitness center owner, named Wasantha Liyanage was assaulted by Nissanka and his 2 sons following a verbal exchange.
 
Wasantha was later admitted to National Hospital, Colombo with cut injuries.
 
Meanwhile, Nissanka and his 2 sons surrendered to police through a lawyer yesterday (Jun 12).
 
Later, the younger son was released on a cash surety of Rs. 10,000 and a personal surety of Rs. 100,000.
 
However, Nissanka has also made a complaint to police against the injured person and Kadawatha Police said it will also be probed.

heading: Mother consumes poison at the child protection authority
Postal strike continues, letters piling up
description:
The Joint Postal Workers' Union says that the strike launched by them will be continued today (Jun 13) as well.
Its convener Chintaka Bandara said by last evening around 300,000 letters had piled up at the Central Mail Exchange.
The postal workers began this strike 2 days ago, demanding a separate recruitment strategy for Department of Post and to ensure the job security to Sub-Post officers.

heading: Veteran musician Cyril Perera dies
description:
Veteran musician Cyril Perera has passed away.
 
He was 73-years-old at the time of his demise.
 
It is reported that he was receiving treatment at a private hospital in Colombo.

heading: Teledrama actress among arrested in a brothel raid
description:
Police have raided a brothel in Kidagammulla, Gampaha, which was operated in the guise of a hotel.
 
Seven women who had allegedly engaged in prostitution were arrested by the police personnel from this place.
 
The person who had managed the brothel was also arrested and later they were remanded until 18
 of this month.
 
Gampaha Headquarters Police conducted the raid early last morning following complaints by area residents.
 
Police also arrested 6 men at the location and they were released on bail.
 
Police said that among the arrested women, was a teledrama actress.
 
Investigations revealed that she had used to work at nightclubs.
 
The arrested women aged between 30 and 40 years are residents of Nittambuwa, Ganemulla, Yagoda, Siyambalape, and Delgoda.

heading: Three treasure hunters arrested
description:
Moneragala Police have arrested 3 persons while engaging in treasure hunting at Guruhela in Moneragala.
 
The suspects are residents of Kaduwela and Moneragala.
 
Few pieces of equipment were also apprehended.
 
The suspects will be produced before courts today (Jun 13).

heading: Dayasiri Jayasekera grilled for 5 hours
description:
MP Dayasiri Jayasekera who had appeared before Criminal Investigation Department left the premises.
 
He was grilled for 5 hours by the CID sleuths.
 
The MP was asked to come to the CID to record a statement after he made a confession that he received Rs. 1mn from Perpetual Treasuries Limited for his election campaign.

heading: No written approval for 1st Mihin board, Presidential Commission found
description:
The first board of directors for Mihin Lanka had been appointed without any written approval from the government.
 
This was revealed during the hearing by the Presidential Commission probing alleged malpractice at SriLankan, Mihin Lanka and SriLankan Catering.
 
The Commission met for a 4
 day today (Jun 11).

heading: MR arrives at Mattala in a light aircraft
description:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says restriction of the arrival of flights to Mattala is done with an intention of revenging.
The former President said this in response to the questions posed by the journalists after he arrived at the Mattala Airport in a light aircraft.
Meanwhile, after an event held in Colombo, yesterday the former President said that the recent changes implemented at the Sri Lanka Freedom Party are useless.
He said before making changes, one should understand the aspirations of the public.

heading: State Minister Range Bandara faces criticism
description:
State Minister Palitha Range Bandara is facing criticism from many sides after he made several statements with regard to the accident involving his son Yashoda Range Bandara.
The police reported that Yasodha Range Bandara had caused the accident while driving under the influence of liquor.
The National Movement of web journalists convened a media conference to educate the people on this incident today.

heading: Winds to subside from tomorrow
description:
Met Department says that the prevailing windy condition over the island and in the sea areas around the island is expected to reduce gradually from tomorrow (Jun 12).
 
Several spells of showers will occur in Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Kurunegala district.
 
Light showers will occur in Western province and in Puttalam, Galle, and Matara districts, particularly in the morning.
 
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Western, Southern, Central, Northern, North-central and North-western provinces and Monaragala district.

heading: Cabinet paper to reduce kerosene to Rs. 70
description:
If cabinet approval is granted, the price of kerosene will be dropped to Rs.70 per litre from midnight tonight (Jun 12).
 
The relevant proposal is scheduled to be tabled before the cabinet today.
 
Discussions were held yesterday between the Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development Vijith Vijayamuni Soysa and representatives from the fisheries union on this proposal.
 
On this occasion, the fishermen agreed to the proposed price of 70 rupees per litre of kerosene oil.

heading: Postal workers launch continuous strike
Rehabilitated LTTE members give emotional send off to Colonel Bandu
description:
A group of rehabilitated former LTTE members got emotional when they bade farewell to the commander of the Civil Defence Force of Mullaitivu camp in Kilinochchi yesterday.
Our correspondent said that the rehabilitated former LTTE members, as well as residents in the area, got very emotional at the farewell.
The Commander of the Mullaitivu Civil Defence Force, Colonel Ratnapriya Bandu helped a number of rehabilitated former LTTE cadres during the last five years to return to normal society.
Meanwhile, today marked the 28th year since the LTTE murdered 400 unarmed policemen in the Rupaskulam area in Thirukkovil, Ampara.
A remembering ceremony was held there today with the participation if IGP Pujith Jayasundera.

heading: TV presenter attacks neighbour with a knife (Photos)
description:
A presenter at a leading TV has attacked an owner of a fitness center in Enderamulla, Wattala.
The owner of the fitness center is now receiving treatment at the National Hospital, Colombo.
It was reported that the incident had occurred in Saturday night following a personal dispute.
The victim was Wasantha Kumara Liyanage, a resident of Enderamulla has lodged a complaint with police.
Police said that the TV presenter is not at home.

heading: Rs. 5 million robbed in Ududumbara
description:
Police say an unidentified group of 5 men in a van have robbed around Rs. 5 million from another van in Galekele in Ududumbara.
The money, belonging to 2 private firms, was transported from Mahiyanganaya to Kandy by a private security firm.
The incident had occurred at around 4.35 pm.
Police said that the robbers have threatened the staff of the security firm with a pistol.
Later, police found the van used by the robbers, abandoned in the Pallekele area.

heading: Cabinet approves reduction of kerosene price
description:
The Cabinet has approved to reduce Kerosene price to Rs.70 per litre from Rs. 101.
 
Minister Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa confirmed this.
 
The price was agreed upon with a discussion with fisheries unions yesterday (Jun 11).

heading: Update: New State Ministers & Deputy Ministers sworn in
description:
Seven parliamentarians were sworn in as State Ministers and Deputy Ministers at the Presidential Secretariat this morning (Jun 12).






Ranjith Aluvihare - State Minister for Tourism Development & Christian Affairs
Lucky Jayawardene - Hill County New Villages Community Development














Kader Mastan - Resettlement, Rehabilitation, Northern Development & Hindu Affairs
Angajan Ramanathan – Agriculture
Ajith Mannapperuma – Environment
Edward Gunasekara - Internal Affairs & North - Western Development
Nalin Bandara - Public Administration, Management, Law & Order

heading: Southern PC debates spread of Influenza
description:
A debate regarding the spread of influenza in the South is being held at the Southern Provincial Council.
 
A senior officer of the Southern Province Ministry of Health stated that to date 24 deaths have been reported and of them 17 were children.
 
Meanwhile, the technical equipment required for the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital’s ICU for children, the only one available in the South, has not yet been provided.
 
The GMOA Joint Secretary, Dr. Kanchitha Samararathna said that treating the diagnosed children has become impossible under these circumstances.

heading: Gampola - Udapalatha PS chairman assaulted
description:
The Chairman of Gampola - Udapalatha Pradeshiya Sabha has been hospitalized after he was assaulted by a group of councillors.
 
He was admitted to Gampola Hospital.
 
The clash had occurred following a tense situation at the council.

heading: G. L. dismisses speculations on meeting between US envoy & MR
description:
The Chairman of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna, Professor, GL. Peiris says that no political matters were discussed during the recent meeting between former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and outgoing US Ambassador, Athul Keshap.
 
Professor Peiris said that the outgoing ambassador only paid a customary call to the former President.
 
Meanwhile, the current US ambassador to Nepal, Aliana B. Teplitz will be appointed as the next US envoy to Sri Lanka.
 
She was appointed as ambassador to Sri Lanka and the Maldives by US President Donald Trump on 25
 of May and, the appointment has been endorsed by the American Senate.

heading: His appointment not yet informed says, former President
description:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says he has not been informed as yet that he was appointed as an advisor of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party.
The former President said this after attending an event in Kottawa today in response to the questions posed by the journalists.

heading: NFF says hidden agenda in 20th amendment
description:
The National Freedom Front says that the JVP is bringing forward the 20th constitutional amendment with a separatist agenda.
Its media spokesperson, Mohammed Muzzamil made this comment addressing a media briefing in Colombo today.

heading: State Minister's lies exposed
description:
The owner of the house which State Minister Palitha Range Bandara’s son, Yashoda Range Bandara’s vehicle crashed into, has stated that there was no clash after the accident.
State Minister Range Bandara who was avoiding media, speaking at a ceremony in Anamaduwa, Puttalam yesterday for the first time after the incident, stated that a certain faction had left a sword and a club in the vehicle after assaulting the occupants of the cab.
State Minister Palitha Range Bandara had convened a press briefing today as well, where he once again stated that a clash took place after the collision.
However, the owner of the house assured our news team that no such clash took place after the incident.
Further, the State Minister leveled allegations against the police and media at the press briefing held today.

heading: Three arrested with a high sensitive scanner
description:
Police have arrested 3 persons while transporting a high sensitive scanner which is used to check underground objects, in the Irattaperiyakulam area in Vavuniya.
 
Police said that the suspects were arrested following a tip-off by Special Task Force last night (Jun 10).
 
The suspects were residents of Kandy and Police said they were on a mission to find gold hidden by the LTTE.
 
The scanner is valued at around Rs. 5 million.

heading: Various views expressed on minister Sujeewa's acceptance of collecting money from Aloysius
description: Various personalities expressed views on State Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe, who had accepted that he had obtained money from Arjun Aloysius who is accused of Central Bank bond scam.

heading: Influenza kills 2 more infants at Karapitiya TH
description:
Two more infants have died of influenza that is being spread across the Southern Province for the past one and a half months.
A spokesperson at Karapitiya Teaching Hospital told our news team that two infants aged 8 months who were receiving treatment at the hospital died from the disease in the past two days.
The spokesperson noted that 18 children in the Southern Province have died from the disease thus far.
Additionally, more than 30 other children who are suspected to have contracted influenza are receiving treatment in the hospital.
However, speaking to our news team, Director of Health Services of the Southern Province, Dr G. Wijesooriya said that the number of patients seeking treatment for the disease in hospitals in the province has reduced significantly.

heading: Kosgoda Sujee suspected of ordering Karandeniya murder
description:
Police say that it has been confirmed the Vice Chairman of Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha, Donald Sampath Ranaweera, was murdered over a personal dispute.
A senior police official in charge of the investigations said that the late Vice Chairman’s relatives, as well as the other party, is refraining from disclosing information about the dispute.
It has been revealed at the autopsy that the Vice Chairman has sustained seven bullet wounds to his chest and another wound to his head.
Donald Sampath was shot last Friday night in Korakeena area in Uuragasmanhandiya.
Police Media Spokesperson, SP Ruwan Gunasekara noted that the suspect, who was arrested while receiving treatment in hospital, is a close accomplice of Kosgoda Sujee, an underworld leader.
Investigations have revealed that the Vice Chairman had been shot following a dispute between him and Kosgoda Sujee.
Donald Sampath Ranaweera has operated a real estate development business in the area and it has been reported that he had received the support of Kosgoda Sujee and his accomplices to operate the business.
However, both factions have had a dispute later and it is reported that the father and son who were murdered in Yudapitiya in Karandeniya, recently also had maintained close ties with the late Vice Chairman.

heading: Wife kills husband following a family dispute
description:
A 42-year-old woman has killed her husband by attacking him with a crow-bar in Gokarella, Kurunegala, following a family dispute.
