The husband was 50-year-old and the incident had taken place last afternoon (Jun 10).
 
Later the woman was arrested by police and she will be produced before Kurunegala court today.
 
They have 3 children of age 18, 12 - both boys - and an 8-year-old girl.

heading: CEB engineers issue a warning again, postal workers also to strike
description:
Ceylon Electricity Board's Engineers' Union says they will again stop attending to emergency repairs and maintenance work from this afternoon (Jun 11), if their demands are not addressed.
 
The CEB Engineers are undertaking a work-to-rule campaign, citing the Public Utilities Commission's failure to approve CEB's Long-term Power Generation Plan.
 
Intensifying their trade union action, they moved out of attending to emergency work from last Wednesday afternoon.
 
However, later they agreed to suspect that action after authorities agreed to approve the plan.
 
But they say since it is being delayed again, they will recommence their trade union action from this afternoon.
 
Meanwhile, postal workers are planning to launch a strike from 4 pm today (Jun 11), to show their protest against misuse of recruitment policies and the way interviews are held to recruit Sub-Post Masters.

heading: One arrested over Grandpass murder
description:
Police have arrested a 28-year-old resident of Wellampitiya for supporting and abetting a recent shooting in Grandpass.
 
One person was killed and 3 others were critically injured in the shooting which took place in January this year.
 
It is reported that the shooting was a result of a dispute over a financial transaction in drug dealing.

heading: Chinese woman arrested in Colpetty
description:
A Chinese woman who was staying in Sri Lanka without a visa was arrested in Walukarama Road in Colpetty, last night (Jun 10).
The woman was arrested last night at around 10, following a tip-off.
The 35-year-old suspect will be produced before Fort Magistrate today.

heading: Fishermen stage a protest
description:
A group of fishermen staged a protest in Maggona, Kalutara this morning (Jun 11).
They are demanding that kerosene oil is sold to them at Rs. 44.
Our correspondent said that fishermen from Beruwela and Payagala also joined the protest.

heading: Dayasiri Jayasekera at CID
description:
Former Minister, MP Dayasiri Jayasekera has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department.
 
He arrived there to give a statement over his confession that he accepted Rs. 1 million from Perpetual Treasuries.
 
Earlier, Jayasekera accepted he received funds from the PTL, which is accused of Central Bank bond scam, for his election campaign.

heading: Police seek public support to arrest a chain snatcher (Photos)
description:
Police are seeking public assistance to apprehend a suspect who used to flee after snatching gold chains from women.
Police have identified the suspect as K. G. Sagara Sawrnamal, and he had snatched a chain from a woman in Madawala, Wattegama in February this year.
The 24-year-old suspect is reported missing from the area since then.
Police urge the public to provide details to 081 - 2 476222 and 0718 - 591063.

heading: Lindula UC Chairman & 3 others further remanded in child kidnapping case
description:
Ashoka Sepala, Chairman of the Lindula Urban Council along with three others were further remanded until 18th of June for allegedly kidnapping and trafficking of a 5-year-old girl.
The suspects were produced before Nuwara Eliya Magistrate Pramodaka Jayasekera this morning (Jun 11).
The Magistrate also ordered that the small girl should be returned to the custody of her father.
Ashoka Sepala who contested from an independent group under the election symbol, clock, during the recent Local Government election was elected the Chairman of Lindula Urban Council.
On the 4th of June police arrested four suspects including Sepala, and 3 others, one of whom was councilor Ishara Anuruddha.
An investigation was launched in response to a complaint made in 2017, regarding the alleged kidnapping and selling a 5-year-old girl from Portmore Estate in Agarapatana.
The investigation led to the arrest of the 4 suspects by Nuwara Eliya Police.

heading: Group of 16 to meet Gotabhaya
description:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party's 'Group of 16' says they are planning to meet former Defence Secretary, Gotabhaya Rajapaksa on Wednesday (Jun 13).
 
Confirming the meeting, former Minister S. B. Dissanayake said Gotabhaya Rajapaksa has a good acceptance in the country as a person who had done a service to the country.

heading: Former President Rajapaksa says “certain individuals were bought during last Presidential election”
description:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that certain individuals were “bought’ during the last presidential election.
Addressing a gathering at a book launch in Colombo last evening (Jun 10), the former President said all allegations that were made against him are, one by one, being revealed as false.

heading: JVP urges to table remaining sections of Bond Commission report soon
description:
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna urges to submit the remaining sections of Bond Commission report in Parliament soon.
The JVP's Propaganda Secretary MP Vijitha Herath said this addressing a media conference in Battaramulla today (Jun 11).
Herath also spoke about the allegations level against JVP MP Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa of accepting money from Arjun Aloysius.

heading: Witness hearing on case against Prasanna Ranatunga begins
description:
The witness hearing on the case against Gampaha district UPFA MP Prasanna Ranatunga and 3 others for allegedly obtaining Rs. 64mn from a businessman after threatening him, began today (Jun 11).
 
It was taken up before the Colombo High Court Judge, Champa Janaki Rajaratne.
 
The complainant said that in the afternoon of 29th of May 2015, Ranatunga gave him a telephone and demanded money.
 
He had said that the MP again visited his premises with 3 security personnel on the same evening and again demanded money.
 
The relevant audio recordings of telephone conversations were played at the court.
 
Thereafter, the case was postponed to 28th of this month.

heading: Rs. 257,000 robbed in Athurugiriya
description:
Two persons on a motorcycle had robbed Rs. 257,000 from an employee of a finance firm, while he was collecting loan installments.
The employee was riding a motorcycle and he was stopped by two robbers at Wijaya Mawatha in Athurugiriya, before fleeing with the money.

heading: Rains predicted for several areas
description:
Met Department says that the prevailing windy condition is expected to continue over the island and in the sea areas around the island in next few days.
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Sabaragamuwa, Central provinces and in Galle and Matara districts, fairly heavy falls about 75 mm can be expected at some places.
Several spells of showers will occur in Western and North-Western provinces and in Hambantota district.
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Western, Southern, Central, Northern, North-central and North-western provinces and Monaragala district.

heading: Indian construction worker dies
description:
An Indian construction worker died last night (Jun 08) after he was run over by a bus, which came into the construction site to take the workers to their lodging place.
It was reported that the 24-year-old victim had attempted to get onboard the bus before it was stopped and then he had slipped and fell.
The incident occurred at a construction site in Slave Island at around 9 pm.
Police have arrested the bus driver.

heading: Makandure Madush's ransom collector dies in exchange of fire with STF
Health authorities warn "Influenza could spread island-wide"
description:
The health authorities say that influenza which has killed 20 persons in the South could spread to other areas of the island.
The Director of Health Education Bureau Dr. Paba Palihawadana said it is reported that the disease is now found in the Sabaragamuwa as well.
It was reported that 30 patients suffering from viral fever are being treated at Embilipitiya Hospital.

heading: Sujeewa should be punished, fmr. Kaduwela Opposition Leader says
description:
Former Opposition leader of Kaduwela Priyantha Pathberiya says the State Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe who accepted that he obtained money from Perpetual Treasuries should be punished.
Senasinghe accepted that he received 3 cheques worth 3 million rupees from the PTL.
Priyantha Pathberiya addressing a media conference organized by the "Organization against Corruption in Kaduwela", said today (Jun 09) if this issue is not addressed properly, the public will react to it.

heading: Identities of underworld members killed in Madawala revealed
description:
Two underworld figures were killed in a shootout with Special Task Force in Madawala, Kandy this afternoon (Jun 09).
Police Media Spokesperson, Superintendent of Police, Ruwan Gunasekara says that the shootout took place at around 12.15 pm.
He said the STF set up a roadblock in Madawala area following a tip-off that a vehicle carrying underworld members is approaching the area.
The two underworld members were killed when the Police Special Task Force retaliated after the two individuals opened fire at the STF personnel.
A spokeswoman at Katugastota Hospital stated that the two individuals were already dead when they were brought to the hospital.
It has been revealed that one of the deceased was the person who operated the drug racket of underworld kingpins Makandure Madush and Angoda Lokka, in Sri Lanka and that he was also involved in collecting their ransoms.
The individual has been identified as 30-year-old Rumalsa Iresh Madushanka Nawagamuwa alias Baila, who is said to own two houses in Panagoda and Imbulgoda.
The other individual who was killed in the incident has been identified as Polwaththage Upali alias Jana who was a resident of Angoda.

heading: Veteran author Somaweera Senanayake dies
description:
Veteran author and scriptwriter Somaweera Senanayake has passed away.
He died at a private hospital early this morning due to a heart attack at the age of 74.
He is the author of the popular novel 'Yashorawaya'.

heading: SAITM Sameera arrested for fake shooting incident
description:
The Criminal Investigation Department has arrested former Chief Executive Officer of SAITM, Dr. Sameera Senaratne.
His car came under gunfire in February 2017 in Malambe and it was found it was a pre-meditated incident.
Later, CID questioned him over the incident.
He was arrested today and was remanded until 14th of June when he was produced before Kaduwela Magistrate.

heading: A proposal from Kaduwela to remove Sujeewa Senasinghe
description:
The organization against corruption in Kaduwela has called for State Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe to be removed from all posts he holds, in addition to removing him from the UNP following his acceptance that he received money from Perpetual Treasuries.
 
Speaking at a media 
called today (Jun 08) the former Opposition Leader of Kaduwela, Priyantha Pathberiya made these comments.
State Minister Senasinghe accepted that he conducted his election propaganda with 3 million rupees allocated by Perpetual Treasuries.
The CID noted the there were three instances where Perpetual Treasuries had allocated 3 million rupees to the State Minister.
Meanwhile addressing a media briefing held in 
the leader of the United National Freedom Front Maithree Gunaratne stated that JVP MP Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa was one of the individuals that received money from Perpetual Treasuries.

heading: Range Bandara criticizes media that reported his son’s accident
description:
State Minister Palitha Range Bandara expressed his views about the accident caused by his son, Yashoda Range Bandara on the 6th of this month while driving under the influence of alcohol.
Our news team attempted to contact State Minister Palitha Range Bandara he avoided speaking to media willingly or unwillingly.
When we attempted to contact the State Minister on his mobile on several occasions, we were told by his security officers that the minister is not available.
Despite the State Minister’s allegations, our reports were all based on accurate facts provided by the Police Media Division.
Police stated that the sword and the club were found inside the cab.
Additionally, Arachchikattuwa police have not yet received a complaint regarding a tense situation, as alleged by the State Minister, erupting following the accident.
Hence, it is questionable as to how the State Minister can make such allegations against media reporting.
A communiqué issued by Police Media Division yesterday at 6.10 am stated that Yashoda Range Bandara was arrested following an accident in Arachchikattuwa on the 06th of June 2018.
The communiqué noted that Yashoda Range Bandara will be produced before courts on the charges of misuse of state property, causing an accident while driving under the influence of alcohol and having a sword in his possession.
Meanwhile, Yashoda Range Bandara had several other allegations 
against him for causing accidents on several previous occasions.
However, we had not reported that the Minister’s son was driving the vehicle on those incidents.
We would like to kindly remind State Minister Range Bandara that he should study the reported items properly prior to leveling allegations against media.
Further, despite the statement made by the Minister that parties who were affected in the previous incidents were looked after, it was revealed that no such action has been taken thus far.

heading: Police widen probe into Karandeniya shooting
description:
Two police teams are conducting investigations to arrest the other individual who is suspected to have carried out the murder of the Vice Chairman of Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha, Donald Sampath.
One suspect was arrested in connection with the incident and police stated that the individual is a close accomplice of Kosgoda Sujee, who is currently overseas.
Police arrested the individual this morning (Jun 09) while he was receiving treatment at Uuragasmanhandiya Hospital.
Police Media Spokesperson, SP Ruwan Gunasekara stated that a T-56 magazine and 30 bullets found in possession of the 22-year-old suspect were also seized.
The incident took place last night when Sampatha was returning home after attending a wedding reception in Korakeena, Uuragasmanhandiya last night.
The driver of the cab has also sustained injuries in the shooting.
Initial investigations revealed that 15 shots had been fired at the cab by two individuals who had arrived on a motorbike.
It is reported that the assailants have met with an accident after their motorbike veered off the road about 100 meters away from the scene.
48-year-old Donald Sampath was elected to Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha from the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna at the recently held local government election.
Initial investigations have revealed that he has had a dispute with Kosgoda Sujee for some time.

heading: One suspect arrested over Karandeniya murder
Businessmen cautioned over online transactions
description:
The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Response Unit says that businessmen should be cautious when transactions are conducted through online.
Senior Engineer of CERT Roshan Chandragupta said that bank accounts to which payments are made should be verified prior to initiating transactions.
He said that SL CERT has received 10 complaints so far this year on online financial fraud.

heading: Sudden breakdowns: few Districts without electricity
description:
The power supply was disrupted last night in several areas due to a breakdown in the 132KW power-line from New Laxapana to Balangoda.
Media Spokesperson of the Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy Sulakshana Jayawardana said that few more hours will be required to restore power supply.

heading: Windy conditions to prevail
description:
Met Department says that the prevailing windy condition is likely to continue until 11th of June over the island and in the sea areas around the island.
It’s expected to reduce gradually after 11th of June.
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces, fairly heavy falls above 50 mm can be expected at some places.
Several spells of showers will occur in Western, Southern and North-Western provinces.
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Western, Southern, Central, Northern, North-central and North-western provinces and Monaragala district.

heading: 24 injured in Velvetithurai clash, 7 arrested
description:
24 persons, who were injured following a clash in the Jaffna-VelVetithurai area yesterday, have been admitted to hospital for treatment.
The incident, which occurred, at a playground when a verbal argument between two groups of youths had intensified into an altercation last evening.

heading: China delays last installment in Hambantota Project over a dispute
description:
The last installment under the agreement on the Hambantota Port with China, amounting to 584 million US Dollars has been delayed.
This is reportedly over a dispute involving infrastructure facilities.
The agreement between China Merchants Port Holdings Company and Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ports was signed on the 29th of July last year.
292.1 million Dollars was received in December last year while a further 97.3 Million dollars was received in January.
The remaining 584 Million was due, a day before yesterday.
Sri Lanka Ports Authority Chairman Parakrama Dissanayake said that they hope to meet the conditions under the agreement soon.

heading: Joint Opposition to stage demonstrations against delaying elections
description:
The Joint Opposition is preparing to carry out a series of protests across the country.
Parliamentarian Dilum Amunugama said that the protests are held against delaying elections and the rise in the cost of living.
Meanwhile, Parliamentarian Bandula Gunawardena addressing a seminar in Thalangama said that they will not let the government’s new trade policy to be implemented.

heading: AG says release of Bond report annexures ‘will not’ impact probe
description: Attorney General has informed President's Secretary, releasing the Annex C-350 of the Bond Commission Report will not have an impact on ongoing investigations into the bond scam.

heading: Bank robbed in Kaduwela
description:
Two persons arriving on a motorcycle have robbed a bank in Ihala Bomiriya, Kaduwela.
 
Police said that the Samurdhi Development Bank was robbed by them this afternoon and sped away with Rs. 120,000.
 
It was reporters that the robbers had in their possession a sharp object and a firearm.

heading: Consumer Affairs Authority management released
description:
The Chairman, Director General and other top officials who were taken hostage by other workers, have been released.
 
The employees took the management into their custody demanding removal of the Human Resources head.
 
The management staff had been released after they had agreed to dismiss the HR head, who is accused of malpractice.

heading: Higher Education Minister accuses new ACMC MP of corruption
description:
The Draft Bill to absorb the students of Malabe Private Medical College to Sir John Kotelawala Defence University was presented in Parliament today (Jun 08).
 
The Draft Bill was moved by Higher Education and Cultural Affairs Minister, Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe.
 
At the same time, accepting money from Arjun Aloysius was argued in Parliament today as well.
 
The argument occurred when Joint Opposition MP, Ranjith Soyza made a statement citing that his privileges have been breached.
 
He said it could be corrected by releasing the names of the MPs who had obtained money from Aloysius.
 
However, Speaker Karu Jayasuriya said it was reported that there's no such a list.
 
Meanwhile, I. M. Ismail who represents All Ceylon Makkal Congress took oaths before the Speaker this morning.
 
He was appointed to fill the vacancy of UNF MP H.H.M. Navavi.
 
However, Higher Education Minister, Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe objected to the appointment of Ismail.
 
He said alleged corruption committed by Ismail when he was the vice chancellor of South Eastern University is mentioned in the COPE report.

heading: Arrested Yashoda Range Bandara undergoes MRI scan
description:
The son of State Minister Palitha Range Bandara, Yashoda Range Bandara who was arrested by the police this morning (Jun 08) was taken to a private hospital for an MRI test.
 
Later, the suspect returned to Sri Jayewardenepura Hospital.
 
Police have filed 3 charges against the suspect.
 
The misappropriation of state property, causing an accident driving under the influence of liquor and having a sword in possession.
 
Medical reports confirmed that Yashoda Range Bandara was intoxicated at the time of the accident which occurred during the early hours of Wednesday in Bangadeniya - Kottapitiya junction along the Chilaw- Puttlam main road.
 
The suspect was originally admitted to Chilaw hospital and was later transferred to Colombo national hospital for further tests.
 
The Police Media Spokesperson’s Office further noted that the suspect is to be produced before courts.

heading: FlyDubai suspends flying to Mattala
description:
FlyDubai, the only international airline that operated to Mattala International Airport has suspended its regular flights until November.
Deputy Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, Ashok Abeysinghe confirmed it.
The Deputy Minister said that the airline has taken the decision due to lack of passengers.

heading: M. K. Sivajilingam hospitalized
description:
Northern Provincial Council member M. K. Sivajilingam has been hospitalized following a heart attack.
 
Our correspondent said the Councillor who fell ill last night at his home, was hospitalized by the security officers and his relatives.
 
Later, he was admitted to the Intensive Care Unit of Jaffna Teaching Hospital.
 
When contacted, a hospital source said that Sivajilingam is recovering now.

heading: Fisherman from Beruwela reported missing
description:
A fisherman onboard a multi-day fishing craft is reported missing after falling into the sea.
 
The fishing craft that had left from Beruwela on 1st of this month with 4 fishermen onboard, and it had caught in a high wave, while it was on its way back.
 
The missing fisherman was a 38-year-old, father of 2 from Bangalawatte in Beruwela.
 
A group of naval divers has been deployed in a search operation to locate the missing person.

heading: 5 faculties of Ruhuna University closed
description: Vice Chancellor of Ruhuna University says that five faculties of the university including Arts and Commerce situated in Wellamadama were closed due to a clash between two student groups.

heading: Yasodha Range Bandara remanded
description:
State Minister Palitha Range Bandara's son Yasodha Range Bandara has been remanded until 12th of this month.
 
He is accused of drunk-driving and misuse of public property.
Yasodha was produced before Nugegoda Magistrate Court this afternoon by a police team from Arachchikattuwa Police.
The cab, which is a property of a Ministry, driven by him crashed into a house early morning on Wednesday.
He and another person injured in the accident and it caused extensive damages to the house.

heading: Young worker falls to death from Lotus Tower
description:
Police say that a 19-year-old worker from Kilinochchi had died after falling in the lift shaft of the Lotus Tower in Colombo, which is under construction.
He had fallen from the 17th floor. The incident occurred at around 2 pm.
Police said he was working in the tower when the mishap happened.
The victim was Koneshwaran Nidharshan, a resident of Aththarekulam in Kilinochchi.

heading: Three arrested with a firearm
description:
Three persons were arrested in Thalathuoya with a firearm.
 
Police found the firearm after the car in which they were travelling was checked.
 
The suspects were residents of Negombo and Wennappuwa.

heading: Lorry catches fire on Southern expressway
description:
A lorry has caught fire between the 19. 4 and 19.5 km posts of the Southern Expressway.
Police said the lorry which was plying from Kadawatha to Matara caught fire at around 12.10 pm.
No one was injured in the incident.
The police officers at the Galanigama Interchange had intervened to douse the fire.

heading: Minister Dissanayake challenges Dilan Perera to get elected to Parliament
description:
Sri Lanka Freedom Party National Organizer, Duminda Dissanayake says that he wishes MP Dilan Perera would be able to contest in the next general election and be elected to Parliament.
Minister Dissanayake was speaking to the media after an event in Anuradhapura today (Jun 08).
He said this in response to a statement by Dilan Perera, who said yesterday that if Dissanayake does not perform properly in his new post, he would be removed from that post also.

heading: Deputy Chairman of Karandeniya PS gunned down
description:
Deputy Chairman of the Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha Donald Sampath was killed in a shooting last night (Jun 08).
Police stated that 2 persons who arrived on a motorcycle had opened fire at Sampath's double cab before fleeing the area.
48-year-old Donald Sampath was elected to the Karandeniya PS from the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.
He was returning home after attending a wedding when the shooting took place.
The driver of the cab was also sustained injuries.
Uragasmanhandiya Police is conducting further investigations.

heading: State Minister Senasinghe to be questioned by CID
description:
State Minister, Sujeewa Senasinghe admitted today that he spent the 3 million rupees that he received from Perpetual Treasuries Limited for his election campaign.
However, according to the investigation report of the Criminal Investigation Department that was submitted to Courts, the state minister has accepted the money after the election was over.
The CID informed the Colombo Fort Magistrate that the PTL has offered the 3 million rupees to State Minister, Senasinghe on three occasions.
This was revealed when the Central Bank Bond case was taken for hearing yesterday.
The CID report further revealed that one of the cheques for one million rupees had been encashed by an S.I. attached to the state Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe’s security detail on the directives of Senasinghe.
The report also states that the rest of the cheques had been encashed by Senasinghe’s security personnel on the directives of the minister’s election and financial coordinator.
Contradicting the above statement by the minister, the CID revealed in Court that all the cheques have been issued by a subsidiary of Perpetual Treasuries, W. M. Mendis Company Limited.
It is significant that all the cheques were issued after the conclusion of the general election in 2015.
According to the CID report, the cheque bearing No.401139 for one million rupees had been issued 7 days after the conclusion of the election.
It further said that State Minister Senasinghe had directly instructed an S.I. attached to his security division to encash the first cheque.
According to the same CID report, state minister Senasinghe received the second cheque on November 12, 2015.
That was 87 days after the election.
The third cheque had been issued to Senasinghe on March 31, 2016, that was 227 days after the general election.
Additional Solicitor General, Yasantha Kodagoda pointed out in court yesterday that one of the controversial Central Bank Bond issuances was also conducted on the same day.
Under these circumstances, the CID is investigating state minister Senasinghe for accepting three million rupees on three occasions from the third respondent of the controversial Central Bank bond case, at a time when there was no election.
The CID has also recorded a statement from state minister, Senasinghe’s election and financial coordinator with regard to the incident.
The minister’s election and financial coordinator said in his statement that he did not keep any record of the money that was received from Perpetual Treasuries nor did he deposit such money in any bank.
He has also stated that he did not know the origin of the cheques.
Accordingly, the CID informed the court that State Minister Senasinghe will be questioned over the reasons as to why he received cheques amounting to millions of rupees from Perpetual Treasuries.

heading: Kerosene price to be reduced ?
description:
Representatives of Fishermen’s Organizations say that Kerosene should be offered to all citizens at the previous price.
However, the Subject Minister and State Minister share different views.
State Minister Dileep Wedarachchi had said that it may be possible to offer a litre of Kerosene at a price between 70 to 80 rupees, by next Monday.
However, Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development Vijith Vijayamuni Soyza said that he withdrew from discussions held regarding the matter.
However, the All Island Fishermen’s Federation said that if steps are not taken to provide Kerosene at 44 rupees, they would carry out a major struggle.
The price of kerosene was increased by Rs. 57 to Rs. 101 in April this year.
The government said the price was increased in such a way to reduce misuse.
They said certain buses and lorries adulterate kerosene with diesel.
However, this price hike has affected the fisheries community and they are urging the government to cut down the price in order to save their livelihood.

heading: Election Commission's Chairman explains ill effects of postponing elections
description:
Chairman of the Election Commission Mahinda Deshapriya says postponing elections creates ill effects.
Addressing a programme in Anuradhapura yesterday (Jun 08), he also spoke of the recent controversy at the Maharagama Urban Council.

heading: Tipper - bike accident kills 2 youths
description:
Two young men were killed when the motorcycle that they were traveling on collided with a tipper at Pallegama in Laggala, Naaula, yesterday.
The two men aged 19 and 22 were killed after being admitted to Dambulla Hospital.
They are residents of Rathalawela, Mahawela.

heading: Unidentified gunmen kill trader in Kaththankudi
description:
Two unidentified gunmen on a motorcycle had shot and killed a shop owner in Deen Road, Kaththankudi, last night.
The incident occurred at around 11 pm.
The reason for the killing is unknown.

heading: Woman arrested at BIA with RS. 8mn worth gold
description:
Sri Lanka Customs Unit at the Bandaranaike International Airport has arrested a woman who attempted to smuggle Rs. 8mn worth jewellery into the country.
 
The arrest was made early this morning (Jun 11) and she had arrived from Dubai.
 
The net weight of the jewellery items was 1.3 kg and the 54-year-old suspect was a resident of Warakapola.

heading: Yasodha Range Bandara remanded further
description:
State Minister Palitha Range Bandara's son Yashoda, who was arrested over an accident, was further remanded until 14
 of June by Chilaw Magistrate.
He was brought to the courts from Sri Jayewardenepure Hospital.
Yasodha Range Bandara was arrested and remanded on 8th of this month.
He is accused of causing an accident in Bangadeniya on 6th of this month while driving under the influence of liquor.
Bandara was arrested while he was receiving treatment at the Sri Jayewardenepure Hospital.

heading: JVP MP Nalinda Jayatissa goes to court
description:
JVP parliamentarian Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa says he will take legal action against the leader of the United National Freedom Front, Maithri Gunarathna, who had leveled allegations against the MP that he accepted funds from Perpetual Treasuries.
MP Jayatissa made this comment in response to the statement made by Maithri Gunarathna yesterday.
Addressing a media briefing in Negombo yesterday, leader of the United National Freedom Front, Maithri Gunarathna stated that JVP MP Nalinda Jayatissa accepted funds from Perpetual Treasuries.

heading: Journalist Mahesh Nissanka arrested
description:
TV presenter and journalist Mahesh Nissanka has been arrested by Kadawatha Police.
Nissanka is accused of attacking an owner of a fitness center in Enderamulla, Wattala with a knife on Saturday night.
 
The fitness center owner is now being treated at the National Hospital.
 
Police said that the attack was a result of a personal dispute.
 
The victim was Wasantha Kumara Liyanage.

heading: Maharagama Urban Council tense
description:
A tense situation has been prevailing at the Maharagama Urban Council with the nomination of the former Chairperson Kanthi Kodikara and 5 others as councillors of the Maharagama Urban Council.
 
Our correspondent said police have been called in to strengthen the security there.
 
6 elected councillors from the February 10th Local Government Election under the Independent Group 11, had resigned to facilitate those nominations.
 
Accordingly, Kanthi Kodikara and 5 others took oaths before former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his residence this morning (Jun 07).




 
The nominations submitted by Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna were rejected and later, the party supported the Independent Group 11.

heading: "No personal agenda" - Anura Kumara
description:
The leader of the Janatha Viumkthi Peramuna says that they did not have any personal political agenda in deciding to bring in the 20th amendment to the constitution.
 
The JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake said this addressing a seminar in Galle yesterday (Jun 06).

heading: Range Bandara’s son admitted to J’pura Hospital, police seek court permission to arrest him
description:
Arachchikattuwa police have submitted a report to the Chilaw Magistrate Court this morning (Jun 07) with regards to the crash involving Yashodha Range Bandara, the son of State Minister, Palitha Range Bandara.
 
A senior police officer investigating the accident said that court permission will be sought to have the suspect arrested.
 
The medical tests have confirmed that the suspect was driving under the influence of liquor at the time of the accident.
 
Yashoda Range Bandara was driving a double cab belonging to a government Ministry when he lost control of the vehicle which saw it being veered off the road at the Kottapitiya junction early last morning (Jun 06) before crashing into a nearby house.
 
The house was extensively damaged in the incident.
 
The suspect who was transferred from Chilaw hospital to Colombo National Hospital for a test had discharged himself and got admitted to Sri Jayewardenepure Hospital instead.

heading: Landslide kills a 3-year-old girl
description:
A 3-year-old little girl was killed when an earth mound collapsed on a house in Uda Maaliboda in Deraniyagala this morning (Jun 07).
Police said an earth mound has collapsed on their house as a result of the prevailing rains.
She was with her mother and a sibling in the home when the incident happened at around 11 am.
The mother and the other child escaped unhurt.
Police said that the body of the victim is kept at Deraniyagala Hospital.

heading: Hit & run bus driver sentenced
description:
The court has imposed a 3-month jail term for a private bus driver who had driven away after an accident.
 
He was sentenced yesterday (Jun 06).
 
The Hulftsdorp Magistrate also imposed a fine of Rs. 30,000 and ordered that the convict will have to serve a jail term of 3 more years if he failed to pay the fine.
 
The accused was a 28-year-old driver of a private bus on 138  route of Kottawa - Pettah.
 
On 24th of last month, the bus drove by him had collided with a car in the Kurunduwatte area and following the accident he had driven away.
 
Later, policemen from Kurunduwatte Police gave chase and arrested the bus driver.
 
It was found that the bus driver was under the influence of liquor at the time of the accident.
 
He was remanded after being produced before Magistrate court.

heading: Australia jails Sri Lankan man over Malaysia Airlines plane bomb threat
description:
A Sri Lankan man who threatened to detonate a bomb on a Malaysia Airlines plane has been jailed in Australia.
 
Manodh Marks, 26, forced Kuala Lumpur-bound jet MH128 to turn back to Melbourne in May last year after he tried to access the cockpit.
 
He was later found not to be carrying explosives and in a drug-induced psychosis, a court heard.
 
It is the first time Australia has jailed a person for attempting to take control of an aircraft.
 
Marks will be deported after serving a maximum sentence of 12 years, judge Michael McInerney told the County Court of Victoria today (Jun 07).
 
"The passengers and crew certainly were not only concerned but convinced, that you were indeed in possession of a bomb," the judge said in his sentencing remarks.
 
The flight, carrying more than 200 people, landed safely about 15 minutes after Marks was tackled to the ground by passengers.
 
Marks, who was in Australia on a student visa, had been released from a psychiatric facility on the day of the incident.
 
The court heard that he had taken crystal methamphetamine, known locally as ice, on the way to the airport.
 
Shortly after take-off, he brandished two black items - later found to be a portable speaker and a battery pack - with flashing lights.
 
"I have a bomb with me," Marks told the crew, according to Fairfax Media.
 
"I want to talk to the captain. I want to talk to the pilot. Don't come near me. I want to destroy this aircraft. I will destroy this plane."
 
About five minutes later, Marks was subdued by passengers who bound his hands with cable ties.
 
The Airbus A330 landed safely a short time later.
 
McInerney said the threat had placed intense stress on the pilots, putting passengers at risk.
 
At the time, Australian police were criticised for taking almost 90 minutes to board the plane after it landed.
 
Victoria Police Chief Commissioner Graham Ashton said police had initially treated it as a possible terrorism incident, before deciding it was "a case involving a mental health issue".
 
"I certainly appreciate when you are on a plane in that situation one minute could seem like an hour," he said.
 
"The objective in any serious incident like this is to get every member of the crew, every passenger off the plane safely, and that is what was able to be achieved."
 
Marks will be eligible for parole after nine years.
 
(BBC)

heading: Two policemen jailed for raping two young women
description:
Colombo High Court judge Gihan Kulatunga today (Jun 07) sentenced 2 policemen for 20 years and six months in jail for gang-raping 2 women in 2003 after abducting them.
 
The incident had taken place in 2003.
 
The accused, a sub-inspector and a police assistant, were serving at Sapugaskanda Police.
 
They were also ordered to pay Rs. 200,000 each to the 2 young women as compensation.

heading: Minister Ranawaka withdraws two court cases
description:
Minister Chmapika Ranawaka today (Jun 07) withdrew two defamation cases against Maubima newspaper that were filed seeking Rs. 1.5 billion for causing damages to his reputation.
 
One of those cases said that his reputation was damaged through an article published on 30th of December 2014, on the disappearance of journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda.
 
The other was against an article on alleged irregularities on the importation of coal, published in the same newspaper.
 
The Minister's attorney informed the Colombo District Court today that his client is willing to withdraw those 2 cases.
 
Considering that the judge dismissed the cases without costs.

heading: Perpetual Treasuries pays Rs. 3.2mn to Mahendran's credit card
description:
Colombo Fort Magistrate ordered to extend the detention of Perpetual Treasuries owner Arjun Aloysius and its CEO Kasun Palisena until 21st of this month.
 
They were remanded when the Central Bank bond scam case was taken up before Colombo Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne today (Jun 07).
 
Here, the Criminal Investigation Department informed the court that the PTL has paid Rs. 3.2mn for former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran's credit card.

heading: Heavy showers of over 100mm predicted (Photos)
description:
The Met Department says due to the active south-west monsoon, windy and showery conditions are expected to continue over the island and in the sea areas around the island in next few days.
 
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, Central and North-Western provinces.
 
Heavy falls above 100mm can be expected at some places in Sabaragamuwa, Western and Central provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.
 
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Southern, Central, Northern, North-central and North-western provinces and Monaragala district.
Meanwhile, our correspondents said due to heavy showers some areas of Hatton were experiencing flash floods. 
In Ginigathhena, traffic has been restricted as a result of an earth mound collapsing on the road in Diyagala.

heading: PTL deposits Rs. 3.2mn in Arjuna Mahendran’s credit card, State Minister Senasinghe's name also transpired in courts
description:
It was revealed in Colombo Fort Magistrate today (Jun 07) that Perpetual Treasuries Limited has deposited 3.2 million rupees in the credit card belonging to former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran.
In addition, it was further revealed that another 3 million rupees have been given to a state minister.
Additional Solicitor General and President Counsel Yasantha Kodagoda revealed these details to the court today.
Later, the owner of Perpetual Treasuries Limited, Arjun Aloysius and his CEO Kasun Palisena were produced before Court today.
At the same time, Magistrate Lanka Jayarathna ordered Perpetual Treasuries chairman, Jeffrey Aloysius to release the asset and liabilities and income and expenditure to the Criminal Investigation Department.
 
Meanwhile, Additional Solicitor General Yasantha Kodagoda informed Court that Singapore police have informed that Arjuna Mahendran cannot be arrested on the orders of Interpol Red Notice.
He further said that therefore, a diplomatic request will be made to Singapore to extradite Arjuna Mahendran to Sri Lanka if the latter cannot be arrested under Singaporean law.
President Counsel Yasantha Kodagoda said that the Legal Draftsman Department is currently preparing the necessary documents with regard to the diplomatic request.
President’s Counsel Yasantha Kodagoda revealed that a State Minister had received funds from Perpetual Treasuries through another Company.
He stated that the State Minister had received money on 2 occasions amounting to 3 Million Rupees.
It was also revealed that the Police Officers attached to the security unit of the MP had encashed the cheques.
According to the CID report, the State Minister concerned was Sujeewa Senasinghe.
 
Meanwhile, President’s Counsel Yasantha Kodagoda also said that Former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran had received cheques amounting to 3.2 Million Rupees from Perpetual Treasuries.
He stated that the funds had been used to settle the bill of the limitless credit card of Arjuna Mahendran.
Meanwhile, President Counsel, Kalinga Indratissa who appeared for PTL objected to the revelation of payment of cash to various individuals by his client.
The case will be called again on 20th of June and, Arjun Aloysius and Kasun Palisena were further remanded until that day.

heading: Finance Minister outlines reasons for collapse of finance companies
description:
Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera says lack of proper financial management, improper investments and fraudulent activities of the management members have been identified as reasons for the collapse of certain finance companies.
 
Minister Samaraweera said this in Parliament today (Jun 07).
 
He said this after Chief Opposition Whip, Anura Kumara Dissanayake made a statement on the collapse of ETI Finance.
 
He was speaking during the adjournment debate on the collapse of finance companies including ETI Finance.

heading: Sunil Handunnetti reappointed COPE chairman
description: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna MP Sunil Handunnetti has been reappointed the Chairman of Committee on Public Enterprises.

heading: "Committed towards reconciliation", says President
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena says the present government is committed to creating peace and reconciliation in the country.
 
President said that during the Iftar ceremony held at the President's House in Colombo yesterday (Jun 07).

heading: Viral flu spreads from South to Sabaragamuwa
description:
The Medical Superintendent of Embilipitiya Hospital N.S. Dharmathilaka says that 30 patients believed to have been suffering from influenza are receiving treatment in the hospital.
Earlier, the Health Ministry stated that 2500 infected patients have been found in the Southern province.
Meanwhile, Sabaragamuwa Provincial Health Services Director Dr. Kapila Kannangara said that the flu is spreading from the South to the Sabaragamuwa province.

heading: SLFP restructuring to be expedited
description:
The Central Committee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party that met yesterday (Jun 07) decided to expedite the restructuring process of the party.
 
The CC members had also talked about the 20th amendment to the constitution moved by the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna.
 
It was the first SLFP CC meeting since the appointment of temporary office bearers.
 
The meeting was chaired by President Maithripala Sirisena.

heading: Son of State Minister arrested
description:
The son of State Minister Palitha Range Bandara, Yasodha Range Bandara who was involved in an accident under the influence of liquor has been arrested.
















The suspect is being treated at Sri Jayewardenepure Hospital for injuries incurred during the accident.
The Police Media Spokesperson’s Office said that officers from Arachchikattuwa Police made the arrest at the hospital.
3 allegations have been levelled against the suspect.
Firstly the misappropriation of state property, secondly driving under the influence causing an accident, and lastly being in possession of a sword - violating the ordinance prohibiting the possession of dangerous knives.
Medical reports confirmed that Yashoda Range Bandara was intoxicated at the time of the accident which occurred during the early hours of Wednesday in Bangadeniya, Kottapitiya junction along the Chilaw- Puttlam main road.
The suspect was originally admitted to Chilaw Hospital and was later transferred to National Hospital, Colombo for further testing.
The Police Media Spokesperson’s Office further noted that the suspect is to be produced before courts.

heading: Heavy rains lash Central hills
description:
Our correspondents say the Central hills have been experiencing heavy rains since early this morning (Jun 07).
 
The water level of the Wimalasurendra Reservoir is also rising and the authorities have opened one of the spill gates of the dam.

heading: Probe underway to arrest Range Bandara’s son
description:
Arachchikattuwa police have launched a special investigation to have Yashoda Range Bandara, the son of State Minister, Palitha Range Bandara, arrested for causing a motor accident.
 
Police stated that Yashoda Range Bandara who was injured in the accident will be transferred from Chilaw hospital to National Hospital, Colombo for a test.
 
A double cab belonging to a government Ministry was driven by the suspect met with an accident at Kottapitiya junction at Bangadeniya on Puttalam- Chilaw road early this morning (Jun 06).
 
Initial investigations revealed that the suspect was under the influence of liquor at the time of the accident.
 
The suspect had allegedly lost control of the vehicle and veered off the road ramming into a nearby house.
 
There were 4 people including 2 small children in the ill-fated house at the time of the incident.
 
However, nobody was injured at the residence.
 
The initial probe revealed that the vehicle was belonging to the Ministry of Skills Development, in which Palitha Range Bandara was the State Minister earlier.

heading: CEB engineers intensify trade union action
description:
CEB Engineers' Union says that their members will not attend emergency electricity breakdowns and repair activities from this afternoon (Jun 06).
 
The union's Chairman, Saumya Kumarawadu said the union has decided to intensify their trade union action as a mark of protest to the continuous delay of approving the Long-term Power Generation Plan by the Public Utilities Commission.
 
They began a work-to-rule campaign from 9th of May.

heading: Cause for Hema Nalin's death revealed
description:
The postmortem inquiry into the death of popular TV host and journalist Hema Nalin Karunaratne has been completed.
 
It had revealed that ruptured blood vessel in his brain and bleeding were the reasons for his demise.
 
Karunaratne died at his home in Malabe yesterday and he was 56 years old.

heading: New mobile app to track ragging in universities
description:
Minister of Higher Education and Cultural Affairs Dr. Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe says that 280 cases of harassment and sexual abuse during university ragging had been reported so far.
 
He said this introducing a new app in an attempt to prevent ragging at universities.
 
The new app was launched by the University Grants Commission in Colombo today (Jun 06).
 
The new app allows the vice chancellors and marshals at universities to track the victims of ragging.
 
Then the authorities could be informed of the incident by the victim through an SMS.

heading: Strong gusty winds predicted
description:
Met Department says due to the active south-west monsoon, the windy condition is expected to strengthen over the island and in the sea areas around the island in next few days from today (Jun 06).
 
Therefore, strong gusty winds up to 60-70 kmph can be expected in Jaffna, Mannar, Mullaitivu, Vavuniya, Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Matale, Badulla, Monaragala, Kurunegala, Puttalam, Ratnapura and Kegalle districts.
 
Fairly strong gusty winds up to 50kmph can be expected elsewhere, particularly in south-western parts of the island.

heading: Withholding tax on sale of teledramas to be abolished
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena has ordered not to charge 14% withholding tax on the sale of teledramas.
 
The President also advised the Finance Minister to inform in writing to relevant institutions not to charge it.
 
During a discussion with a group of artists, the President had pointed out that this tax has been charged as a result of misunderstanding the newly introduced tax policies.
 
The President also promised that if the new tax policies have become an obstruction to the growth of local cinema and teledrama industries, it will be rectified.

heading: SLTB to purchase 500 new buses
description:
The government is planning to enhance the bus fleet at Sri Lanka Transport Board by importing 500 new buses.
 
The relevant Cabinet paper was approved yesterday (Jun 05).
 
According to the running timetable of the SLTB, 7257 buses are needed to accomplish the passenger service properly.
 
However, as of now, the SLTB has only 6000 buses in running condition and 1560 of this fleet is more than 15 years old.
 
Accordingly, 400 buses with 50-54 high-back seats for urban service and 100 buses with 32-35 seats for rural service will be purchased.

heading: Who is responsible for Arjuna Mahendran? PM is asked
description:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says that he no longer has any responsibility with regard to the former Central Bank Governor, Arjuna Mahendran after the latter had resigned from the post.
Prime Minister Wickremesinghe made this statement while answering a question posed by the Chief Opposition Whip Anura Kumara Dissanayake in Parliament today (Jun 06).

heading: Who got money from Arjun Aloysius ?
description:
Two more parliamentarians, Minister Chandrani Bandara and MP C. B. Ratnayake told today (Jun 06) that they did not obtain money from Perpetual Treasuries owner Arjun Aloysius.
With that as of today, 57 MPs have said that they have not received money from Aloysius.
Minister Sarath Fonseka and MP Dayasiri Jayasekera accepted that they got money.
Meanwhile, the Youth Wing of the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya lodged a request with the Office of Missing Persons seeking their assistance to locate former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran.

heading: Heavy rains and winds predicted
description:
Met Department says due to the active South-west monsoon, the windy condition is expected to strengthen over the island and in the sea areas around the island in next few days.
 
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, Central and North-Western provinces.
 
Heavy falls above 100mm can be expected at some places in Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Kalutara, Galle, and Matara districts.
 
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Southern, Central, Northern, North-Central and North-Western provinces and Monaragala district.

heading: Police say Range Bandara's son will be arrested
description:
Police say since it has been proven that State Minister Palitha Range Bandara's son, Yasodha Range Bandara was under the influence of liquor at the time of this morning's accident in Bangadeniya, he will be arrested.
The police said the suspect will be arrested after submitting details to the court.
This afternoon Yasodha Range Bandara was taken to the National Hospital, Colombo for a test, thereafter he had left the hospital.
 
Related story:

heading: Rathana Thera becomes emotional
description:
Parliamentarian Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thera says that an internationally recognized legal document should be prepared to regulate Glyphosate in Sri Lanka.
The Thera said this speaking at a conference held in Colombo yesterday (Jun 05).
Ven. Rathana Thera became emotional while recalling a past incident at the conference.

heading: Indian national arrested with foreign liquor
description:
An Indian national was arrested yesterday at the Bandaranaike International Airport with 12 bottles of foreign liquor.
 
The suspect was a 21-year-old.
 
After he was apprehended police produced him before Negombo Magistrate Court.
 
He was released for a fine of Rs. 2,000.

heading: SLFP CC meets today after positions changed
description:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party Central Committee meets today (Jun 07) for the first time after the temporary appointment of the new office-bearers.
 
The meeting will take place in the afternoon, at the President’s official residence, with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.
 
The SLFP temporary office bearers were appointed last Sunday, where Prof. Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa was appointed the new General Secretary.
 
The President was re-appointed as the party Chairman, former Presidents, Mahinda Rajapaksa and Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, as well as the former Prime Minister D. M. Jayaratne, were re-elected as advisors of the party.
 
Similarly, Minister Duminda Dissanayake was elected the party’s National Organizer.

heading: Child born inside night mail train
description:
A 26-year-old mother has given birth to a baby boy inside the Batticaloa bound night mail train.
 
The incident occurred last night (Jun 06). 
The mother and the newborn were first admitted to Habarana Hospital and from there to Dambulla Hospital.
 
The mother was a resident of Kaththankudi.
 
A hospital source said that the health condition of both mother and the child is good.

heading: Water Board employees end strike
description:
The strike launched by the employees of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board citing several demands including a 25% salary hike has been suspended.
 
The Union said that they took the decision after the Subject Minister and Secretary of the Ministry agreed to look into their issues during a meeting yesterday (Jun 06).

heading: Kelaniya University to research on CKDU
description:
An agreement to establish an Information and Research Centre on Chronic Kidney Disease of unknown origin (CKDu), at the University of Kelaniya, was signed before President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat, today (Jun 05).
 
Presidential Task Force on Prevention of Kidney Diseases, Project Director Asela Iddawela and the Vice Chancellor of the University of Kelaniya Professor D. M. Semasinghe signed the agreement.
 
The agreement aims at promoting researches conducted by the University of Kelaniya regarding the Chronic Kidney Disease of unknown origin.

heading: UNP’s Ananda Kumarasiri new Deputy Speaker
description:
United National Party’s Ananda Kumarasiri was elected as the new Deputy Speaker following a secret ballot in Parliament, a short while ago.
 
He obtained 97 while MP Dr. Sudharshini Fernandopulle got 53 votes.
 
One vote was invalid.
 
The Speaker decided to go for a secret vote after the names of MP Ananda Kumarasiri and Dr. Sudharshini Fernandopulle were proposed for the post.
 
The Deputy Speaker’s post fell vacant after MP Thilanga Sumathipala resigned from the Unity Government along with 15 other SLFP MPs.

heading: Iranian foreign currency smuggler arrested (Photos)
description:
Sri Lanka Customs officials at the Bandaranaike International Airport have arrested an Iranian national who had attempted to smuggle Rs. 17 million worth of currency notes.
LKR 350,000, US $ 8,000 and Malaysian Ringits 2,000 were found in him.
The 50-year-old was to leave for Dubai.
He had told the officials that he earned that money by playing casino in Sri Lanka.

heading: Woman rescued after a suicide attempt
description:
The area residents in Chilaw were able to rescue a woman who had attempted to commit suicide by jumping into the sea.
 
Later she was admitted to Chilaw Hospital.
 
The identity of the woman is yet unknown.

heading: ETI depositors demonstrate at Parliament roundabout
description:
A group of ETI Finance depositors staged a demonstration at the Parliament roundabout today (Jun 05).
They urged to return their money.
Meanwhile, MPs Dayasiri Jayasekera and Sunil Handunetti came to meet the depositors and vowed they would take the matter to the Parliament.
The depositors have already visited the ETI head office in a number of times seeking their money.
However, they say that the ETI management is not setting their issue.
The aggrieved people have deposited billions of rupees at the ETI.
They also visited the ETI head office today as well.

heading: Hakeem & Rishad in a verbal showdown at Cabinet meeting
description:
Minister of Water Supply, Rauff Hakeem and Minister Industry and Commerce Rishad Bathiudeen have engaged in a heated argument at yesterday's (Jun 05) Cabinet meeting.
 
A difference in opinion over the resettlement in the North had led to a verbal showdown between the two Ministers, a source said.
 
When the Cabinet met under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena, the two Ministers had criticized each other, it was reported.
 
Minister Hakeem had requested that he too be included in a Ministerial Committee that oversees the resettlement of displaced in the North.
 
Then Minister Rishad Bathiudeen had said that if Minister Hakeem is added to the Committee, he would resign from it.
 
However, following an exchange of words, the President had said that all the Muslim political leaders will be convened for a meeting to discuss the matter.

heading: Drug trafficker arrested at Galewela
description:
A 26-year-old person was arrested in Galewela while transporting heroin from Colombo to Jaffna.
He was a resident of Colombo 12.
Police found 25.2g of heroin from the suspect.

heading: SLFP holds diverse views on monitoring MP’s
PHU heads to OMP requesting Arjuna Mahendran be located
description:
The Pivithuru Hela Urumaya says that a complaint will be lodged with the Office of Missing Persons today (Jun 06) requesting that former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran be located.
 
Its Youth Affairs Secretary, Sugeeshwara Bandara said that they will provide details of possible places that Mahendran is hiding to the Commission.

heading: Son of State Minister Range Bandara injured in accident, suspected of driving under influence of liquor
description:
A cab owned by a Ministry, which was driven by the son of State Minister Palitha Range Bandara had met with an accident at the Kottapitiya Junction in Bangadeniya on the Chilaw - Puttalam main road, early this morning (Jun 06).
 
The State Minister's son, Yasodha Range Bandara and another youth who were in the cab, were admitted to Chilaw Hospital with injuries.
 
The probe conducted by Arachchikattuwa Police revealed that the cab was belonging to the Ministry of Skills Development.
 
The cab which was driven at excessive speed had crashed into a house at the Kottapitiya Junction in Bangadeniya.
 
It had caused extensive damages to the house.
 
It was also revealed that the State Minister's son was under the influence of liquor at the time of the accident.

heading: Bus accident injures 12
description:
12 passengers were injured when two private buses collided at Hiriwadunna on the Habarana - Dambulla main road early this morning (Jun 06).
 
Police said one of the buses was plying from Colombo to Thirukkovil.
 
Two women were among the injured and police said the condition of 4 of the injured passengers was critical.
 
They have been transferred from Habarana Hospital to Polonnaruwa General Hospital.

heading: Husband kills wife and commits suicide in Pamunugama
description:
A 47-year-old husband in Pamunugama, Ja Ela has committed suicide after killing her wife following a family dispute.
 
The incident had happened last afternoon (Jun 05).
 
The murdered woman was aged 46.
 
The postmortems will be conducted today and Pamunugama Police is probing the incident.

heading: Galle Face entry road closed at Lotus roundabout
description: Police have closed the Galle Face entry road from Lotus roundabout due to a protest march by unemployed graduates.

heading: Date fixed for Basil's case
description:
Colombo High Court today (Jun 06) fixed 1st of November, to hear the case against former Minister Basil Rajapaksa and 3 others over allegedly misusing Rs. 2991 million.
 
Colombo High Court Judge, R. Gurusinghe ordered that 4th and 21st witnesses should be present in court on 1st of November to record evidence.
 
Former Minister Basil Rajapaksa and 3 others are accused of misusing Rs. 2991 million from Divinaguma Development Department to purchase corrugated galvanized sheets in this case.

heading: 4-year-old dies after consuming paracetamol (Photos)
description:
A 4-year-old boy had died in hospital after accidentally consuming paracetamol in Maskeliya.
 
The child's parents had noticed that the child was eating paracetamol, thinking that was peppermint, and then had taken the child to Dickoya Base Hospital.
 
Later, he was transferred to Nawalapitiya Hospital.
 
However, he had died at the hospital.

heading: “Health” to be made a compulsory subject for GCE (O/L)
description:
The Cabinet has ratified a proposal submitted by the Minister of Health, Dr. Rajitha Senaratne to make health, a compulsory subject for GCE (O/L) examination.
 
It was recommended by the Committee of Experts on Educational Reforms.
 
The proposal will be implemented subject to the approval of National Education Commission.

heading: 100,000 letters backlogged due to strike
description:
The 48-hour strike launched by the Union of Posts and Telecommunication Officers' ended at midnight yesterday (Jun 05).
 
The distribution of letters and parcels was completely stuck as a result of the trade union action and there were around 100,000 letters and parcels to be distributed.
 
They are demanding their salaries to be increased and address several other professional issues.
 
The convener of the union, Chintaka Bandara said since the authorities have broken their promises, they would commence an indefinite strike from 12th of June.

heading: Presidential Commission probing frauds at SriLankan Airlines meet again
description:
The Presidential Commission which was appointed to probe alleged malpractice and frauds at SriLankan Airlines, SriLankan Catering and Mihin Lanka met today (Jun 06) for the second day.
 
The Company Registrar General has been asked to give evidence before the Commission today.
 
President Maithripala Sirisena appointed this Commission in February this year to probe alleged malpractice and frauds at SriLankan Airlines, SriLankan Catering, and Mihin Lanka from 1st of January 2006 to 31st of January 2018.

heading: MP Sudharshini’s nomination for Deputy Speaker’s post creates divisions in JO & TNA
description:
A division was created in the Joint Opposition as well as in the Tamil National Alliance during the vote to select Deputy Speaker in Parliament yesterday (Jun 05).
 
Although the Joint Opposition and the TNA were expected to vote for MP Sudharshini Fernandopulle, some members were not present during the vote.
 
The parliamentary group leader of the Joint Opposition, Dinesh Gunawardena said that a decision was taken during the parliamentary group meeting chaired by former president Mahinda Rajapaksa, to vote for the MP Fernandopulle.
 
He stated that the reasons for failure to vote for her by several JO members should be ascertained.
 
Meanwhile, TNA MP Selvam Addaikkalanathan revealed that when the secret ballot was announced, Opposition Leader, R. Sampanthan’s statement seeking support to MP Fernandopulle was not acceptable.
 
Consequently, UNP MP, Ananda Kumarasiri who received 97 votes in the secret ballot, was elected the Deputy Speaker of Parliament.
 
 MP Fernandopulle secured only 53 votes.
 
Despite Opposition Leader recommended MP Fernandopulle for the post, TNA MPs abstained from voting.
 
The JVP also did not vote and certain Joint Opposition MPs too were absent during the vote.

heading: Paternity leave proposed during childbirth
description:
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna has made a proposal to the Parliament saying that paternity leave should be granted for fathers during childbirth.
 
This was proposed during the debate on the draft bill to streamline salaries of office and shop workers in Parliament yesterday (Jun 06).

heading: An unexpected death of a 14-year-old boy in Nittambuwa
description:
A 14-year-old boy has died when a coconut tree fell on him at Heapanakanda in Alawala in Nittambuwa.
 
The unfortunate boy was escorting his younger sibling home after a tuition class when the tragedy struck.
 
He was admitted to Wathupitiwala Hospital with serious injuries.
 
However, he died last afternoon.

heading: A list of MP's who obtained money from Aloysius does not exist says Speaker
description:
Speaker Karu Jayasuriya told in Parliament today (Jun 07) that all responsible stakeholders confirmed that there's no list of parliamentarians or other persons who had allegedly received money from PTL owner, Arjun Aloysius.
 
The Speaker also said there is no truth in reports that said 25 security personnel of the MPs' had been questioned in this regard.
 
He said that the police confirmed that there was no such questioning.
 
The Speaker added that he had informed the President's Secretary to hand over all the related documents to him and those will be collected after he returns to the country.
 
The IGP's assistance has been sought for that.
 
The Speaker made this statement after speculations were surfaced that there's a list of MP's who had obtained money from the remanded businessman.

heading: Fishermen to strike from today
description:
The All Island Fisher Community's trade union says they will not venture into the sea from today as a protest against kerosene price increase.
 
Accordingly, the fishermen from Negombo and the Southern coastal belt from Dehiwela to Beruwela will join the strike action.
 
The union's President Aruna Roshantha said the discussions they had with the authorities seeking a reduction in kerosene prices were unsuccessful.
 
He said that will launch an island-wide strike from Monday.

heading: Reckless driving kills 2 men
description:
Two persons were killed when two private buses collided at Muruthawela in Pasyala, this morning (Jun 07).
 
One of the buses was plying from Mawanella to Colombo while the other one was heading to Anuradhapura from Colombo.
 
The victims aged 22 and 32 were residents of Kegalle and Mawanella.
 
3 other passengers were admitted to Wathupitiwela Hospital.
 
After the collision, the Anuradhapura bound bus had veered off the road and crashed into the wayside shop.

heading: Four youths arrested for posting pictures of sharp objects on Facebook
description:
Dambulla Police has arrested 4 youths for posting pictures of swords, Kris knives and some other sharp objects on Facebook accounts.
 
The youths, aged between 16 and 21 years and are residents of Dambulla, Kandalama, and Cap-Ela.
 
Dambulla Police received a complaint that the group was harassing neighbours there was also a complaint of an assault.
 
Police investigations revealed that the suspects used the sharp objects in the photos to intimidate their neighbours.
 
Police have since released the suspects after having given a severe warning.

heading: Fmr Minister Sarath Kumara Gunaratne granted bail
description:
Colombo High Court today (Jun 12) granted bail to former Deputy Minister Sarath Kumara Gunaratne and 5 others over their alleged links to a financial fraud.
 
They were issued charge sheets today.
 
The suspects were released on cash sureties of Rs. 25,000 each and personal bails of Rs. 1 million each.
 
The suspects are accused of misappropriating Rs. 9 billion from Lanka Fisheries Corporation during the 2015 Presidential Election.

heading: Cache of arms and ammunition found (Photos)
description:
A cache of arms and ammunition hidden during the conflict by the LTTE cadres were detected following a tip-off.
 
The STF officials found them in an abandoned toilet pit in Puliyanpokkanai in Kilinochchi.
 
A group of people who had ventured into the area taking their cattle herds had seen the ammunition and had informed the police.
 
Our correspondents said 184 hand grenades, 35,500 T-56 ammunition, 5 claymores, 4 kg of explosives, 34 40mm mortars, and 4 RPG's were among the find.

heading: Heavy showers in Nuwara Eliya
description:
Met Department says heavy showers were reported from Nuwara Eliya district during the past 24 hours.
 
Fairly heavy showers were reported from Sabaragamuwa province and Kalutara and Kandy districts.
 
Moderate showers were reported from Colombo, Gampaha, Galle, and Matara districts.
 
Light showers were reported from North-western province and Ampara
 
Highest rainfall of 107.3 mm was reported at Norton in the Nuwara Eliya district.

heading: Viral fever shuts down Agri Faculty of Ruhunu University
description:
The Ruhunu University’s Agriculture Faculty in Mapalana has been shut down until further notice due to a viral fever, which is spreading in the region.
 
The Ruhunu University’s Vice-Chancellor, Prof. Gamini Senanayake told us that in the last few days close to 100 students fell ill due to a viral fever.
 
The professor said that health authorities have been informed of the situation.
 
Meanwhile, the Medical Superintendent of Embilipitiya Hospital N. S. Dharmathilaka says that 30 patients believed to have been suffering from influenza have been hospitalized to receive treatment.
 
Meanwhile, Sabaragamuwa Provincial Health Services Director Dr. Kapila Kannangara said that the flu which was spreading in the South is now entering the Sabaragamuwa province.

heading: CJ to be informed of Supreme Court decision on Ranjan's remarks
description:
Supreme Court bench announced that their decision on Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake's alleged defamatory remarks on judiciary will be informed to the Chief Justice.
 
This was revealed when the case was taken up before Supreme Court judges Eva Wanasundara and L. T. B. Dehideniya today (Jun 04).
 
Earlier in the day, the Additional Solicitor General Priyantha Naavana who appeared for the Attorney General informed the Supreme Court that the statement made by the Deputy Minister, at a glance is in contempt of court.
 
Earlier, the Supreme Court informed the Attorney General to express his opinion on the controversial statement made by the Deputy Minister.
 
Ranjan Ramanayake had said on several occasions that most of the judges and lawyers in Sri Lanka are corrupt.
 
He made a statement on 21st of August, 2017.
 
Thereafter, Ven. Magalkande Sudatta Thera and several others went to the Supreme Court against the Deputy Minister's statement and the case was first taken up on 14th of December.

heading: Windy condition expected to strengthen
description:
Met Department says that due to the active South-West monsoon, the windy condition is expected to strengthen over the island and in the sea areas around the island in next few days.
 
Therefore, strong gusty winds up to 60-70 kmph can be expected in Jaffna, Mannar, Mullaitivu, Vavuniya, Polonnaruwa, Kandy, Nuwara Eliya, Matale, Badulla, Ratnapura and Kegalle districts from Wednesday.
 
Fairly strong gusty winds up to 50kmph can be expected elsewhere particularly in south-western parts of the island.

heading: Preschools in Matara to be closed for one more week
description:
Matara District Preschool Association says that it has decided to extend the closure of the Matara District preschools by five days till 10th of this month due to the spread of the viral fever in the Southern Province.
Earlier the Southern Province Education Ministry had decided to close down the Southern Province pre-schools till yesterday.
However, at a media briefing yesterday, Matara District preschool Association Secretary Prince Thamaraa Manoj said that as a precautionary measure it decided to extend the period of closure of preschools in the Matara District by another five days.
According to the Sri Lanka Medical Research Institute, it is revealed that this disease condition has occurred due to the spread of Influenza A virus.
By now 12 children in the Southern Province have succumbed to this viral fever.

heading: Crucial sections of Bond Commission report given to Speaker
description:
Sections C- 350 to C-360 of the Bond Commission report, which were not released so far, have been handed over to the Speaker by President's Secretary.
The relevant sections were handed over to the Speaker's Office this morning (Jun 05).
Earlier, Speaker Jayasuriya informed the Presidential Secretariat to hand over the sections to him which were not earlier given to him.

heading: "Bharatha faction fired first, verdict given against Duminda not lawful" - President Counsels prove before court
description:
President’s Counsel, Anura Meddegoda pointed out to the Supreme Court today (June 04) that the Bharatha Lakshman’s faction first opened fire and, the second faction returned fire as the duty cast on them was to protect the life of former MP Duminda Silva.
 
He further proved before the bench of five-bench Supreme Court judges that the verdict given by the Colombo High court is not legitimate.
 
The appeal filed by former MP Duminda Silva requesting the Court to acquit him was taken for the 7th day today.
 
The bench chaired by the Chief Justice Priyasad Dep.
 
Making submissions, President Counsel Anura Meddegoda stated that although the High court verdict stated that former MP Duminda Silva ordered one of his guards to obtain a firearm, none of the witnesses has stated so.
 
Quoting the High Court verdict, the President Counsel stated that the opinion of the Court was also that former MP Duminda Silva did not brandish a gun and intimidated the voters although such an accusation had been made against the former MP.
 
Therefore he pointed out that former MP Duminda Silva should be acquitted from the charges of acting under a common agenda.
 
The President Counsel stated that another charge had been made that former MP Duminda Silva assaulted an individual, the evidence of that incident was not proved beyond reasonable doubt.
 
The President Counsel pointed out that the security guards of former MP Duminda Silva have returned fire as part of discharging their duty.
 
They did so after the first shots were fired by the Bharatha Lakshman faction.
 
He stated that the investigators have created false incidents with the intention of making former MP guilty although he is innocent in that incident.
 
The President Counsel further stated that such factors were pointed out during the trial; however, they were not analyzed before convicting the former MP.
 
The President Counsel who quoted the High Court verdict also said that the vital evidence including the Government Analyst’s reports was not analyzed before issuing the verdict.
 
President Counsel, Anura Meddegoda pointed out to the bench of Supreme Court Judges that under such circumstances, there is no any legitimacy in the verdict that convicted former MP Duminda Silva.
 
On the previous hearings, the President Counsels proved before the Supreme Court that every evidence submitted in an attempt to make former MP Duminda Silva guilty were contradictory and, the Court verdict has stated itself that none of the evidence that was given during trial could be treated as 100 percent acceptable.
 
They stated that Duminda Silva has been made guilty for some offenses that were not in the charge sheet and such action cannot be legal for whatsoever.
 
They stated that there were contradictions and omissions in the evidence that were fabricated to make former MP Duminda Silva guilty.
 
Although such contradictions and omissions were pointed out during the High Court trial, they were not properly treated before giving the verdict.
 
They further pointed out that the CID has filed forged charges against former MP Duminda Silva by creating fabricated incidents.
 
The President Counsels pointed out that former MP Duminda Silva was indicted for using firearms but no any evidence was submitted during the trial.
 
They said that the Bharatha Lakshman faction had first started the shooting where former MP Duminda Silva became a victim, that incident was neglected in giving the verdict.
 
The President Counsel said that it was proved well by sufficient evidence that former MP Duminda Silva was shot at first. However, the High Court verdict has stated that that incident was no pertinent and, it was the best example to that effect.
 
They also said that judicial medical reports have also confirmed that former MP Duminda Silva received gunshots on his forehead.
 
He said the High court verdict has been given not on the submissions or evidence made before the Court but it has been given merely on former MP Duminda Silva’s popular political recognition.
 
They said although the verdict is read one hundred thousand times, it is not possible to understand why former MP Duminda Silva has been convicted.
 
Therefore the president counsels proved before the Supreme Court that the High court verdict that convicted former MP Duminda Silva is not legitimate at all.
 
They said the High court judge has given the verdict, without examining whether the evidence is proved beyond reasonable doubt but based on the opinions submitted by the state counsels.
 
The President Counsels further pointed out before the Supreme Court that the High Court has ignored the submissions made by the Duminda Silva faction or the defence submissions and, has conducted the trial based on the fictitious incidents and evidence.
