President Counsel Anuja Premarathna further said before the bench of five Supreme Court Judges that under these circumstances, penalizing former MP Duminda Silva under any charge is unlawful.
 
When the Case was taken up for hearing on previous occasions, President Counsel Anuja Premarathna said that the verdict against former MP Duminda Silva has been given neither on the evidence nor on the facts but based on his personality as a popular political icon.
 
He said that although the verdict is read one hundred thousand times, it is not possible to understand why former MP Duminda Silva has been convicted.
 
President Counsel Anuja Premarathna proved before the bench of five-member Supreme Court Judges that the verdict that convicted former MP Duminda Silva is not truly genuine.
 
Meanwhile, President Counsel Anil de Silva stated that the verdict given by the Colombo High Court is full of shortcomings.
 
He said that the verdict has been given by the Judge solely based on the submissions made by the State Counsels. She has failed to scrutinize whether such evidence was proved beyond reasonable doubt.
 
The President Counsel pointed out before the Supreme Court that former MP Duminda Silva was accused of using firearms but no evidence was given during the trial to prove such charges.
 
He pointed out that the shooting at Duminda Silva was instigated by Bharatha Lakshman faction. However such action was completely overlooked by the Judge when she had given her verdict.
 
President Counsel Anil de Silva further pointed out before the Supreme Court that the High Court has ignored the say by the former MP Duminda Silva faction or the submissions by the Defence and, has conducted the trial based on the fictitious incidents and evidence.
 
He said that this Case was filed to tarnish the image of former MP Duminda Silva, therefore, his client has been denied a justifiable trial similar to that of any other citizen is entitled to in this Case.
 
Therefore, President Counsel Anil de Silva requested the Supreme Court to overrule the verdict that contravened the law to sentence former MP Duminda Silva and, acquit him from all the charges.
 
The appeal will be called again on May 14th.

heading: 37-year-old dies under mysterious circumstances in Moratuwa
description:
Police have found a body of a 37-year-old man from a ditch in Willorawatte in Moratuwa.
 
The body was detected this morning (May 14) after police were informed about it.
 
The deceased person was a resident of Moratuwa, Molpewatte.
 
The relatives of the deceased say they suspect foul play in the death.

heading: Police roundup over 2050 persons
description:
Police say 2051 persons were arrested following an island-wide special operation carried out from 11 pm yesterday to 3 am today (May 12).
 
1329 wanted persons, 151 criminal suspects, and 571 others were also arrested.

heading: Container operators increase transport charge by 15%
description:
Lanka United Container Transporters’ Association says that container transport charges will be increased by 15 percent due to the increase in fuel prices.
 
The President of the Association Sanath Manjula said that the new charges will come in to effect from 20th of this month.
 
Meanwhile, the Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association had also called for a 10 percent increase in bus fares following the fuel price hike.
 
The three-wheeler operators also increased the fare for the first kilometre from Rs. 50 to 60.

heading: Thundershowers predicted to hit some provinces
description:
Met Department says due to a disturbance in the atmosphere heavy rains could hit Southern, Central, Sabaragamuwa and Western provinces in the morning today (May 13).
 
The Department warns thundershowers could exceed 100mm in certain areas.
 
People are requested to take precautions over heavy winds and lightning hazards.

heading: Family dispute kills 5-month-old infant boy
description:
Police say a 5-month-old little boy died at Badulla Hospital after he was hit by his father with a club.
 
According to reports, between 9 am and 11 am today (May 12), a family dispute had erupted at a house in Kandeketiya between a husband and his wife.
 
Then the man had attempted to hit the wife with a club, but it had hit the little boy who was with his mother.
 
The little boy was first admitted to Kandeketiya Hospital and thereafter he was sent to Badulla General Hospital.
 
But he died upon admitting to the hospital.
 
The postmortem will be held tomorrow. The suspect, the victim's father had fled the area.




Investigations are underway to arrest him.

heading: Subjects & functions of Ministries gazetted
description:
The Government Printer says that the Gazette notification on amended subjects and functions of the Ministries had been published last night (May 12).
19 institutions including some that were previously under the purview of the Ministries of Education and Internal Affairs and Wayamba Development, have been assigned under the Ministry of Higher Education and Cultural Affairs. 
 Meanwhile, the Employees’ Trust Fund which was initially under the purview of the Ministry of National Policies and Economic Affairs and later assigned to the Ministry of Youth Affairs, Project Management and Southern Development, has now been assigned under the Ministry of Labour and Trade Union Relations.

heading: Flashfloods hit Galle, roads inundated
description:
Several roads in Galle have gone underwater as a result of the incessant rain, the Disaster Management Center said.
 
The DMC also said that the traffic on the Passara - Namunukula road has been restricted due to fall of rocks on to the road.
 
Meanwhile, 8 line-homes in an estate in Pindeniya, Kandy were damaged last evening after a huge tree fell on them.
 
The DMC said 2 teenage girls suffered injuries and they were hospitalized.
 
The occupants of the houses, 45 persons have been given alternative shelters.

heading: Fmr. Defence Secretary says no one can stop their journey
description:
Former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa says one's forward march cannot be stopped by undertaking arrests.
 
He said this following a religious event at the Godakawela Mahindarama Temple in Embilipitiya today (May 12).
 
When journalists asked him whether he would contest forthcoming Presidential Election, he said that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa would take a decision on that.
 
Meanwhile, former Minister W. D. J. Seneviratne joining the event said that he said 2 years ago that Gotabhaya Rajapaksa is suitable for the party's leadership.

heading: Protesters block Tangalle - Hambantota main road
Podujana Peramuna challenges Govt. to hold Provincial Council Election
description:
Former Minister, who is a member of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna, Basil Rajapaksa says before having discussions of the Presidential Election, that the government should hold the Provincial Council Election.
 
He said this following a meeting in Dehiwela yesterday (May 13).

heading: Hiru CIA exposes job racket, woman arrested
STF detect 1kg of heroin in Palai, Jaffna
description:
A Special Task Force team from Rajagiriya, Colombo camp apprehended 2 persons in Palai, Jaffna with 1 kilogram of heroin.
The raid was carried out following a tip-off.
The STF team also apprehended a van which was allegedly used to traffic narcotics.
The suspects, aged 27 and 37 are residents of Jaffna.

heading: Private bus operators demand fare hike, threaten to launch a strike
description:
All Island Private Bus Owners’ Federation says it will launch a strike from Wednesday if bus fares not increased by 20%.
 
They also demand to increase the minimum charge, which is Rs. 10 now to Rs. 15.

heading: 10-year-old girl drowns in Passara
description:
Police say a 10-year-old girl died after she had drowned in a canal in the Egodagala area in Passara.
 
It was reported she had attempted to cross a canal with her mother and both of them were carried away by strong currents.
 
The area residents had rescued them, but the little girl had died upon admission to hospital in Passara.
 
The victim was returning home after attending a tuition class when the tragedy struck yesterday (May 12).

heading: Kerosene subsidy from June 1
description:
The Ministry of Finance says the kerosene subsidy will be given to Samurdhi beneficiaries without electricity as well as to the estate community.
Accordingly, the Ministry noted that the first installment of the kerosene concession will be paid to the Samadhi beneficiaries without electricity from 1st of June.
The Ministry of Finance also noted that the concession will be given to fishermen as well.
Meanwhile, a group of fishermen staged a protest this morning obstructing the Tangalle – Hambantota main road in Gurupokuna – Hungama against the recent hike in fuel prices.
The protesters emphasized that the increase in fuel prices is unfair to the fishing community.
Meanwhile, Minister of Power and Renewable Energy Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said no decision has been taken to increase the electricity rates even though the fuel prices were revised in line with the rising prices of crude oil.

heading: Presidents of Sri Lanka and Iran meet in Teheran
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena who is in Iran has met with his Iranian counterpart Hassan Rouhani in Teheran this afternoon (May 13).
 
The representatives of Sri Lanka and Iran signed new MoUs to further strengthen economic and trade ties between the two countries.

heading: Public urged to be vigilant for lightning hazards
description:
Heavy falls, about 100mm can be expected at some places, particularly in Central, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, Uva and Western provinces and in Polonnaruwa and Vavuniya districts.
The Met Department said there may be temporary localized strong winds during thundershowers.
The general public is requested to take adequate precautions to minimize damages caused by lightning activity.

heading: Supreme Court rejects Udayanga's petition
description:
The fundamental rights petition filed by former ambassador to Russia, Udayanga Weeratunga, seeking an order to make null and void an arrest warrant that was issued against him, was rejected by the Supreme Court today (May 11).
The FR petition was taken up before a 3-member bench of Sisira de Abrew, Nalin Perera and Buwaneka Aluwihare.
The arrest warrant against Weeratunga was issued by the Fort Magistrate Court over the MIG deal.

heading: Private bus owners demand a fare hike, more than 10 percent
GMOA to launch one day strike on May 17
Cabinet paper to affiliate 980 SAITM students to KDU
SLFP's "Group of 16" meets Cardinal Ranjith
description:
Several representatives of the SLFP group including the 16 MPs who recently resigned from the government met with His Eminence Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith in Colombo this morning (May 11).
S. B. Dissanayake, Anuradha Jayarathna, Thilanga Sumathipala, Susil Premajayantha, Lakshman Yapa Abeywardana, Sudarshani Fernandopulle, Sumedha G Jayasene, W. D. J. Senevirathna, Chandima Weerakkody and T. B. Ekanayake were among the MPs who joined the delegation.
The MPs had explained their future course of actions to His Eminence.
Meanwhile, following the meeting, MP Dissanayake said that only they would decide of their future.

heading: Shantha Bandara appointed STC chairman
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena has appointed former Deputy Minister Shantha Bandara as the new Chairman of the State Timber Corporation.
He had received his appointment letter from President this afternoon (May 11).
Bandara was appointed after President decided to sack Anuruddha Polgampola yesterday after he was appointed 6 days ago.

heading: 2017 AL recorrection results issued
Another archaeological site bulldozed in Dibulagala
Minister warns not to sell fertilizer for higher prices
description:
Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera says that strict legal action will be taken against anyone who attempted to sell subsidized fertilizer for higher prices.
 
The subsidized price of a sack of fertilizer is fixed at 1500 rupees.
 
Issuing a statement the Minister said that paddy farmers can obtain a sack of fertilizer from the Agrarian Service Centres for 500 rupees under the fertilizer subsidy.
 
He further noted that farmers who cultivate other crops can purchase a sack of fertilizer for 1500 rupees from the market.
The government has set aside Rs. 32.5 billion for fertilizer subsidy in 2018.

heading: CBSL Governor says studying taking over of Samurdhi Bank
description:
Central Bank Governor Indrajith Coomaraswamy says that he's studying as to how Central Bank could take over Samurdhi Bank, as suggested by the Prime Minister.
He said this addressing a media conference at the Central Bank this morning.

heading: Office on Missing Persons commences public consultations
description:
The Office of Missing Persons is launching a series of regional-level public consultations to gather details of missing persons, commencing in Mannar from today (May 12).
 
Consultations will be held with the families of missing and disappeared persons as well as from the activists, professionals and organizations working on the issue.
 
Within the next few weeks, the OMP will visit the districts of Matara, Trincomalee, Mullaitivu, Kandy, Kilinochchi, Jaffna, Batticaloa and Amparai.

heading: Rising prices of goods troubling masses, MR says
description:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the rising commodity prices are troubling the masses.
 
The former President said this responding to journalists after an event at a temple in Bandaragama yesterday (May 11).

heading: President says it is unethical to use war heroes to get political mileage
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena says if a certain political party uses war heroes to gain their political mileage, it is unethical.
 
The President made these remarks unveiling the ‘Wayamba Rana Abhiman’ War Heroes’ monument in Kurunegala, yesterday (May 11).
 
The new monument was established to replace the previous war heroes’ monument which was removed due to the Kurunegala- Dambulla Main Road Development Project.
 
This war memorial displays all the names of the war heroes of the North-Western Province who sacrificed their lives to protect the motherland.
 
The entire project has been completed at a cost of 27 million rupees by the Army’s Engineering Services Corps.
 
President Sirisena addressing the gathering further said that the present government has not work to undermine the war heroes and always tries to ensure their rights are protected considering their services to the nation.
 
The President while rejecting the accusations against the government regarding the war heroes, said that all these statements are meant to make the government uncomfortable.
 
Even though the government is accused of soldier victimization the real soldier victimization occurred during the past régime, the President said.

heading: Polonnaruwa irrigation engineer attacked
description:
Police have arrested one person for assaulting the irrigation engineer of Polonnaruwa.
 
Later, the suspect was produced before the Polonnaruwa Magistrate and was remanded until 15 of this month.
 
The engineer was assaulted last morning (May 11) when he visited the forest reserve of Canal 2 in Polonnaruwa to remove an unauthorized construction.
 
The injured engineer was admitted to Polonnaruwa General Hospital.
 
The State Services Engineers' Union said they will launch a trade union action against this incident on Monday.
 
The President of the Union, D. Abeysiriwardena said if relevant legal action is not taken against the attackers they would definitely commence trade union actions.

heading: Thundershowers & lightning predicted
description:
The Met Department says the possibility for afternoon thundershowers is still high over the island.
Showers or thundershowers will occur over most provinces of the island, particularly after 2 pm.
Showers will occur in Western and Southern provinces and in Puttalam district during the morning too.
Heavy falls, about 100mm can be expected at some places, particularly in Western, Central, Southern and Uva provinces and in Ampara, Batticaloa and Kurunegala districts.
Misty conditions can be expected at some places in the Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces during the morning.
There may be temporary localized strong winds during thundershowers.
The general public is requested to take adequate precautions to minimize damages caused by lightning activity.
The Met Office also said that showers or thundershowers will occur in the sea areas off the coast extending from Puttalam to Pottuvil via
Colombo and Galle.
Showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in other sea areas in the evening or night.
Heavy falls can be expected at some places in the sea areas off the coast extending from Puttalam to Galle via Colombo.
Temporarily very strong gusty winds (up to 70-80 
) and rough seas can be expected during thundershowers.

heading: President Sirisena leaves for Iran
Joseph Michel Perera says 'will not quit politics'
description:
Former Senior Minister of the United National Party, Joseph Micheal Perera refuted claims made by certain media institutions that he was quitting politics.
Perera said this when we contacted him to get a clarification.
Earlier, at a special Working Committee Meeting of the UNP, the former Minister made a statement that we would resign from the Working Committee to protest the appointment of MP Ravi Karunanayake as the Assistant Leader of the party.

heading: SAITM students urged them to be enrolled to KDU
description:
A group of SAITM students staged a demonstration in Colombo this morning (May 10).
 
Thereafter, they marched towards the Presidential Secretariat demanding that they are enrolled to the Kotelawela Defence University.
 
Police closed the Galle Face entry road but allowed a representative from the demonstrators to hand over a letter to an official of the Presidential Secretariat.
 
Thereafter, the students ended their demonstration.

heading: Arjun Aloysius & Kasun Palisena further remanded
description:
The owner of Perpetual Treasuries Arjun Aloysius and its CEO Kasun Palisena have been further remanded till 24th of May.
 
The suspects who are accused of Central Bank bond scam were produced before Colombo Fort Magistrate today (May 10).
 
The Magistrate has also ordered the Inland Revenue Department to hand over details of income and assets of the PTL to the IGP.

heading: Immigration & Emigration Act to be amended
description:
The Cabinet has decided to amend the current Immigration & Emigration Act in order to meet the present requirements.
 
It was recommended by a special committee, which consisted experts, appointed to study the required changes.
 
Thereafter, the Department of Immigration and Emigration prepared a report based on that, mentioning the regulations that should be included in the new Act.

heading: Long queues near fuel stations block Colombo roads
description:
Heavy traffic has been reported on several roads in Colombo and suburbs.
 
Our correspondents said it has been created due to long queues near fuel stations.

heading: SLHRC records over 100 statements over Kandy incident
description:
The Sri Lanka Human Rights Commission has recorded statements from more than 100 individuals with regard to the recent clashes in Digana, Akurana and Ambathanna areas in the Kandy district.
The Chairperson of the SLHRC, Dr Deepika Udugama said that statements were recorded for 3 consecutive days and vital facts were gathered during the process.

heading: Lanka IOC increases fuel prices
description:
Lanka IOC says in line with the fuel price increase of CPC, they will also increase the prices with effect from tomorrow (May 11).
 
When we contacted, a Spokesperson at the Lanka IOC confirmed the price hike.
 
Meanwhile, Minister Rajitha Senaratne told the weekly Cabinet briefing, the fuel prices of CPC will be increased effective midnight today.
 
He said accordingly a litre of Octane 92 petrol has been increased by Rs. 20 to Rs. 137.
 
A litre of Octane 95 petrol will be sold at Rs. 148, with an increase of Rs. 20.
 
A litre of auto diesel has been increased by Rs. 14 to Rs. 109 and a litre of super diesel has been increased by Rs. 9 to Rs. 119.
 
According to the new price hike, a litre of kerosene oil, which was sold at Rs. 44, will be sold at Rs. 101, an increase of Rs. 57.

heading: Leopards roaming in Hatton (Photos)
description:
The villagers of Kudagama in Hatton say that they are again threatened by leopards.
 
The villagers say they have noticed that several leopards are roaming in their village and a number of domestic dogs are also missing.
 
Around 300 families are living in this village.
 
They urge the authorities to chase these leopards to forest reserves as their day to day life is affected.

heading: Suspected bank robber arrested
description:
Police have arrested a suspect who had allegedly linked to the recent robberies in banks and jewellery shops.
 
Police said that the suspect was arrested in the Kiribathgoda area.
The suspect had arrived at a bank branch in Wattala on a motorcycle this afternoon.
However, when a security guard had confronted him, the suspect had fled the area.
Then the bank staff had alerted the police about the suspect and his motorcycle.
The initial investigations revealed that the suspect was a 42-year-old, resident of Iriyawetiya, Kiribathgoda, Kelaniya.
Police have also found a packet of chilli powder in the possession of the suspect.

heading: Lanka IOC fuel prices also increased
description:
With the increase of fuel prices by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, Lanka Indian Oil Company also decided to increase its fuel prices by midnight yesterday (May 10).
Accordingly, the revised price of 92 octane petrol stands at 137 rupees per litre, while 95 octane petrol price per litre stands at 151 rupees at Lanka IOC sheds.
A spokesperson for the company noted that the prices of Auto Diesel have been increased to 111 rupees while super diesel has been increased to 119 rupees per litre.
Lanka IOC increased fuel prices recently as well.
Effective from midnight last night, the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation also increased their fuel prices.
The price of petrol was increased by 20 rupees per litre.
Auto diesel increased by 14 rupees per litre and Super Diesel by 9 rupees per litre.
As a result of the price increases, the Octane 92 increased from 117 rupees to 137 rupees per litre, Octane 95 increased from 128 rupees to 148 rupees per litre, a litre of auto diesel increased from 95 to 109 rupees and super diesel will now sell at 119 rupees per litre.
Additionally, the price of a litre of kerosene increased to 101 rupees, which is a price hike of 57 rupees per litre.

heading: Anuruddha Polgampala loses STC chairmanship
description:
Government sources say that the appointment of Anuruddha Polgampala as State Timber Corporation Chairman has been cancelled.
Polgampola was appointed as the STC Chairman on 4th of May.

heading: Verdict given against Duminda not lawful, verdict states evidence could not be accepted as 100% correct
description:
Verdict given against Duminda not lawful"
The President Counsels proved before the Supreme Court today (May 10) that the verdict given by the Colombo High Court against former MP Duminda Silva is not lawful.
 
When the Appeal made by former MP Duminda Silva was taken up for consideration today, his President Counsels pointed out that the evidence in every incident that was given to make former MP Duminda Silva guilty are contradictory.
 
They said that the verdict itself states that the evidence given by the witnesses could not be accepted as 100% correct.
 
The Appeal which has been filed by former MP Duminda Silva, requesting the Court to acquit him was taken up for consideration for a 4th day today.
 
It was taken up before a bench of five Supreme Court Judges headed by Chief Justice Priyasad Dep.
 
Making submissions, President Counsel, Anuja Premarathna said that no explanation was made in the verdict about the shortcomings and the contradictions that were found in the false evidence which had been fabricated intending to convict former MP Duminda Silva.
 
Referring to previous judgments, the President Counsel said that the care should be taken when a person is made guilty based on evidence that has shortcomings and contradictions.
 
President Counsel Anuja Premarathna said previous judgments are generally adopted in the judicial tradition, but former MP Duminda Silva has been convicted without taking such traditions into consideration.
 
He repeatedly proved before the Supreme Court that the evidence in every incident that was given to make former MP Duminda Silva guilty are contradictory.
 
The President Counsel said that the verdict itself states that the evidence given by the witnesses could not be accepted as 100% correct.
 
President Counsel Anuja Premarathna further said before the bench of five Supreme Court Judges that under these circumstances, penalizing former MP Duminda Silva under any charge is unlawful.
 
When the Case was taken up for hearing on previous occasions, President Counsel Anuja Premarathna said that the verdict against former MP Duminda Silva has been given neither on the evidence nor on the facts but based on his personality as a popular political icon.
 
He said that although the verdict is read one hundred thousand times, it is not possible to understand why former MP Duminda Silva has been convicted.
 
President Counsel Anuja Premarathna proved before the bench of five-member Supreme Court Judges that the verdict that convicted former MP Duminda Silva is not truly genuine.
 
Meanwhile, President Counsel Anil de Silva stated that the verdict given by the Colombo High Court is full of shortcomings.
 
He said that the verdict has been given by the Judge solely based on the submissions made by the State Counsels. She has failed to scrutinize whether such evidence was proved beyond reasonable doubt.
 
The President Counsel pointed out before the Supreme Court that former MP Duminda Silva was accused of using firearms but no evidence was given during the trial to prove such charges.
 
He pointed out that the shooting at Duminda Silva was instigated by Bharatha Lakshman faction. However such action was completely overlooked by the Judge when she had given her verdict.
 
President Counsel Anil de Silva further pointed out before the Supreme Court that the High Court has ignored the say by the former MP Duminda Silva faction or the submissions by the Defence and, has conducted the trial based on the fictitious incidents and evidence.
 
He said that this Case was filed to tarnish the image of former MP Duminda Silva, therefore, his client has been denied a justifiable trial similar to that of any other citizen is entitled to in this Case.
 
Therefore, President Counsel Anil de Silva requested the Supreme Court to overrule the verdict that contravened the law to sentence former MP Duminda Silva and, acquit him from all the charges.
 
The Appeal will be called again on May 14th.

heading: Train travel along the Kandy line disrupted
description:
A strike launched by railway station masters and staff last night (May 10), resulted in a halt in train services along the upcountry line beyond Rambukkana.
The Railways Main Control Room said that train journeys to Badulla and Kandy- Matale have been completely disrupted.
The night's mail train plying from Badulla to Colombo and from Colombo Fort to Badulla had also terminated its journeys near Nawalapitiya train station, early this morning.
Commuters were greatly inconvenienced as a result of the Rambukkana railway station being closed early this morning without advance warning.
Recently a discrepancy in wages, led train controllers, station masters and train drivers to engage in another strike action which was later postponed following discussions.

heading: Three wheeler charges increased
Three-wheeler fares increased by Rs. 10
description:
The three-wheeler trade unions have decided to raise the fare as a consequence of the government's decision to raise fuel prices.
it has been decided that the fare for the first kilometre will increase from Rs. 50 to 60 rupees.
The Unions decided to refrain from revising the fare for the remainder of the hire.
Issuing a communique, the All Island Three-WheelerOperators' Trade Union said that their services could not continue without raising the fare.
Meanwhile, the Lanka Private Bus Owners' Association said that as a consequence of the increase in fuel prices, the bus fares also needed to be hiked.
The President of the association Gamunu Wijeratne told our news team that a decision regarding this would be taken after their Executive Committee meets, which will take place today (May 11).

heading: Fuel price to be revised every 2 months
description:
Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera says with the implementation of the fuel pricing mechanism, the prices of fuel could be increased or decreased every 2 months.
 
The new fuel pricing mechanism was approved by the Cabinet yesterday (May 09).
 
Addressing the media, the Minister also said that 2.5% tax on children's savings accounts will be withdrawn.
 
He also said that writers royalty fee from publishers will be tax-free up to Rs. 50,000 monthly or Rs. 500,000 per annum.

heading: Minister confesses to flashing a pistol to get financial allocations
description:
State Minister of Irrigation and Water Resource Management Palitha Range BaMinisterde a statement that he had to flash a pistol, to convince the authorities to allocate Rs. 38 million towards the construction of the Aanamaduwa Technical College.
The statement was made yesterday (May 10) during the launching of the Deduru Oya- Sengal Oya project.

heading: Up-country train strike ends
description:
The strike launched last night by the staff of railway stations within the Nawalapitiya Operation Unit has been suspended.
The decision was taken after Railway General Manager agreed to discuss their issues.
The meeting will be held at 9 am today (May 11).
They have launched the strike after disciplinary action was taken against a railway worker attached to the Watagoda Station.
As a result of the strike, train services on the up-country line beyond Rambukkana were disrupted.

heading: Trinco 'Thel Kumara' shot death
description:
A 45-year-old person who was in a stationary lorry in the Sirimapura area in Trincomalee has been gunned down.
Police said that three assailants arrived in a car had committed the crime and fled the area.
The victim was Hendavitharana Selin Kumara, alias 'Thel Kumara'.
The body is kept at Trincomalee Hospital.
Police said the reason for the shooting is yet to be ascertained.

heading: Another minister sworn in today (Photos)
CEB states no decision on increasing electricity rates
Special Commodity Levy on dhal increased
description:
Finance Ministry says that the Special Commodity Levy on imported dhal was increased from today (May 09).
 
Accordingly, the SCL which was on Rs. 1 for a kilo of 'whole dhal' has been increased by Rs.6 to Rs. 7.
 
Meanwhile, the SCL on split dhal has been increased by Rs.9 per kilo from Rs, 3 to Rs. 12.
The new levy revision will be effective for 6 months, the Finance Ministry said.

heading: National Audit Bill gets Supreme Court's ratification
description:
Speaker Karu Jayasuriya informed the Parliament today (May 09) that the Supreme Court has conveyed that the National Audit Bill is consistent with the constitution.
 
The Speaker announced this when the parliamentary session began this afternoon.
 
Meanwhile, a minor fire broke out in the official room of Minister Gamini Jayawickrema Perera before the proceedings began.
 
The fire was doused by the fire unit of the Parliament.
 
The fire has broken out due to a technical fault in an air conditioner.

heading: Judicature Amendment Bill being debated
description:
The Judicature Amendment Bill is being debated in Parliament now (May 09).
 
The Bill facilitates the setting up of a permanent High Court-at-Bar to hear cases mainly coming under the Penal Code, Money Laundering Act, Bribery Act and cases coming under Public Properties Act.

heading: "Thel Kumara" shot dead in Trincomolee
IUSF protest closes road from Ward Place
description:
Police have closed the Ward Place road due to a protest march by Inter-University Students Federation.
Our correspondent said that heavy traffic is reported from the Town Hall area and nearby roads as a result.

heading: A/L student assaults doctor accusing him of not treating his mother properly
description:
An advanced level student in Galle has assaulted a ward doctor of the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital this afternoon (May 09).
 
The student had attacked the doctor accusing him of not treating his mother properly.
 
The student was attending the needs of his mother, who was being treated at the hospital.
 
When contacted, the GMOA branch of the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital said that the patient was to be transferred to another ward for further treatment, and the student had attacked the doctor without knowing it.
 
However, the suspect was arrested by the Hospital Police and he will be produced before courts tomorrow.

heading: CID investigates a strange post on President’s Twitter account
description:
The Criminal Investigation Department has initiated an investigation on a strange post published on the Twitter Account of President Maithripala Sirisena.
However, President’s Media Unit stated that it cannot confirm yet whether the President’s Official Twitter Account is hacked or not.
An excerpt of the speech made by the President at the inauguration of the second session of the 8th Parliament was published on his Official Twitter page yesterday (May 08).
However, another post which contradicted the President’s speech was published on his Official Twitter page.
The abnormal post was withdrawn shortly.
The President’s Media Unit stated that the CID has initiated an investigation with regard to the strange post published without the knowledge of the administrator.

heading: Police use tear gas & water cannon to disperse IUSF protest
description:
Police have used tear gas and water cannon to disperse the members of the Inter-University Student Federation in Ward Place, a short while ago.
 
The police used teargas and water cannon when the undergraduates attempted to enter University Grants Commission.
 
The IUSF began their protest march from Kelani University this afternoon.
 
They were protesting against the SAITM.

heading: Unauthorized constructions in tourism hotspots to be removed
description:
The Department of Coastal Conservation says that steps would be taken within next month to demolish the unauthorized constructions in the Weligama – Mirissa, Dehiwela - Mt. Lavinia and Negombo coastal belts.
 
B. K. Prabath Chandrakeerthi, the Director General of the Department of Coastal Conservation said that the demolitions will be carried out with the assistance of police and other relevant government institutions.

heading: Six female undergraduates hospitalized
description:
Six female undergraduates who were injured police used tear gas and water cannon on anti-SAITM protest march organized by Inter-University Students' Front are receiving treatment at the Colombo National Hospital.
 
A hospital spokesperson said their condition is not serious.
 
Police used tear gas and water cannon when a protest march organized by IUSF attempted to reach the University Grants Commission in Ward Place.

heading: Rs. 10mn worth gold detected at BIA (Photos)
description:
Police have arrested a resident of Kandy who had attempted to smuggle in 2.1kg of gold from Singapore.
 
Upon inspecting his baggage, police detected the gold biscuits each weighing around 100g.
 
The estimated value was Rs. 10 million.

heading: Heavy traffic in Peliyagoda, police obtain court order against IUSF protest
description:
Police say heavy traffic is prevailing in the Peliyagoda area due to a protest march organized by Inter-University Student Front.
 
The protest march is held against the SAITM.
 
It began from the University of Kelaniya and they will reach Colombo this evening.
Meanwhile, the court has issued an order against the IUSF not to disrupt public or traffic movement during their protest.
The police said they are also barred from entering government offices.

heading: Facebook fraudster arrested in Polonnaruwa
description:
Polonnaruwa Crime Prevention Unit has arrested a youth who had swindled money through the Facebook, entering into the accounts of others.
 
The suspect had logged into accounts of others and then collected money as friends of the account holder via Easy cash.
 
The suspect was a 19-year-old, resident of Moonamaldeniya.

heading: CEB engineers' strike continues
description:
The work-to-rule campaign launched by the Ceylon Electricity Board's Engineers' Union is continuing.
 
They launched their trade union action charging that the Public Utilities Commission is delaying the approval of Long-term Power Generation Plan submitted by the CEB.
 
The Union's President Saumya Kumarawadu said they will continue the trade union action until the issue is resolved.
 
Meanwhile, electricity breakdowns were reported from several parts of the island.

heading: Judicature (Amendment) Bill passed
description:
The second reading of the Judicature Amendment Bill passed in Parliament with amendments.
The second reading of the bill got 119 votes in favour while 52 MPs voted against.
The 16 SLFP Ministers who resigned from the government voted against the bill.

heading: New mechanism to disperse Samurdhi benefits
description:
Minister Gayantha Karunathillake says since there are accusations that unsuitable persons are enjoying Samurdhi benefits, the government is considering to introduce a new mechanism to identify beneficiaries to disperse Samurdhi.
Meanwhile, All Ceylon Samurdhi and Assistant Agriculture Development Officers' Union said if the proposal to take the Samurdhi Development Bank under the purview of the Central Bank is not withdrawn within 2 weeks, a series of protests will be organized in future.

heading: Rtd. Customs Inspector arrested with gold at BIA
description:
Retired Customs inspector aged 65 from Ja-Ela area has been apprehended by the Bandaranaike International Airport Customs with 2.45kgs of gold jewellery.
 
The estimated value was Rs. 14 million. The gold was hidden inside a worn waste girdle.
 
According to the preliminary investigations these gold had been brought from Dubai by a smuggler and handed over to the suspect.

heading: Youth knifed to death in Tangalle
description:
One person was knifed to death following a dispute between 2 factions in Tangalle.
The incident had occurred last afternoon (May 09).
The victim, aged 23 was a resident of Beliatta road, Tangalle.
No suspect has been identified.

heading: Remaining SLFP MP’s invited to join "Group of 16"
description:
The National Organization Collective invites the remaining parliamentarians of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party to quit the Unity Government and join with the 16 MPs who resigned from the government.
 
The National Organizer of the Collective, Dr. Gunadasa Amarasekera makes the open invitation addressing the media in Colombo today (May 10).

heading: Money lender murdered in Thanamalwila (Photos)
description:
Thanamalwila Police say a group of unidentified persons have attacked a 40-year-old person with sharp objects while the victim was travelling on a motorcycle on the Kalthota - Bodagama main road in Thanamalwila.
 
The attack, which took place last evening, targeted a father of 2, a resident of Sevanagala.
 
Police said the victim was undertaking a small-scale business and he was also lending money to needy persons in and around Hambegamuwa.
 
Police investigations are underway.

heading: Fuel prices increased from midnight
description:
Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Rajitha Senaratne says it was decided to increase the fuel prices during a special Cabinet meeting last night (May 09).
 
Addressing the media, the Minister said accordingly the prices will be increased with effect from midnight today.
 
The new CPC prices will be:

heading: First Cabinet meeting after reshuffle, today
description:
The cabinet is scheduled to meet for the first time today (May 09) since the recent cabinet reshuffle.
 
Government sources say that protocol normally has been to have cabinet discussions held on Tuesdays.
 
However since the inauguration of the new session of Parliament took place yesterday, the Cabinet meeting was required to be rescheduled for today.
 
Priority will be given at the meeting to discussions regarding the next steps to be taken by the Good Governance Government.
 
In addition, attention will also be drawn to the issue concerning the Deputy Speaker post.
 
MP Thilanga Sumathipala resigned from the post last month.
 
Meanwhile, the Parliament is scheduled to meet at 1 pm today.

heading: Little girl dies after falling into a pit
description:
Police say a little girl aged 1 year and 9 months has fallen into a pit filled with water and died in the Matikotuwa area in Dankotuwa.
The incident had occurred this morning (May 12).
It was reported that the pit was dug behind the house to collect waste water from the bathroom.

heading: Decision on train strike to be taken this afternoon !
description:
The Railway Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union says they have decided to postpone their planned strike until this afternoon (May 09).
The union said the decision was taken on the request by government committee appointed to resolve their problems.
The Secretary of the union Indika Dodangoda said that a discussion was held last afternoon with Minister Sarath Amunugama, the chairman of the committee appointed to solve the issues faced by railway employees.
The locomotive operators earlier said that the authorities are reluctant to solve their pending salary issue and thus they decided to move ahead with the planned strike.
Meanwhile, Minister of Power and Renewable Energy Ranjith Siyambalapitiya requested that the work -to -rule trade union action launched last afternoon by CEB engineers be brought to an end.
The trade union action was launched accusing the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka of delaying the approval of Long-term Power Generation Plan submitted by the CEB.
The Minister said that a mixed power generation plan relevant to this would be presented to Cabinet and approval will be obtained today (May 09).

heading: Locomotive drivers postpone strike
description:
The Railway Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union says they have decided to postpone their planned strike until tomorrow (May 09) afternoon.
 
The union said the decision was taken on the request by government committee appointed to resolve their problems.
 
The locomotive operators earlier said that the authorities are reluctant to solve their pending salary issue and thus they decided to move ahead with the planned strike.

heading: Fire destroys storage at BIA
description:
A fire broke out at around 4 this morning (May 09) in a storage unit belonging to one of the duty-free shops at Katunayake airport.
 
Police said that no one was hurt in the incident.
 
The fire has been contained, however, the items that were stored in the unit were severely damaged.
 
The value of the damage is yet to be ascertained.

heading: JO to go to IPU over Opposition Leader's post
description:
The Joint Opposition is planning to lodge a complaint with the Inter-Parliamentary Union regarding the post of Opposition Leader in Parliament.
 
70 MP’s out of 93 who were elected to Parliament from the United People's Freedom Alliance are now sitting in the Opposition.
 
The Joint Opposition MPs are of the view under such circumstances, it not ethical for the Tamil National Alliance to hold the post of Opposition Leader as they have only 16 members in the House.

heading: MSD firearm reported missing
description:
A service weapon of a Ministerial Security Division member has gone missing.
 
Police said when the Sri Lanka Freedom Party parliamentarians came out of the parliament last afternoon (May 08), the MSD member was with him and his service weapon was found to be missing.
 
The Police Media Division said that an investigation has been launched into the matter.

heading: Rideegama deaths : "Murder-suicide" suspected, 3 children orphaned
description:
The bodies of a husband and his wife were found from a house in Rideegama, Kurunegala yesterday (May 08).
 
Investigations revealed that the husband had first killed the wife by strangulating her, before committing suicide by hanging.
 
Police said the couple, who had a 10-year-old son and 4-year-old twin girls, were reportedly quarrelling with each other due to family issues, constantly.
 
At the time of the incident, the son was at the house while the 2 daughters were with their grandmother.
 
The incident had occurred on the night of 7th and the deceased woman was 29-year-old Dinusha Manohari.
 
The husband was aged 34, named Anil Kulatunga.
 
The father of the woman said that the son-in-law contacted them at around 8 pm and informed him that his daughter has committed suicide by hanging inside the house.
 
He told police when he rushed to that house he saw the son-in-law had committed suicide by hanging on an avocado tree, opposite the house, using a wire.
 
The Magisterial Inquiry was conducted by the Rambadagalla Acting Magistrate and he had ordered postmortems to be conducted at the Kurunegala Teaching Hospital.

heading: "Group of 16" says correct protocol followed
description:
MP Chandima Weerakkody says that the 16 Sri Lanka Freedom Party parliamentarians including himself, who recently resigned from the government, took their seats in the opposition yesterday (May 08) according to the correct protocol.
 
He said this responding to a query posed by Hiru News.
 
However, Minister Vijith Vijayamuni Soya expressing his views to the media yesterday in Parliament said that the 16 MPs sat with the opposition prior to the ceremonial mace being placed in the parliamentary chamber.

heading: Gold smuggling attempt foiled (Photos)
description:
Police Narcotic Bureau unit at the Bandaranaike International Airport has apprehended 431.85g of gold worth Rs. 2.6 million in the possession of a Sri Lankan woman arrived from Dubai.
 
The woman aged 40 from Kuliyapitiya was arrested last midnight (May 08).
 
The Jewelleries were hidden inside her baggage.

heading: UNP politburo to discuss more changes
description:
The politburo of the United National Party is scheduled to meet this afternoon (May 09) at the parliamentary complex.
 
The meeting will be held at 3.30 pm.
 
Its member Deputy Minister J. C. Alawathuwala said party constitution and other restructuring activities are on the agenda.

heading: SLHRC begins probe on Kandy riots
description:
The Sri Lanka Human Rights Commission will start their probe into the recent riots in Kandy from today (May 09).
 
The SLHRC said that relevant details will be collected for 3 days.
 
The officials will visit the riot-hit areas to meet the victims and other affected parties to gather details.
 
The SLHRC said by 21st of April they completed gathering information and views from the parties who were interested in this probe.

heading: Motorcyclist collided with train at unprotected crossing
description:
A 46-year-old person was killed when his motorcycle collided with a train at an unprotected railway crossing in Gamini Mawatha, Ragama last evening (May 08).
 
The train was plying from Colombo Fort to Mahawa.
 
The injured person was admitted to Ragama Hospital but he succumbed to his injuries at the hospital.
 
The deceased was a resident of Negombo.
 
The postmortem inquiry will be held today (May 09).

heading: Talks fail, train strike launched
description:
The Railway Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union says they have decided to launch their planned strike from this afternoon (May 09).
 
The union said the decision was taken after the authorities failed to resolve their problems.

heading: Protestors block Ratnapura - Kalawana road
description:
A group of parents staged a demonstration this morning demanding the authorities to assign enough teachers to Kalawana Tamil School in Ratnapura.
 
Our correspondent said that the protesting parents blocked the Ratnapura - Kalawana road from the Dedurukanda area.

heading: Rs. 20mn bribe – suspects remanded, complainant being threatened
description:
President’s former Chief of Staff Dr.  I. K. Mahanama and the former Chairman of Timber Corporation P. Dissanayake have been further remanded until 22
 of May after being produced before Colombo Additional Magistrate Buddhika Sri Ragala this morning (May 09).
The two suspects were arrested for allegedly accepting Rs. 20 million as a bribe from an Indian investor.
The Bribery Commission informed the court that the Presidential Secretariat and the State Timber Corporation have not yet sent them the necessary documents to assist with the ongoing investigation.
As a result, the commission requested additional time to complete the investigations.
The Bribery Commission also informed the court that the complainant has been threatened.
The commission informed the court that an individual who introduced himself as a member of the LTTE Intelligence Unit visited the office of the complainant on Rosemead Place.
The visitor had requested details from the office promising to help the complainant, it was revealed.
The accused public servants Mahanama and Dissanayake had demanded a bribe of Rs. 540 million from the Indian investor in return for assisting the investor to acquire shares of Kantale Sugar Company.
Bribery sleuths arrested the suspects while the bribe was being handed over in a hotel car park in Colombo on 3
 of May.
President’s ex-Chief of Staff, Dr. Mahanama had functioned as the Secretary to the Ministry of Land before being appointed to the new post.
Kantale Sugar Company came under the purview of the then Ministry of Land.
Meanwhile, Nalin Gunawardane, the son of former Minister late M. K. A. D. S.  Gunawardena said that Dr. Mahanama has made false allegations against his late father in connection with this bribery incident.
The SLFP Chief Organizer for Seruwila electorate, Nalin Gunawardana revealed this at a media conference held in Colombo today (May 09).

heading: Train strike called off
description:
The Trade Union Collective says they have decided to call off their strike after Cabinet had agreed to solve their salary issues.
Earlier, they announced that they would strike from 12 noon today (May 09).

heading: Rs. 10mn loss in fire at warehouse of BIA duty-free shop
description:
Police say that initial estimates show that the electronic appliance worth around Rs. 10 million were destroyed in the fire that broke out in a warehouse facility of a duty-free shop at the Bandaranaike International Airport.
 
The fire broke out at around 4 am today (May 09).
 
The fire brigade units of the airport and Air Force were called in to douse the blaze.
 
The reason for the fire is yet to be determined.

heading: No water rate hike this year, NWSDB
description:
The National Water Supply and Drainage Board says that although there's a need to increase the water rates, it will not be implemented this year.
 
The board Chairman, K. A. Anzar revealed that production costs have dramatically increased although water rates have not been increased in the last five years.
 
The Chairman added that 1000 litres of water is sold to consumers at 12 rupees even though the actual cost for the volume is 48 rupees.

heading: 10-hour water cut in Kolonnawa
description: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board says a 10-hour water cut will be enforced from 2 pm tomorrow in Kollonnawa, Meetotamulla, Sedawatta and Wellampitiya.

heading: New session of 8th Parliament commences today
description:
The new session of the 8th Parliament will commence at 2.15 this afternoon, under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
 
The Deputy Secretary General of the Parliament Neil Iddawela said that all necessary arrangements have been in place in this regard.
 
The President will be welcomed by the Speaker and Prime Minister and will be escorted to the chamber.
 
The mace bearer is to enter the chamber with the ceremonial mace and after its customary placement, the new parliamentary session is to commence with the Secretary-General presenting the prorogation.
 
Following these proceedings, President Sirisena will make the policy statement of the government.
 
According to British customs, the queen is to deliver a speech upon recommencement of Parliament following adjournment.
 
This is known as the throne speech.
 
However, according to the 1978 constitution, there is no mention of a throne speech.
 
However, with the commencement of a session, the leader of the state is vested with the right to deliver a policy statement.
 
A vote can also be called for.
 
However, it was decided at the party leaders meeting recently, that an adjourning debate will be held on Thursday, with regard to the President’s speech.
 
Accordingly, constitutional experts note that holding a vote isn’t possible under these circumstances.

heading: Party's survival not reliant on personalities, UNP Natl. Organizer says
description:
The National Organizer of the United National Party Minister Navin Dissanayake says the survival of the UNP does not rely on personalities.
 
He said this responding to journalists following an event in Colombo yesterday (May 07).

heading: Afternoon thundershowers predicted
description:
The Met Department says there’s a possibility for afternoon thundershowers over the island.
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western and Southern provinces and showers or thundershowers will occur elsewhere after 2 pm.
Showers will occur in Puttalam and Mannar districts during the morning too.
Fairly heavy falls, about 75 mm can be expected at some places, particularly in Western, Central, Sabaragamuwa, Uva and Eastern provinces and in Galle, Matara and Puttalam districts.
The Met Department also said showers or thundershowers will occur at times in the sea area off the coast extending from Puttalam to Hambantota via Colombo and Galle.
Showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in the other sea areas around the island.
 
Temporarily very strong gusty winds (up to 70-80 kmph) and rough seas can be expected during thundershowers.

heading: A woman dies in Mawanella under mysterious circumstances
description:
Police found the body of a woman who had died under mysterious circumstances in the Mawanella town.
 
The area residents had alerted the police of the death.
 
The 65-year-old victim was identified as Tamara Damayanthi, a resident of Mawanella.
 
The postmortem inquiry will be held today (May 08).

heading: Attempt by 2 women to smuggle gold foiled (Photos)
description:
Sri Lanka Customs Unit at the Bandaranaike International Airport has apprehended 2 Sri Lankan women who had attempted to smuggle in 1.1kg of gold from Singapore.
 
The estimated value of the detected gold was Rs. 10 million.
 
The arrested women were residents of Jaffna.

heading: IP Neomal and Emil Ranjan further remanded
Discussions fail, locomotive operators to strike from midnight
description:
Railway Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union says they will commence an indefinite strike at midnight today as planned.
 
The union had taken the decision after discussions with the authorities had failed.
 
The locomotive operators say that the authorities are reluctant to solve their pending salary issue and thus they decided to move ahead with the planned strike.

heading: Brothel raided in Walasmulla (Photos)
description:
Four persons including 3 women were apprehended by Tangalle Division Crime Prevention Unit today (08) after raiding a brothel in Walasmulla.
 
It was operated in the guise of a guest house.
 
The male suspect, aged 55, was arrested for operating the place while the women aged 25, 26 and 41 were residents of Tangalle, Kalawana and Padiyathalawa.
 
The raid was carried out following a tip-off and the police said that the suspects will be produced before courts.

heading: Motor-cycle group attacks 2 youths
description:
A group of persons who had arrived on motorcycles had attacked 2 youths with sharp objects in Nirveli, Jaffna.
 
The attack took place yesterday (May 07).
 
The injured youths aged 21 and 23, were first admitted to Kopay hospital.
 
Later they were transferred to Jaffna Teaching Hospital as their condition was serious.
 
The 7 attackers wearing face masks had arrived on 3 motorcycles.
 
It was reporters one of the attackers had earlier an argument with the youths.
 
Thereafter, he had come and attacked the youths with six others.

heading: Unemployed graduates stage protest in Colombo Fort
description: Police say that the Galle Face entry road has been closed from Lotus roundabout in Fort, Colombo, due to a protest march by unemployed graduates.

heading: CEB engineers launch work-to-rule campaign
description:
The CEB Engineers' Union says they will launch a work-to-rule campaign from this afternoon (May 08).
 
The union is urging the Public Utilities Commission to approve the Long-term Power Generation Plan submitted by the Ceylon Electricity Board.
 
They said they decided to take a union action, as the approval has been continued to be delayed.
 
Meanwhile, Lanka Viduli Sevaka Sangamaya said they will also support the work-to-rule campaign of the CEB engineers.
 
Its General Secretary Ranjan Jayalal said they have not yet discussed the matter with them.
 
Meanwhile, the Lanka Petroleum Private Bowser Owners' Union said that they would withdraw from the services if a pricing formula is not introduced within 2 weeks.
 
The Joint Secretary of the union, Shantha Silva told us that they will discuss the matter with Minister Arjuna Ranatunga this evening.

heading: SLFP's "Group of 16" to sit in Opposition before President’s statement
description:
The 16 Sri Lanka Freedom Party parliamentarians who resigned from the Unity Government have decided to sit with the Opposition before the President delivers his policy statement in Parliament today (May 08).
 
The proceedings in Parliament will commence at 2.15 pm.
 
The Parliament's Deputy Secretary-General Neil Iddawela said that seating arrangements for the 16 SLFP MPs have been made.
 
The group paid a courtesy call on the chief prelate of the Amarapura chapter, Aggamaha Panditha, Most Venerable Kotugoda Dhammawasa Thera today.
 
They visited the Dharmapalarama Temple in Mt. Lavinia this morning to brief the chief prelate of their future course of actions.

heading: Husband & wife commit suicide
description:
Police have found the bodies of a husband and his wife who had committed suicide by hanging at a house in Kiribathgalle in Rideegama in Kurunegala.
 
They were aged 34 and 29.
 
Police investigations are underway to ascertain the reason behind the suicide.

heading: Golden Peacock Medal : More details of suspects revealed
description:
Police say 3 of the 6 suspects who were arrested for the theft of Golden Peacock medal of late Dr. Lester James Peries, are registered criminals.
 
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said this addressing the media in Colombo today (May 08).
 
Police arrested 6 suspects after analyzing CCTV footage collected from houses close to the home of Dr. Peries.
 
The suspects had stolen a mobile phone and the medal while the funeral process was taking place at Dr. Peries' home.

heading: Parliament to be inaugurated in a short while
description:
All arrangements are now in place to inaugurate the second session of 8th Parliament.
 
The new session will be inaugurated under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at 2.15 pm.
 
Deputy Secretary-General Neil Iddawela said that all necessary measures have been taken in this regard.
 
The President will be welcomed by the Speaker, and the Prime Minister and will be escorted to the chamber.
 
At the beginning of the session, President Sirisena is scheduled to present the government’s policy statement to the House.

heading: President  & PM arrive in Parliament
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Speaker Karu Jayasuriya have arrived in Parliament to inaugurate the second session of 8th Parliament.
 
The session is scheduled to open at 2.15 pm.

heading: SLFP's "Group of 16" sit in Opposition
description:
The 16 Sri Lanka Freedom Party parliamentarians who resigned from the Unity Government sat with the Opposition.
They had sat with the Opposition before the President commenced his policy statement.
The proceedings in Parliament commenced at 2.15 pm.

heading: May Day rallies : SLFP goes to Batticaloa, MR leads SLPP meeting in Galle
description:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party will hold their May Day Rally today (May 07) under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
The rally will be held at Chenkaladi in Batticaloa.
Sri Lanka Podu Jana Peramuna will hold their May Day Rally under the patronage of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at Samanala Grounds in Galle.
The march will commence at 1 pm from the Mahamodara area.
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna will hold their rally at Colombo BRC Grounds under the patronage of their leader Anura Kumara Dissanayaka.

heading: President says Buddhist society should be strengthened
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena says it is important to strengthen the Buddhist society in order to find a solution for the issues prevailing in various fields.
The President said this addressing an event at Sirivijayaba Pirivena in Polonnaruwa yesterday (May 06).

heading: Ganesan seeks clarity on new MoU
description:
The leader of the Democratic People's Front, Minister Mano Ganesan says that before signing a fresh MoU for the remaining period of the Unity Government, it should be discussed with the other affiliated parties.
Earlier, the Sri Lanka Freedom Party said that a fresh MoU will be signed with the United National Front in order to continue the Unity Government.
Minister Ganesan expressed views addressing a May Day Rally organized by the DPF in Colombo yesterday (May 06).

heading: Met Office predicts afternoon showers
description:
The Met Department says that the possibility for afternoon thundershowers is still high over the island.
Showers or thundershowers will occur in the most parts of the island after 2 pm.
Showers will occur in the Southern and Western provinces and Puttalam and Mannar districts during the morning too.
 
Heavy falls, about 100 mm can be expected at some places, particularly in Central, Sabaragamuwa, Uva, North-central and Eastern provinces and in Galle, Matara and Kalutara district.
 
Misty conditions can be expected at some places in the Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces during the morning.
 
There may be temporary localized strong winds during thundershowers.
The general public is requested to take adequate precautions to minimize damages caused by lightning activity.

heading: Suspect arrested with a pistol
description:
Police have arrested a 19-year-old youth in Mount Lavinia with a pistol and 5 ammunition.
The pistol was of foreign made.
The suspect, a resident of Angulana, Moratuwa was arrested yesterday (May 06) following a tip-off by the Kalutara Crime Prevention Unit.
The suspect will be produced before Panadura Magistrate today.

heading: 69 kilos of Kerala cannabis detected in Vavuniya
description:
69.7 kilos of Kerala cannabis was detected from a house in Pandrikkethakulam in Omanthai during a raid carried out by the Vavuniya Anti-narcotic Unit last morning (May 06).
The raid was carried out at around 9 am and police found 33 parcels of narcotic.
The suspects, aged 23, 24 and 28 are residents of Vavuniya, Jaffna and Mullaithivu.
They will be produced before Vavuniya Magistrate Court today.

heading: Father of two dies in wild elephant attack
description:
A father of 2 was killed in a wild elephant attack in Diyabeduma in Minneriya at around 7 am today (May 07).
The victim was aged 59 and he was attacked while he was in his garden.
The area residents say that wild elephants are encroaching human habitats these days in the wake of harvesting.

heading: UPFA Gen. Sec. stresses MS will be SLFP Presidential candidate
description:
The General Secretary of the United People's Freedom Alliance Minister Mahinda Amaraweera says President Maithripala will be the Sri Lanka Freedom Party's Presidential candidate for 2020.
He told this expressing views to the media following a meeting with the party supporters in Moneragala yesterday (May 06).
He also said that the Ministers who resigned from the government might not attend SLFP's May Day rally to be held in Batticaloa this afternoon.
It will be held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
Meanwhile, W. D. J. Seneviratne, S.B. Dissanayake and Dayasiri Jayasekera who resigned from the Unity Government recently confirmed that they will participate in the SLFP May Day rally.
However, former Ministers, Chandima Weerakkody, Lakshman Yapa Abeywardana and former Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala did not respond.
The Joint Opposition led by Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna will hold its May Day rally at Samanala Grounds in Galle.
MP Mahindananda Aluthgamage said that the rally will be launched under the patronage of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at 3 pm.

heading: Dilum Amunugama summoned to Terrorist Investigation Division
description:
Joint Opposition MP, Dilum Amunugama has been summoned to the Terrorism Investigation Division to record a statement.
He had initially been asked to give a statement on 10th of May in connection with the recent Kandy riots.
However, MP Amunugama told us that he would ask for an alternative date as he is required to attend Parliament on 10th of May.
353 suspects were arrested in connection with the Kandy riots by police.
220 of those individuals were later released on bail.
However, the leader of Mahason Balakaaya, Amith Weerasinghe along with 131 other suspects are still being held in remand custody.

heading: Train strike from midnight tomorrow
description:
The Locomotive Engineering Operators' Union (LEOU) says they will launch a strike from midnight tomorrow.
Its Secretary Indika Dodamgoda said they have decided to go ahead with the strike as the authorities are not taking steps to resolve their salary anomalies.

heading: CEB engineers too launch a strike
description:
The engineers of the Ceylon Electricity Board are launching a work-to-rule campaign from tomorrow (May 08).
The President of the Union, Saumya Kumarawadu said there's a possibility of stalling the operations of power stations.

heading: Six persons remanded over stealing 'Ranamayura Medal'
description:
The 6 persons who were arrested for the theft of the Golden Peacock Medal and a mobile phone from the house of late Dr. Lester James Peries have been remanded until 21st of this month.
They were produced before Colombo Additional Magistrate Daminda Weligodapitiya.
The Magistrate also ordered to have an identification parade to identify 2 of the suspects.
Earlier, police arrested the suspects connected to the theft after analysing the video footage.
Five of them are accused of keeping the stolen goods while another was accused of stealing them.
Police said that the suspects had arrived at the residence of late Dr. Peries in a bus and a three-wheeler.
Addressing a media conference in Colombo this morning, Police Media spokesperson SP, Ruwan Gunasekera said the medal had been stolen from his residence, whilst on display next to the mortal remains of late Dr Peries.
Bambalapitiya police launched the probe after the missing medal was found abandoned on a passenger bus plying from Colpetty to Kaduwela.
Police have tracked the suspects using the registration number of the three-wheeler.
Accordingly, police arrested the father of the female owner of the three-wheeler along with 3 others.
They were aged 47 and 65, residents of Gampola.
They have sold the stolen mobile phone for Rs. 4,000 to a repair shop in Navalapitiya.
The officers of the Bambalapitiya Police this morning arrested the owner of that shop too.
The Police spokesperson went on to say that the suspects were found to be part of an organized group that is known for stealing property from celebrities and such funeral houses in Colombo and its suburbs.

heading: Upcountry Tamil parties clash on May Day, Thalawakele tense (Photos)
description:
Police say a tense situation was prevailing at the Thalawakele town this afternoon.
It arose when the supporters of Ceylon Workers' Congress were confronted by the supporters of the Tamil Progressive Alliance at the Thalawakele town.
Our correspondent said riot police was called in to control the situation.
The May Day rally of the TPA was held in Thalawakele and the supporters had attempted to attack the buses transporting CWC supporters to their rally in Nuwara Eliya.

heading: President says he will not retire after 2020
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena says he will not retire by 2020 as he has to fulfil a lot more responsibilities.
He said this while addressing the May Day rally organized by the Sri Lanka Freedom Party at Mawediwembu in Chenkalady, Batticaloa today (May 07).
Only a few out of the 16 former SLFP Ministers who resigned from the government recently were present at the rally.
Except, MP. S. B. Dissanayake others - Dayasiri Jayasekera, Dilan Perera, and Thilanga Sumathipala were not seated on the stage.
They waited at the entrance of the sports ground.
However, other members of the group, Chandima Weerakkody, Lakshman Yapa Abeywardana, W. D. J. Senevirathna, Anura Priyadarshana Yapa, Susil Premajayantha, Susantha Punchinilame, Anuradha Jayarathna, Taranath Basnayake, T.B. Ekanayake, Sudarshani Fernandopulle and Sumeda J Jayasena were absent.

heading: 12-year-old boy dies in road accident (CCTV footage) - (Sensitive footage)
description:
A 12-year-old boy was knocked down by a speeding van at Naagawila on the Puttalam - Colombo main road this evening (May 07).
He collided with a van when he was coming out from a shop with his sister.
The van had fled after hitting the boy. But it was apprehended in the Puttalam area.

heading: Train services and power supply to be affected ?
description:
The Locomotive operators say they will launch a strike from midnight today (May 08).
They said that the union decided to stop work as the authorities have failed to address their salary issue.
Meanwhile, the CEB engineers are planning to start a work-to-rule campaign from this afternoon.
The union said there's a possibility of electricity breakdowns as a result.

heading: May Day rallies : JVP seeks social justice
description:
The May Day rally of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna was held at the BRC grounds in Colombo this afternoon.
It was held under the theme of social justice, national unity and people’s friendly governance.
Meanwhile, several other political parties held their May Day rallies in Colombo.
The May Day rally of the Jathika Hela Urumaya was held at the New Town Hall, Colombo.

heading: SLPP makes series of pledges
description:
The Mayday rally organized by the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna led by the Joint Opposition began under the patronage of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at the Samanala Grounds in Galle this afternoon.
"Join forces against tax burden, selling off national resources and Central Bank bond scam" was the theme of the rally.
The former President Rajapaksa joined the rally at 5 pm.
The retrieval of plundered money from the bond scam and EPF and cancelling of Free Trade Agreements with India and Singapore were among the pledges made during the rally.

heading: Met Department issues heat weather advisory
description:
Met Department this afternoon (May 05) issued a heat weather advisory for the Northern, Eastern and North-Central provinces.
It said that that the caution level is expected in Northern, Eastern and North-central provinces and in some parts of Kurunegala, Gampaha, Matale and Badulla districts tomorrow.

heading: Three more arrested over Kandy incidents
description:
The Terrorism Investigation Department has arrested 3 more suspects from Pujapitiya, Ambatenna, Kahawatta areas in connection with the recent violence in Kandy.
They are accused of attacking a place of worship on 7th of March in Welekade at Ambetenna in Pujapitiya.
The arrests were made this morning (May 05).
The suspects aged 55, 22 and 21 will be handed over to Pujapitiya Police for further investigations.

heading: Anuruddha Polgampola new chairman at STC
description:
Anuruddha Polgampola has been appointed by President Maithripala Sirisena as the new chairman at the State Timber Corporation.
 
He obtained his appointment letter from President last afternoon (May 04).
 
P. Dissanayake who served as the chairman of STC is in remand custody right now over a bribery case.

heading: Bus driver ends Tinuli’s bright future
description:
A 9-year-old girl who was crossing the road on a zebra-crossing with her grandmother was run over by a passenger bus in the Kegalle town this morning (May 05).
The little girl was on her way to a tuition class.
 
She was admitted to Kegalle Hospital with a critical condition and died at around 9.45 am.
 
The grandmother had sustained minor injuries.
 
The victim was 9-year-old, Tinuli Pasandya Bandara, was a grade 3 student at Kegalle Convent.
 
Police have arrested the bus driver and he will be produced before Magistrate today.

heading: President says 'no mercy' on bribery and corruption
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that legal action will be taken in an unbiased manner against anyone found to be guilty of bribery, corruption, fraud, theft, wastage and misappropriation of state resources.
The President made these comments addressing the International Family Health Services Day celebrations held in Polonnaruwa today (May 05).
The President further noted that a government free of corruption is vital for a better society.

heading: Underworld figure Dileepa killed in shootout with STF
Several backbenchers to skip UNP's May Day rally
description:
The United National Party will stage its May Day rally at the Sugathadasa Indoor Stadium in Colombo today (May 06).
 
It will be held under the patronage of the UNP leader Ranil Wickremesinghe.
 
However, it was reported that several backbenchers of the party are skipping the rally.
 
State Minister Range Bandara said that he's sick and he would attend the rally only if is recovered during the day.
 
Meanwhile, Badulla district MP Chaminda Wijesiri said that he's critically ill and will not be able to attend it.
 
Matale District MP Ranjith Aluvihare said due to the issues in the party he won't attend today rally.
 
Meanwhile, UNP General Secretary Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam yesterday visited the Sugathadasa Indoor Stadium for an inspection visit to check the arrangements.

heading: Legal action against officials for destroying Wijithapura archaeological site
description:
The Archaeological Department says that legal action will be taken against state officials and contractors who are responsible for destroying an archaeological site in Wijithapura, Anuradhapura for a housing project.
 
Director General of the Department Professor P. B. Mandawala said that steps will be taken to recover expenses for restoring the site to its original condition from the relevant institutions.
 
It is reported that this area had been used by King Elara’s soldiers to carry out intelligence gathering during the war with King Dutugamunu.
 
Artefacts in the area were destroyed when the area was cleared by the Housing Development Authority to build a new village.
 
The Ipalogama Divisional Secretary accepted the damage caused but said that the land was released while being unaware of its historical importance.

heading: Malaysia intercepts vessel cramped with 131 illegal Sri Lankan migrants
description:
Malaysian police have intercepted a tanker with 131 Sri Lankans believed bound for Australia and New Zealand, destroying an alleged human smuggling ring that has been operating for over a year.
 
Authorities halted the modified tanker on Tuesday off the coast of southern Johor state, national police chief Mohamad Fuzi Harun said. He said the immigrants included 98 men, 24 women, four boys and five girls.
 
Police also raided a fishing boat used to transport the migrants to the vessel and detained three Indonesians and four Malaysians on board, he said. Another five Malaysians were nabbed for suspected involvement in the smuggling syndicate.
 
“This syndicate has been operating since mid-2017 and has international connections across Sri Lanka, Australia, New Zealand, Indonesia and Malaysia,” Fuzi said.
 
A total of 127 Sri Lankans will be charged for entering Malaysia illegally while nine Malaysians, four Indonesians and four Sri Lankans will be investigated for human smuggling, he added.

heading: Afternoon showers predicted
description:
The possibility for afternoon thundershowers is still high over the island, Met Department says.
 
Showers or thundershowers will occur at several palaces in the most parts of the island after 2 pm.
 
Showers will occur in the Southern province during the morning too.
 
Heavy falls, about 100 mm can be expected at some places in Central, Sabaragamuwa and North-central provinces and in Badulla, Kaluthara and Vavuniya districts.
 
Misty conditions can be expected at some places in the Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces during the morning.
 
There may be temporary localized strong winds during thundershowers.
 
The general public is requested to take adequate precautions to minimize damages caused by lightning activity.

heading: Earth slip kills youth in Nawalapitiya (Photos)
description:
A youth was killed last night (May 05) when an earth mound collapsed on a house.
 
The 20-year-old victim was a resident of Gonawalapathana, Nawalapitiya.
 
At around 8. 30 last night a huge earth mound had collapsed on the living room of the house.
 
Police said a tree was also fallen on the house.
 
The area residents had managed to rescue the youth and his brother, but the youth had died while they were taken to the hospital.

heading: Mixed power generation plan before Cabinet
description:
The mixed power generation plan to meet the Ceylon Electricity Board's long-term power generation requirements will be submitted to the Cabinet next week, sources say.
 
It includes coal power plants as well.
 
A high-level discussion with the participation of the President Maithripala Sirisena, Ministers Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, Dr. Sarath Amunugama, heads of Public Utilities Commission, CEB union representatives and officials was held to discuss it.
 
It was decided at this meeting to activate a mixed power generation plan.
 
The Secretary to President Austin Fernando has submitted it to the PUCSL for approval.
 
Earlier, there was a disagreement between the PUCSL and CEB engineers over the plan, as the PUCSL did not agree with having coal plans in the mix.
 
We contacted CEB Engineers' Union to get their views on this.
 
Its President Engineer Saumya Kumarawadu said if the PUCSL continue to delay the power generation plan, they will launch a strike from Tuesday (May 08).

heading: Joint Opposition says disagreement between IMF & government growing
description:
The Joint Opposition says the disagreement between the government and International Monetary Fund is growing.
