Police said that the murder had been committed last afternoon (May 27) following a heated argument between two persons.
The deceased was a resident in Radawana and the suspect had fled the area following the murder.
The postmortem will be held today (May 28).

heading: 20 A to be submitted to Parliament
description:
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna says that the 20th amendment to the constitution will be presented in Parliament today (May 25).
 
The amendment proposes the abolition of the Executive Presidency.
 
The JVP leader MP Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that it would be submitted to the Parliamentary Secretary General as a private motion.

heading: Three Jaffna fishermen reported missing at sea
The water level of Attanagalu and Maa Oya increasing, over 138 thousand affected
Viral fever snaps lives of 11 children in Matara
description:
Karapitiya Teaching Hospital Director Dr. Jayampati Senanayake says that the 11 children have passed away as a result of the Influenza and Adino virus that is spreading in the South.
These deaths reportedly took place between 1st of May 1st and yesterday.
Director Senanayake revealed that 11 children were from the Matara District.
He added said that in the last two days, two small children had died due to the viral fever.

heading: 12-year-old boy abused at Welioya police station
description:
The court has ordered to arrest the police personnel who are suspected of being connected to committing, assisting and abetting the abuse of the 12-year-old boy at Welioya Police station whilst in police custody.
The relevant court case was taken up at the Kebetigollawa Magistrate court yesterday (May 28).
On this occasion, Magistrate Manoj Prabhakaran issued this order to ASP of the Mullaitivu District.
The Magistrate has also ordered that if on the occasion that those responsible are not identified, all police personnel at the Welioya police station, should be produced for an identification parade.
The Kebetigollawa Magistrate informed at court that if the suspects were not arrested and produced before the court, it would become necessary to take up the complaint in court.
The child was arrested by Welioya Police on 8th of this month over a theft of corrugated sheets.
Then the child was detained at the Welioya Police, and the child had complained that he was abused by an on-duty policeman inside the police premises.

heading: Joint Opposition leaders to discuss 20th Amendment
description:
The leaders of the Joint Opposition will meet with the former President, Mahinda Rajapaksa this evening (May 30) at the former President's official residence in Colombo.
 
The convener of the Joint Opposition MP Prasanna Ranatunga said that the current political situation, including the 20th amendment to the constitution, will be discussed in detail.
 
Meanwhile, the Sri Lanka Freedom Party's Central Committee is scheduled to meet on Sunday.
 
It is reported that the final decision on the new office bearers of the party will be taken during this meeting.

heading: President directs speedy action to contain viral flu in South
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena has advised health officials to take necessary action to treat patients and prevent the spread of viral disease in the South without making financial provisions an issue.
 
The President had made a visit to the Ministry of Health yesterday (May 28) to discuss the issues in relating to the spread of the viral fever in the south.
 
The President had further noted that if there is a shortage of equipment and medicine, it should be provided based on the need, disregarding the tender procedures.
 
The Director of Karapitiya Teaching Hospital, Dr. Jayampathi Senanayake revealed that 11 children had died of the viral disease this month at the KTH, and most of them were from Matara.

heading: Canned fish 'unfit' for consumption, imported
description:
Health authorities say a stock of canned fish which are unfit for human consumption has been imported.
 
They accuse that certain companies are trying to get them cleared.

heading: 12-hour water cut in Kelaniya & Wattala
description:
National Water Supply and Drainage Board says that a 12-hour water cut will be effective from 7 pm tomorrow several areas of Gampaha district.
 
The areas are: Kelaniya, Peliyagoda, Wattala, Ja-Ela, Biyagama, Dompe, Gampaha, Katunayaka, Seeduwa and Mahara.

heading: President says the wrong use of social media could no longer be allowed
Tree falls on Badulla - Colombo bus
description:
A 24-year-old youth was killed and another passenger was injured when a tree fell on a Badulla - Colombo bus.
The incident had happened in Galkanda on the Haputale - Diyathalawa road.

heading: Hearing on bail application of Aloysius postponed
description:
The Attorney General's Department informed the Court of Appeal today (Jun 01) that the owner of Perpetual Treasuries Arjun Aloysius and it's CEO Kasun Palisena have not submitted special facts to the court.
 
It was disclosed when the bail application was considered before the president of Court of Appeal Preethi Padman Surasena and Shiran Gooneratne.
 
Making submissions on behalf of the AG, Additional Solicitor General Yasantha Kodagoda said that Colombo Fort Magistrate Court and Colombo High Court have already rejected bail to them.
 
The case will be taken up again on 11th of this month.

heading: Road accident kills motorcyclist in Moragahahena
description:
A 30-year-old motorcyclist was killed in an accident involving a tipper at Weediyagoda in Moragahahena this morning (Jun 01).
 
The deceased was an area resident.
 
Although the tipper driver took the victim to Bandaragama Hospital, he was already passed away when he was taken to the hospital.

heading: Railway Technical Services’ strike continues
description:
The Railway Main Control Room says that the office trains were operated as usual despite the ongoing strike action by the Railway Technical Services’ Union.
However, it announced that there might be delayed as a result of the strike. 
 
They commence a 48-hour token strike at 4 pm yesterday (May 29) over three demands, including a 12.1 percent salary increase be implemented.
 
Meanwhile, the Sri Lanka Railways announced that casual, temporary and contractual employees of the Railway Technical Service should report for work immediately
 
However, the trade unions that are engaged in the strike said that if the authorities take action to suppress the trade unions, they would take action to continue the token strike.
 
Railways General Manager, S. M. Abeywickrema also requested that the employees end the strike and report for work.
 
However, the President of the Railway Technical Services’ Trade Union Committee, Sampath Rajitha said that the strike would be in force till 4 pm tomorrow.

heading: President talks about past 3 years
description:
President Maithripala Sirisena says many things that are required for the nation's future have been achieved during the past 3 years.
 
He said some don't see it.
 
He said this during a ceremony to present 12,000 land deeds for settlers of Mahaweli “B” and “C” Rambakan Oya zones, held today (Jun 01).
 
Under this initiative, one hundred thousand land deeds will be handed over to Mahaweli settlers.

heading: A minister finds the dream of the Group-16
Colombo 7 millionaire arrested for electricity piracy
description:
Maligakanda Magistrate has ordered a wealthy resident of Colombo 7 to pay a fine of Rs. 606,487 for electricity theft.
 
He had done so by manipulating the electricity meter.
 
It was found that the suspect had carried out the fraud for a long time, causing losses to the CEB.
 
The Maligakanda Magistrate also imposed a fine of Rs. 10,000 on the suspect.

heading: Mastan’s Deputy Ministerial portfolio likely to be changed !
description:
Internal government sources say that the Deputy Ministerial post offered to the Sri Lanka Freedom Party MP Kader Mastan yesterday is likely to be changed.
 
He was appointed the Deputy Minister of Resettlement, Rehabilitation, Northern Development and Hindu Religious Affairs.
 
However, many have raised objections against the appointment.
 
When we contacted Minister Mano Ganeshan, he confirmed that the matter was discussed with the President and that a suitable change may be made after reviewing the objections.
 
Meanwhile, councilor M. K. Sivajilingam said at the Northern Provincial Council session that he did not agree with the appointment.
 
In addition, General Secretary of TELO, P. Udayarasa also voiced his objections to the appointment.
 
 He said MP Mastan’s background does not qualify him to hold such a portfolio.
 
PLOTE leader, Dharmalingam Siddharthan also raised his objections to the appointment.
 
Wanni District MP, Kader Mastan who took oaths yesterday stated that there are Hindu voters amongst his supporters.

heading: Case against Ghanasara Thera postponed
description:
The Court of Appeal postponed a case filed by the Attorney General against Ven. Galagodaatte Ghanasara Thera and 12 others until 23rd of November.
 
The case was taken up before CoA judges, Deepali Wijesundera and Achala Wengappuli.
 
They were earlier released by the Colombo High Court in a case where they were accused of entering a religious place in Thalahena, Thalangama and causing damages to it.
 
Thereafter, the AG filed a case in the Court of Appeal, challenging the decision.

heading: Postal Employees on strike head to Colombo today
The main suspect along with 2 others who shot at Kirivehera Chief Incumbent have been remanded
Main suspect in Kirivehera shooting in Colombo
description:
It has been revealed that the main suspect in the shooting of the chief incumbent of Kataragama Kirivehera, Venerable Kobowaka Dhamminda Thera, is in hiding in Colombo.
The suspect has been identified as Bopegedara Asela Lakshman Bandara who is a former custodian of Mahesen Devala.
A senior officer at the Police Special Task Force stated that the suspect, who had previously been in hiding in several areas, is currently in Colombo.
The senior officer also stated that it will be possible to arrest the suspect soon.
Meanwhile, the chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Venerable Kobowaka Dhamminda Thera continues to receive treatment at a private hospital in Colombo.
Three armed persons carried out the shooting on 12th night where the chief incumbent sustained injuries to the arm and the abdomen.
Another monk who was present at the scene and sustained injuries was admitted to Hambantota General Hospital and was later discharged.

heading: Move to relocate 2 elephants from Sinharaja being criticized
description:
The environmental protection organization, Surakimu Sri Lanka charges that the Minister of Wildlife, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka has decided to have the two elephants, both inhabitants of the world heritage rainforest, Sinharaja, to be moved to the elephant detention center at Horowpathaana.
 
Addressing a media conference in Colombo this morning (Jun 13), National Organizer of Surakimu Sri Lanka, Pahiyangala Ananda Thera disclosed this.
 
When we contacted Wildlife Director General C. Suriyabandara to comment on the matter, he said that the two elephants were creating havoc for residents of the boundary villages of Sinharaja, thus they decided to move the elephants out of the forest.
 
He also said that the two elephants' lives are at risk as they used to encroach the adjourning villages.

heading: One dead after police open fire in Jaffna clash
Public entities incur Rs. 50bn loss
description:
Speaker Karu Jayasuriya says that according to the reports of the Finance Ministry, in 2017, the state entities had caused a loss of over Rs. 50 billion.
 
He said this addressing a seminar organized by the Committee on Public Accounts, for journalists held in Colombo yesterday (Jun 18).
 
The Auditor General Gamini Wijesinghe also attended the event.

heading: Speeding car kills policeman
description:
One police officer was killed and another was injured when a speeding car veered off the road in the Nildiya Uyana area on the Kandy - Jaffna main road, knocked them down.
 
The policemen were on night patrol duty.
 
Two others who were onboard the car were also injured.
 
It is reported that the driver of the car has fallen asleep on the wheel, causing this accident.
 
The victim was a 49-year-old, police sergeant, a resident of Tittawellagoda in Matale.
 
The driver of the car was arrested following the mishap.

heading: "Commemorate war heroes" - Fmr. President requests
description:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa accuses that the present government does not take steps to commemorate the war heroes who protected the country risking their lives.
 
He said this while attending a religious ceremony in Panagoda yesterday (May 16).
 
Here, the former President requested the masses to commemorate the war heroes.
